4154.Author: Rafa
4154.Review: One of the best Single malts around in the price area! Smooth and rich tasting - pleasure to sip !

4154.Author: Al
4154.Review: Appreciative of the crafting that goes into this fine scotch. I find it great on the whole, maybe a little underwhelming on the palate compared to the nose and finish but still a great drinking experience.

4154.Author: Mokeart
4154.Review: If you are or ever were a Royak Marine you will know  what I mean when I say, this malt is Hoofing ,the is no better accolade .

4154.Author: Darren M.
4154.Review: Having read the review's I agree that the addition of just a few drops of water brings the Smokey and Salty notes out and smooths out to a lovely long finish.

4154.Author: Tomasz
4154.Review: The best single malt i ever tried at the price! And there was quite a lot :)

4154.Author: Steve
4154.Review:
Beautifully nice drink, no bitter after taste.
A pleasure to drink from the first drop to the last.

4154.Author: Paul
4154.Review: The initial dry nose is almost a challenge. You aren't sure just how it is going to end up. But boy does it end up nice.

4154.Author: chanwyjk
4154.Review:
One of the best single malt whiskey I have tasted 
Highly recommended!

4154.Author: sid
4154.Review: Great taste,worth it for the price.

4154.Author: Anonymous
4154.Review: Stunning, beautifully smooth with a delightful hint of the sea

4154.Author: Occasional malt drinker
4154.Review: Tried it for the first time last night in Edinburgh absolutely fantastic

4154.Author: Matthew
4154.Review: This is a magnificent whisky. The smoothness, mouthfeel and the saltiness make it a perfect accompaniment to dark chocolate. I f I was to only have one whisky, maybe this is it.

4154.Author: Stein S
4154.Review: Excellent value for money. The best single malt I have found at this price level

4154.Author: Malt maniac
4154.Review: Usually I am a peaty whisky drinker but a recent tour and tasting of the wifes homeland distillery of Arran has made me think more of other whiskies so when I seen this in ALDIS for ?20.99 I had to buy it and I am so glad I did.As soon as you open the bottle and get a nose you instantly know that this is an exceptional whisky and it just gets better upon tasting.Its so fresh and crisp you would think that it was not made by man but rather discovered rolling over the sea cliffs.A true masterclass  in whisky distillation and maturation!

4154.Author: Anonymous
4154.Review: Firstly, in response to Kim (2009), why not the other way round and have the canister be the same shape as the bottle:)?....Anyway - a superb malt, made out of contrasts that somehow merge perfectly: light yet substantial, salty yet sweetish, simple yet elegant, oaky yet refreshing, the heaviness of the sea yet the lightness of the wind etc etc....Wonderful, though once, and only once, I had a subpar bottle, the alcohol was too hot.

4154.Author: Dan Rowley
4154.Review: Lovely smell, great clean, crisp taste.  A lot cheaper than other single malts and even better tasting than many.  I''m a big fan of the Islay whiskies and Talisker-OP stands highly alongside them in my opinion.  The brininess is identifiable, but certainly not off-putting, a nice long finish to a dram too.

4154.Author: Craig Bryant
4154.Review: Superb malt. Simple as that. There is nothing harsh about this dram. Nose surprises every time with orange and a whiff of brine.  If you close your eyes and breathe deeply you almost feel yourself wrapped in north coastal sea air. Palate is butterscotch with a hint of citrus. Finish is long and dry, buttery with a hint of salt. By far and away my favourite sub 14 year old malt.

4154.Author: Anonymous
4154.Review: realy nice and smooth

4154.Author: Johnty B
4154.Review: Needs more cask influence to calm the alcohol that is somewhat detached and sharp on the tongue.Frankly, I am surprised it has a 12 year label as it tastes more like a 6 year old. I take it with ice to calm it down. Its a pity OP can't five it a bit of their 17 year-old magic. I suppose you get what you pay for!

4154.Author: David Abram
4154.Review: Considering that my Grandmother was born & bred in Wick, this was an absolute must for me. My first ever taste of malt (as I usually drink blends) and I must say this is such an easy-drinking one and amazing value for money too!

4154.Author: Ian Wallace
4154.Review:
Deliciously flavoursome - sweet & enjoyable to share with your very best friends ,
Well worth a visit to the distillery too !

4154.Author: Johnny Norfolk
4154.Review: You must add a drop of water to this. It transforms it into one of the best. Underated but I would not hesitate to recomend it. It is very well made.

4154.Author: Anonymous
4154.Review: This single malt stands out on many levels. Great value. Great provenance. Great uniqueness of character. And of course great aroma, taste, texture and finish. What would it be like at 43 or 46%, un-chillfiltered and non-caramelized (E150)..? The mind boggles, as it is already, despite all the branding, a whisky that magically stays true to its provenance and just delivers time after time! And oh, yeah, another of it's great strengths is the consistency, bottle after bottle, year after year...

4154.Author: The Colonel
4154.Review: Bought my first bottle a couple of weeks ago based on decent reviews and when I tried it I was quite disappointed, finding it a bit bland. Now the bottle has been open a week or so and after sampling again I was pleasantly surprised. I still found it light and delicate but it's a distinctive malt and I would love to try the 17yr and 21yr next.

4154.Author: Mike Barber
4154.Review: Big sherry presence? This whisky is matured in ex-bourbon casks. Great dram for the money though. just wish it was given a craft presentation.

4154.Author: Matt
4154.Review: Clean and zingy, very fresh. Some peat but also honey and nuts. I did get a little of the salty brine flavour but certainly not unpleasant, for the money I doubt you could pick up anything as complex as this.

4154.Author: JC
4154.Review: Bought this on a whim as I fancied a change from my usual (Laphroaig QC) so glad I did, this is a brilliant dram for the money with such a unique taste. In this price bracket im yet to try anything that compares.

4154.Author: Mr Wise
4154.Review: Absolute perfection, a fantastic taste with very little lingering after taste. By far the best I have tasted and my favourite.

4154.Author: Anonymous
4154.Review: A fantastic drop. Prefer over others in its class.

4154.Author: Rick.
4154.Review: A lovely malt, & you can definitely taste a bit of the sea in this one. Recommended.

4154.Author: Phil Starkey
4154.Review: Best Malt Ive tried (until the 21 yr old pulteney arrives) very smooth and easy to drink not overly peaty or smokey just a dam good whisky.

4154.Author: Anonymous
4154.Review: Blimey, this is good stuff. Best highland out there for under 25 quid, what more could you ask for? (Apart from a free bottle!)

4154.Author: Michael H.
4154.Review: Wow.....best I've had in a while.  No need for ice or water.  Love it neat.  Will buy again

4154.Author: Jamie H
4154.Review: Not bad, not bad. Above average in it's class. On par with Balvenie Double Wood.

4154.Author: Gordon Reeves
4154.Review: Definite tang of brine when you first stick your nose in the glass.  Well balanced but unremarkable.  Good value for money though at this price!

4154.Author: Pete May  (sassanach)
4154.Review: not being a great fan of whiskeys in general, and scotch in particular, i approached my birthdat present with caution. What a revalation !! At last, a single malt I can drink and enjoy! To my uneducated palate it is pleasantly smooth but challenges the taste buds to a duel of flavours. I'll certainly be buying more when this bottle is empty, (won't be long ), and may even stretch to the 21 yr version!! Bring it on.

4154.Author: Bert
4154.Review: Take a sip, close your eyes and allow yourself to be transported to the north coast of Scotland, where a howling cold wind blows, with sea spray and rain hitting your face, then allow this beautiful Whisky to warm you from head to toe. Love it.

4154.Author: norwegian26
4154.Review: I liked it,but i would like a bit more smoke in hte ending

4154.Author: Craig Bryant
4154.Review: Beautiful, slightly salty and fruity with a gentle finish. A good starting point to explore the world of whisky.

4154.Author: Anonymous
4154.Review: Beautiful. Unpeated, slightly salty with a terrific nose and silky mouth feel. Fruity, complex and delicious.

4154.Author: Anonymous
4154.Review: A great, great malt. Simple as that.

4154.Author: pan-van
4154.Review: This is the best for our family:)

4154.Author: Danny G
4154.Review: Outstanding quality, a unique highlander unlike anything from the region.The best value, loved it.

4154.Author: Jason's Scotch Whisky Reviews
4154.Review: "Nose"Honey, vanilla, and almond notes mingle - this has clearly been aged in both bourbon and sherry casks."Palate": PalateLight bodied. What was honey and almond on the nose turns to sweet malt and marzipan notes on the palate. However, upon transition to mid-palate the salty brine element becomes abundantly clear, marked by a noted tanginess. "Finish": a nutty, slightly honeyed feel, with the oak providing a clean, unobtrusive dryness.

4154.Author: Dr.McGarretty
4154.Review: Lovely dram which integrates the bourbon and sherry notes alongside the sea side / sea spray which transports you up to Wick. Full bodied and smooth with a long finish a class act. Oh yes don't put ice cubes in it!!! Just a drop or more of water if needed.

4154.Author: AJ Smith
4154.Review: Whether new or veteran to single malt, this is a very good whisky. Amazing orange nose slightly diluted, with a cool, refreshing sea spray across the palate, smooth spice, then a nice smoke on the medium finish. You'll want to stock up!

4154.Author: Billy
4154.Review: Definitely try it with a splash of water, otherwise tastes and smells a bit dull. Still very good for the price , love the bottle too.

4154.Author: Anthony
4154.Review: My favourite. Love the salt and citrus flavours. Hope to get an older bottle as I age. Just turned 30 and loving exploring Scotch.

4154.Author: echoset
4154.Review: I'm not a big fan. It reminded me of a speyside..

4154.Author: stewie ramone
4154.Review: got given a bottle for my birthday. very good,would like some more please:)

4154.Author: stewie ramone
4154.Review: lucky enough to get a bottle for my birthday. very nice. hope to have this again.

4154.Author: mighty quaid
4154.Review: this is a brilliant malt. perfect for people just getting into whisky drinking as i think this covers all the bases. highly recommended.

4154.Author: Davepat
4154.Review: Not the Manzanilla of the north it was once (Michael Jackson), but still one of the best examples of a coastal whisky. Lovely and smooth, a little salt and sea air, I too drink it strait.

4154.Author: Brandon
4154.Review: very fine and exceptionally smooth malt.  A good starting point along with the Glenlivet 12 for beginners, as the flavours are easily discernible, with a very light "burn".  I use these two to introduce others to the proper appreciation of single malt.  No ice or mixers allowed

4154.Author: Anonymous
4154.Review: One of my favorites. A very unique flavor that combines sweetness and smokiness. Very smooth. Unbeatable value.

4154.Author: LonesomeKyPoet@aim.com
4154.Review: This is absolutely an adorable whisky! I usually get a bottle at Christmas. Very nice! I live in Kentucky in Bourbon Whiskey Country, but I still love a good Scotch from time to time. To me, Bourbon and Scotch are "kissing cousins!"  :-)

4154.Author: Drums
4154.Review: This one has plenty of character, and tells the story of a classic coastal highland whisky. Strong distinctive flavours, really enjoy the subtle salt characteristics, and a long distinguished finish.

4154.Author: S.P. Bristol (Badger)
4154.Review: This malt i would recommend,it is truly a wonderful work of nature,soft on the nose,smooth on the tongue,plenty of after taste's to droll over,this would please most ardent malt lovers

4154.Author: Kim
4154.Review: The maritime malt is an accurate description. The distinctive hint of brine makes it a nice change from all the sherried stuff. But why make the bottle a different shape to the canister?

4154.Author: aussie shaun
4154.Review: This tastes more like a speyside malt than a highland,sweet and smooth and very drinkable.The bottle looks nice as does the canister it comes in.

4154.Author: Stephen Williams
4154.Review: Does what it says on the bottle a lovely single malt

4154.Author: Anonymous
4154.Review: excellent smooth with a definate taste of orange

4154.Author: jimgriswold@mchsi.com
4154.Review: i JUST FINISHED A BOTTLE OF BOWMORE LEGEND. IS THIS A DIFFERENT TASTE, OR ALONG THE SIMILIAR TASTE FROM ISLAY?

4154.Author: Barry Lilley
4154.Review: Beautifully smooth and complex with a lovely finish.  Excellent malt which gives Highland Park a run for its money.

4154.Author: Edoardo
4154.Review: I just tried a miniature, and it really hit me. A couple of ice cubes, few minutes and as soon as you get the glass near your nose you are hit with some light orangey aroma, relaxing and refreshing. Really enjoyable

4154.Author: David Mathews
4154.Review: Distinctive and impressive. The tones are too complex for my discernment, but I do love the mystery!

4154.Author: Anonymous
4154.Review: The personification of a quality whiskey

26248.Author: Anonymous
26248.Review: One time purchase sums it up nicely

26248.Author: Simon Brown
26248.Review: Young, fiery, a little bit of peat, a little bit of smoke, definitely not aged which is a shame because in about 10 years this'll be quite a nice whisky - right now it's a very expensive paint stripper. Add ice (!) if you value the lining of your mouth. Not one for the connoisseur.

26248.Author: Hanimo
26248.Review: Unfortunately this scotch is very lackluster. Has a nice peatiness on the nose, but it's not smooth at all, and mostly just leaves a medicinal flavor and numbness. There's no age listed on the bottle, so clearly this isn't a properly aged whisky as other reviewers have noted, and that's very disappointing for a single malt. I guess this is good for shots!

26248.Author: Johnny
26248.Review: Massively overpowered with peat and smoke. The smell of mentol finishes off the overpowering attack on the taste buds without any real death of flavour. Not impressed and won't buy again

26248.Author: Ella
26248.Review: Loved it! Fantastic light smoke flavor with a sweet finish, very smooth.

26248.Author: Anonymous
26248.Review: Outstanding value.

26248.Author: mike m
26248.Review: Saw many negative reviews, but each to his own.This whisky has a lovely light smokey peat initial taste, and then a very satisfying toffee finish. Very warming on a cold winter's day!

26248.Author: Stevie Henderson
26248.Review: Lovely.not too peaty..pleasant on the palate

26248.Author: Ger
26248.Review: To smokey, Taste really bad. At the moment is Jameson my favorite whiskey.

26248.Author: Anonymous
26248.Review: A one time purchase, you can spend your money better elsewhere

26248.Author: Ben B
26248.Review: Feel I need to balance the books on reviews on this one as there's really not a lot wrong with a nice, standard malt. It's young, not complex, a great starter for those dipping their toes into gentle peat. Whispy smoke on the nose with a gentle, underlying candied sweetness. Spicy vanilla palate (as the producer notes say) and a pleasantly long finish. Won't break the bank and not barnstormingly exciting, but solid stuff.

26248.Author: Doc
26248.Review: This whiskey was a one time purchase.  Not horrible and not great  It appears young, probably corporate decision to put less expensive single malts on the shelf for quick profits in a craze for single malts. I've certainly tasted better ardmore's!

26248.Author: Anonymous
26248.Review: Not the best to be honest, it is very smooth and isn't too smoky but it just lacks flavour

26248.Author: Helen
26248.Review: I enjoyed it. Peaty and smoky but not over the top. Lovely light colour. I think it fits nicely amongst my highland single malts, well, if I wasn't always drinking them. I liked it. Send a barrel my way x

26248.Author: Rock
26248.Review: Pretty poor. Blandness of a young whisky which presumably it is. Much better whiskys at this price point.

26248.Author: Anonymous
26248.Review:
Thought I’d give this one a try, liked the mild peaty nose and taste to suit, clung to the glass which was a good thing.
Not as overpowering as some of the island malts, not a favorite, though grand for the price......

26248.Author: Josh
26248.Review: This scotch is a NIGHTMARE! Ardmore Traditional was one of my favorite whiskies at any level... Legacy is undrinkable. No character, no depth, absolutely not a single redeeming quality to this bottle!

26248.Author: TonyB
26248.Review: A wonderful surprise awaits you from the first cinnamon nose to a silky finish

26248.Author: Bob
26248.Review: Sorry tastes like medicine,to over powering

26248.Author: Bart G
26248.Review: I like it - good for starting the peaty beginners series

26248.Author: Wim Dohmen
26248.Review:
Expected nothing, got very much.
Wondeful balanced whisky!

26248.Author: Anonymous
26248.Review: Not sure whether mine was off. It tasted like surgical spirit!!

26248.Author: Mark
26248.Review: Disappointed, smoke on the nose, smoke on the tongue, not much more, a wee sweet toffee at the end. Too smokey.

26248.Author: Chris Williams
26248.Review: Peaty smokey flavour great first hit on the palette very enjoyable

26248.Author: Killakoalaballs
26248.Review: Its a 3.5 to 4 rating. As one already said its no Laphroaig but the flavours are nice and smooth. I suggest enjoying a glass or two while a lady kisses the land down under

26248.Author: Anonymous
26248.Review: Beyond the other flavours, I like the Smokey pervasiveness

26248.Author: Noel Moitra
26248.Review: Rather strong on the nose.The Speyside grass/heather is quite prominent. First smoke then peat, but not in the Islay mould; less dominant. Spices easily nosed, unmistakeable cinnamon. A teaspoon of water brings out the latent sweetness. On the palate, tangy with a lot of blowback. Quickly toned down with water. Honey comes to the forefront and oaky vanilla is obvious. Grass changes to Cancerian fruit, probably green apple. Lasting sweetness as you move into the finish. Spices recede first but the warm peaty aftertaste remains. Good value for money. I can still taste the body of this dram 10 minutes after downing it.

26248.Author: Chad
26248.Review: Worst Single Malt I ever tasted. It's taste like medicine instead of Single Malt.

26248.Author: PJ
26248.Review: I am very disappointed! Ardmore was one of my top 5 favorite whiskies, It was always hard to find it in the US, I used to get it from the duty free and truly enjoy the malt. I just came across this 40% ABV new bottle about bought it immediately. I have had a dram sitting in the glencairn glass for an hours and there's absolutely nothing happening to it. No character, no development and the body is weaker than any other whisky I can think of. They have killed a great thing and why?

26248.Author: BrandonLee
26248.Review: My bottle has no finish.  Well, very little.  Just a wisp of smoke and done.  Initial taste and nose is very promising, but then a huge let down.  I'd almost rather have a less interesting malt that holds up.  So sad for one of my favorite malts (previous bottling).  The good news is that there are still good indie bottlings of Ardmore that are worth going back to.

26248.Author: Mikey D, Warrington, near Irlam, Salford.
26248.Review: Peat, peaty peat, peat peat peaty, peaty peat peaty, germoline peaty pants

26248.Author: Kirkcaldy Kanka
26248.Review: Sweet with peat. Great value at the price. Other people's negative comments probably come from those who are not used to peaty whiskies. This is often the case with negative reviews of popular Islay malts. Customer who likened Talisker to a peaty whisky has not tried a truely peaty whisky. Ardmore has a gentle peatyness and I was surprised at its quality at this low price.

26248.Author: Canadaman
26248.Review: Great value for the price, although light on the "peat" claim. This was nice once I got about 3 drinks in, the taste -although lighter- was very sippable. I did not taste or smell much for the peat, even compared to Bowmore Small Batch or 12 yo. Excellent value considering it goes for what blended Scotches usually are and is much nicer.

26248.Author: FM
26248.Review: Quite good. Smoke and toffee are predominant and that's all there is to it, flavour wise.  It's just that there's some alcohol harshness...  I've tasted a few blended scotches that had less burn.  There are far better whiskies at this price-point.  Bought it because it was on offer at a supermarket and it was a good buy at that price but would not pay full price for it.  Managed to finish the bottle in two weeks, which is good going for me, so it can't be all that bad.

26248.Author: John Quinn
26248.Review: Superb

26248.Author: Motaun
26248.Review: I agree that it is dry.  The taste is new to me, but is okay.

26248.Author: david ferguson
26248.Review: overpowering peaty malt whisky i did not enjoy it cheaper malts like glen moray and shieidhaigh taste better

26248.Author: Michael Raine
26248.Review: For the price, this is a great introductory whisky. In fact, this was the first single malt that was bought for me.  A great tasting whisky but the long harsh after taste just takes the edge off it. Still a good single in my opinion and maybe I should have tried a dash of water to see what effect that would have of the end flavour.

26248.Author: Morph
26248.Review: Great taste and flavour. Peaty and smoky and dried fruit. Ruined by such a harsh alcohol aftertaste. So much potential but let down in the end

26248.Author: R,Ran
26248.Review: Not a bad drop, had better, however had a lot worse. If you think it tastes like Germoline, There's something wrong with your mouth.

26248.Author: Dave, Preston, Lancs
26248.Review: I bought my first ever bottle yesterday. Money is a bit tight this month so I thought I would take a chance. What a most pleasant surprise. Admittedly it's not an Ardbeg or a Laphroaig but this really is a very palatable dram. Extremely difficult to understand the negative comments.

26248.Author: John Hdson
26248.Review: just tried this today in York, very moreish and i totally agree with Stuart P's description...i got a bottle in my collection now and soon i'm gonna enjoy it even more

26248.Author: Karl
26248.Review: Thought this was horrible as did my wife. Although we don't generally like smokey peaty malts we have enjoyed a few tallisker being one but this as another person said is like germoline. Sorry not for us.... ??

26248.Author: Stewie
26248.Review: While it's a nice drink I'm confused as to how it's classed as a single malt.

26248.Author: Gordon2
26248.Review:
A perfect accomliment to a fine cigar. It provides a warmth that may not suit all and a perfect reminder of what a single malt should be. Smokey, peat, oaky and a lovely lingering after taste.
But that could be the Ardmore speaking

26248.Author: Allan Wood
26248.Review: So sorry, but this is the worst I have tasted. It smells and tastes like Germoline. I don't know whether I have got a faulty bottle but it has made me ill. Reading other comments, it is obvious that the whisky has gone down well with other people. I have had many other brands that have been highly satisfactory but this brand is not to my taste.

26248.Author: Shaggy
26248.Review: Beautiful subtle smoke, very woody but smooth and moreish. Can't wait to try more

26248.Author: Shaggy
26248.Review: Beautiful subtle smoke, very woody but smooth and moreish. Can't wait to try more

26248.Author: Anonymous
26248.Review: this is smooth,its classy ,but wasnt to my personal taste, it has in my taste a cigar after flavour, its decent though,its lie the teachers of the 80s and 90s before it went abit grouse

26248.Author: Adam
26248.Review: I've been slowly working my way through different brands of single malts and decided to give this one a try. Sometimes it can take me a couple of glasses to decide whether I'm a fan but with this one instantly loved it. Full of flavour with a hint of peat. Really nice smokiness to it that lingers. Really worth a try. I think I've found my new favourite.

26248.Author: Steve, GLA, ATL
26248.Review: An absolute gem of a find that can be enjoyed by everyone. Extremely well balanced combination  of smoke, vanilla and sweet apple.

26248.Author: Degsie
26248.Review: Mighty fine dram indeed, and an absolute bargain at the moment! My new go to whisky!

26248.Author: Tony
26248.Review: The prominent smokey flavour definitely hit the spot for me. This is one of the best bottles I have ever had.

26248.Author: Mike
26248.Review: In comparison to the traditional cask I find this a completely different dram, it''s not as earthy and there is less smoke to it, don''t get me wrong the traditional is a classic and it''s a shame they no longer make it, but this is a lovely new drop with a lot of potential, don''t get put off by the NAS label, this has wonderful sweetness to it with the heather coming through strongly in the nose and the honey is very prominent in the taste with a subtle smoke then the finish isn''t prolonged but really delivers with satisfaction. I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a nice everyday evening dram without breaking the bank

26248.Author: whiskyman
26248.Review: Amazing and smoky.

26248.Author: LR Kempster
26248.Review: To date this is the finest whiskey I have had the pleasure of drinking. Everybody''s tastes are different and I like to drink neat with ice. Hence 5 star

38593.Author: Whiskyman18
38593.Review: A nice malt and very good value for money. Easy to drink with some coastal like influences complementing the Speyside character. Give it a go - you won't be disappointed.

38593.Author: Geoff
38593.Review: Clean, well-defined  taste with just a touch more western isles character to it than the usual Speyside. Very nice all round.

38593.Author: Max
38593.Review: Creamy and light – it’s just a nice malt.

38593.Author: Anonymous
38593.Review: Not bad at all. Bought it very cheap for about £25 and pleasantly surprised. Light and accessible.

38593.Author: JDS
38593.Review: A really nice dram, smooth as silk and sits nicely on the palate.

38593.Author: Dave G
38593.Review: Have tried this and there is a faint taste of orange peel, but I couldn't taste the ginger. I had it with a Partagas Serie P and it married very well.

38593.Author: Mike
38593.Review: Absolutely fantastic. I purchased a bottle from the Co-Op approx 5 months ago, never tried it before but thought I would try something new. That first glass was sublime – so smooth on its own but equally as enjoyable over ice. Nicer than the likes of Glenfiddich/Glenmorangie. Brought for a few birthdays recently and not a bad word to be said.

38593.Author: Charles
38593.Review: This is one of the smoothest malts I have ever had. It is velvety and clean and very moreish. Wonderful

38593.Author: nicu
38593.Review: Extremely velvety. Great bouquet, typical Scottish. Perfect. I'll taste it anytime with pleasure.

38593.Author: Don
38593.Review: Tried this malt for the first time  yesterday and was pleasantly surprised at its mellow warmth, fruitiness and sweetness. Not usually a fan of Speyside malts in general but have just purchased two more bottles.

38593.Author: Tomweedram
38593.Review: Love it for a change...lovely birthday gift

38593.Author: Anonymous
38593.Review: Lovely single malt, nice tasting and one of my favourite whiskies, mellow taste. Recommended highly.

38593.Author: Casuallydone
38593.Review: Middle of the road whiskey. Slight afterburn which I’m not fond of. I’ll see the bottle off but I’m afraid it will be back to my Talisker and not back here again!

38593.Author: Anonymous
38593.Review: many years ago my late father brought a bottle or two from his holiday in Scotland. Didn't see it for years after that but always remember the mellow taste. I now buy it when it's on offer as I have a rule about spending too much money on whisky. I don't care what the so called experts say this is a very nice malt, particularly when it's reduced on the shelves! Try it and save money ...do NOT put water with it!

38593.Author: David Gallacher
38593.Review: An excellent and fine example of Scots Whisky.    Highly recommended so give it a try

38593.Author: Barry
38593.Review: Very good, it has a great colour and is very smooth, a good whiskey and at a very reasonable price, I will be purchasing again

38593.Author: Gareth Ward
38593.Review: Not sure what to make of it, great nose but mediocre taste/finish.  Not offensive though

38593.Author: Simmy
38593.Review: Got this as a gift, liked it a lot, a smooth malt and didn't burn the throat. Will buy another as it's a decent price too

38593.Author: G
38593.Review: Brilliant aroma. Not the finest taste but considering the price it’s absolutely fantastic

38593.Author: Rafael
38593.Review: Fantastic aroma but tastes similar to the cheapest vodka

38593.Author: Nath
38593.Review: My first try from this distillery and I liked what a tasted, full of flavour but very smooth. It was a gift but I would certainly purchase myself and also try some of the other labels

38593.Author: Martin
38593.Review: Just into the malt this year good price and go down well

38593.Author: Damian
38593.Review: There are no great miracles when it comes to whisky. It's a reasonably priced bottle that tastes as such but much more pleasant than some similarly priced sweet bottles like Auchentoshan and certainly a step up from cheap bourbon. It's sweet and smooth on ice and a great one to mix for the philistines. Adding more value to it is pointless (this is no miracle Speyside) but certainly one of the more pleasant bottles in this price range. You will look good pulling this out when drinking to get reasonably drunk with reasonably experienced whisky drinking friends.

38593.Author: Robert
38593.Review: Like one occasionally that isn't smoked or woody just bought this nice caramel n fudge good buy for £22.

38593.Author: Ivan
38593.Review: Great product for reasonable price, definitely would recommend for anyone interested in tamnavulin

38593.Author: JHR
38593.Review: Quality dram, smooth and interesting.  Value at £32,  excellent value at £22 in my local supermarket.  One to buy and put away  for a treat at Christmas.

38593.Author: lucas
38593.Review: nice flavour, aroma but it's burning a throat like a cheap vodka.

38593.Author: Denis
38593.Review: Ok but could do with a few more years in the wood. Won't be rushing back.

38593.Author: MarcelS
38593.Review: A Great One

38593.Author: Anonymous
38593.Review: Simply fantastic, so smooth and full of flavours, up there with the very best. This is our latest favourite

38593.Author: Brian King
38593.Review: Suits our pallete and sharing with 4 friends all felt the same a new one for our list of Likes Thank you

38593.Author: ADY THE LOCK
38593.Review: Great nose, toffee & fudge, fruity & caramel, no smoke or acrid aftertaste, easy to drink with no ice or water, blink & the bottles half full, or gone if your a pessimist. well worth ?32 quid. Competes with any ?80 pound bottle, a bottle not for sharing, just enjoy on the qt.....

2808.Author: Chris Williams
2808.Review: Enjoyable , good peaty notes  , a saturday night tipple.

2808.Author: Rob Stebbing
2808.Review: Tried it last week for the first time at an early Burns Night dinner, and it definitely won't be the last! Beautifully smooth, almost honeyed but with that smoky-peat flavour that distinguishes all good single malts - and it warms the insides wonderfully as it goes down!

2808.Author: Nadja
2808.Review: I grew up in Germany tasting incredible award winning Schnapps. I barely ever get to enjoy the flavor of this spirit here in the States. When I smelled this scotch, I was immediately reminded of the sugary yet subtle  fruit note of Mirabellen Schnapps. Light, warm, sweet, bright and very drinkable.

2808.Author: Tom C
2808.Review: A straightforward whisky with a bit off saltiness and spicyness throughout. Very clean and refreshing. Adding water brings out a slightly floral taste.

2808.Author: Tom C
2808.Review: A straightforward no nonsense whisky with slight peatyness and a bit of matured fruit taste.

2808.Author: Jon Boy
2808.Review: One of two whiskies that introduced me to the world of single malt whisky. A smooth, somewhat sweet and enjoyable dram. Not really peated, but a small hint. Bargain of a whisky that I really enjoy and would recommend to anybody, particularly if new to whisky.

2808.Author: Thomas  Prendergast
2808.Review: Absolutely lovely.

2808.Author: Alistair  McCafferty
2808.Review: I really like this whisky, it's got very strong flavours and is exceptional value for money, I usually have at least one bottle per month and it's consistently refreshing

2808.Author: Jason Cattigan, Killarney
2808.Review: Stunning, a beautiful drink. A smooth drink but not lacking in flavors!!

2808.Author: Andrew McLean Hunter
2808.Review: First time tonight wonderful.  I am not a full on Island fan but not against, Speyside normally first choice. This is the best of both styles with an added something, a great discovery for me

2808.Author: Carlos
2808.Review: Smells of salt, oak, dried fruit, hint of peat. Easy to drink, soft on the palate, tastes of toffee, dried fruit, oak, hint of smoke and peat. Smooth, brief finish. A good dram.

2808.Author: Andy Roth
2808.Review: This was a surprise.  I was expecting a quality that matched the low price, but Whoa!  This is a delicious well-balanced scotch with strong vanilla and caramel notes.  No smoke.  Fans of The Balvenie will appreciate the quality and flavor ... and LOVE the price.

2808.Author: Srinivas
2808.Review: Excellent.  Worth every cent

2808.Author: SAH
2808.Review: This is the best tasting scotch for the money. Has very delicate finish. Not bitey.

2808.Author: Anonymous
2808.Review: This is good stuff with a unique taste, if not your typical island malt.  This is no peat or brine anywhere.  On the nose there is something damp like a wet field.  Barley mixed with hay.  On the palate it is sweet.  There is malt with vanilla.  This has a honeyed and slightly oily feel.  The finish is of medium length and warming with spice mixing in.  Not the most complex but nice.  I like sherry and peat, but every now and again I want something plain.  This might be an island whisky but in my opinion it most resembles Auchentoshen 12

2808.Author: Ken Imlach
2808.Review: was my favorite single malt and my GO TO everyday scotch. VERY disappointed with the recipe changes.

2808.Author: BoyG.
2808.Review: Flavorful & smooth. Moderately priced for good quality.  Can compete with brands that cost 3x more or higher.

2808.Author: Alan S.
2808.Review: Received a bottle as a gift; really enjoying it. Smooth, soft texture. Very easy to drink, no harshness or acidic taste. Simple, smooth and more-ish.

2808.Author: Steve
2808.Review: Very drinkable and lovely honey taste

2808.Author: Frank
2808.Review: After watching  a T/V prog  tours of the islands.  She visited Jura with  only 1 distillery on the land. Well I had to try it . glad I did , i love it . Its not a heavy on the palate drink its one of those that has its place any time of day tipple. its got my vote.  Glenfiddich is still my top shelf best  and this is now  my day time fave  . Scotland  does not make a poor whiskey and its got a dram for all tastes and this is another fine example of the trade in what they do best. I shall buy it again .

2808.Author: Richard Williams
2808.Review: Smooth and sweet

2808.Author: Anonymous
2808.Review: Not bad bit of a harsh finish but pleasant and enjoyable. I find that with this drink a double will last me a long time due to the long finish. I would buy this again but only if the price is right.

2808.Author: Juan Leigh
2808.Review: Beautiful , smooth, easy drinking.Caramel on the nose.Vinious in character.Slightly sweet on the finish.

2808.Author: john c
2808.Review: liquorice root and toffee

2808.Author: Anonymous
2808.Review: Taste is good but take it with water or only ice

2808.Author: Mifune
2808.Review: This is excellent and for its price point hard to match. This is one of my top picks for a non-peaty scotch.

2808.Author: Andre
2808.Review: I'm drinking this at this moment and it's smooth, light....Lovely

2808.Author: Dave B
2808.Review: A quite, mellow whisky. It glides smoothly over the taste buds, rather than attacking them. Very pleasant.

2808.Author: peter
2808.Review: Lovely and easy to drink straight.

2808.Author: Greg
2808.Review: Good staple malt to have in. Nothing fancy and doesn't pretend to be. Easy to drink and good value.

2808.Author: Tam fae Belfast
2808.Review: A wee bit disapointing,Ihave drunk a lot of other brands and must say this one does"nt come up to scratch tastes like a good blend

2808.Author: The Phillster
2808.Review: Light but with plenty of taste too -a real winner

2808.Author: Dale
2808.Review: I have tried many single malts but return to this time and again, smooth and warming, quiet beauty.

2808.Author: Anonymous
2808.Review: I liked this and had no inclanation to add water. Really matched description given on box gentle light etc I would expect this to be agreeable with most but those conisuers looking for that sensory adventure.

2808.Author: Shaggy
2808.Review: Not a bad drink, but didn''t really excite me like others have. I think I shall have to try a few more glasses and make a second judgement

2808.Author: Sergej (Serbia)
2808.Review: I couldn''t believe at start. In my small town in Serbia, I found Jura Origin in pack with two cups. This whisky is really amazing and his taste reminds me of Glenfiddich Solera 15.

2808.Author: Phil D  (IL-USA)
2808.Review: It is still one of my favorite malts. Great sweetness and creamy viscosity.   I have spent more on many single malts and enjoyed them much less. Love the other Jura whiskies as well.

2808.Author: Anonymous
2808.Review: Too good

2808.Author: Anonymous
2808.Review: A cut above a blended whisky; far more complex. Smooth and light.

2808.Author: Wine lover
2808.Review: I''m drinking this right now, and it''s smooth, light, and whiskey. Which is what I paid for, but then again, everyone''s different.

2808.Author: Drunken Master
2808.Review: Very Light and firm whisky and aged so good all be frankly I had a half bottle and I didn''t feel a thing the next day. Real good

2808.Author: Chris
2808.Review:
I received this as a present this week and after tasting it, I wasn''t that impressed. Nosing it left me with sharp tingling sensations instead of the usual warm feeling.

Tasting it I got a strong flavour of liquorice and bourbon. Not my favourite but bearable.

2808.Author: Tom should choose this!
2808.Review: Beautiful whisky. Lovely taste with a hint of honey. Not everything needs to be peaty... Very smooth and morish!

2808.Author: Sapan Jani
2808.Review: Not Much Appreciating...comparatively a young whisky, 10yrs old..I personally don''t like it though hv a smooth go on our pallet..needs to get bottled minimum at 12yrs of age..tastes like a blended whisky not at all Malty...

2808.Author: Justatheory
2808.Review: I''ve tried lots of malts over the years and generally enjoyed them all but not keen on this at all. It''s insipid not smooth and tastes like a cheap blend.

2808.Author: Anonymous
2808.Review: What had the potential to be a superb single malt, is utterly ruined by being so watered down.  Such a shame.

2808.Author: gs
2808.Review: Very smooth

2808.Author: r.j.yung
2808.Review: Very nice cast hint of smoke and no after taste . A winner at a low cost .

2808.Author: Anonymous
2808.Review: Lovely drink. My father in law nearly choked when he saw the price after we''d sunk half a bottle!

2808.Author: nice whiskey
2808.Review: Nice

2808.Author: halliday
2808.Review: best whisky I  ever tasted

2808.Author: nyoro john
2808.Review: its nice and smooth

2808.Author: darko, croatia
2808.Review: excellent whisky that comes at a very good price. what strikes me about it is that it has that salty, iodide, seaside character that comes from its marine roots, but also a strong body which I like in highland whiskies. I enjoy it very much!

2808.Author: Anonymous
2808.Review: Opened bottle of origin last week for my birthday the wife bought me – nectar

2808.Author: Graygo
2808.Review: Opened a bottle of this tonight which my son bought me for my birthday, must say that I found it a pleasant drop, sweet and easy to drink neat. By the way it is whisky not whiskey :(

2808.Author: Keith
2808.Review: Jura is often available on special offer in some major UK supermarkets; which makes it great value. It has a unique distinct flavour profile, that includes fresh and cheerful vanilla toffee with a short finish. I love that they sell half bottles on special offer. Great value in it's price range.

2808.Author: Anonymous
2808.Review: I completely agree with Jamie H's review....very nice, but I think I would buy Aberlour or Glenmorangie again over this.

2808.Author: A Scotsman
2808.Review: Very smooth and easy to drink, I would try any whisky with a few spots of water for comparisons purposes and have found in many cases it brings out more aromas, in this case it just ripped the taste out of it. A top quality whisky highly recommended on it's own!

2808.Author: Anonymous
2808.Review: there is no sutch thing as a bad whiskey its just some are better than others. i am poor & for the price this is exalent

2808.Author: SPP
2808.Review: I have tried dozens of single malts over the years and the 10 years old Jura remains my favorite. As a matter of fact that is the only whiskey I drink for the last several years. I keep other single malts for the house guests and offer Jura only to very close friends.

2808.Author: bikerpaul
2808.Review: LOVE IT i've tried many malts all a little different and unique...cant fault this one tho you should try superstition as well,but be warned....its VERY easy to drink !!

2808.Author: Sneh Kant
2808.Review: Really the peaty smell is obnoxious it's great in taste style and surpasses all other scotches,it's magic with  tast and marvellous in aroma

2808.Author: Bolg of the North
2808.Review: Out of the fifty or so different whisky’s I’ve tried so far this is the only one I couldn’t drink. It does have a very unique flavour to it but unfortunately it is not one that I could appreciate.

2808.Author: Anonymous
2808.Review: For the price there is nothing wrong with this whiskey at all yes you could pay a little more and buy a JW black label which is better. However if you are really going to pay more go for the Jura 16 year old you will not be disappointed and worth every penny for the experience

2808.Author: Craig Bryant
2808.Review: My review of 7th May 11 was a little harsh. My taste in single malts has moved away from Islay's and I'm now beginning to appreciate the sweet, honeyed tones of this whisky. So much so, in fact, that I've just ordered a bottle of 16 year old to compare !

2808.Author: Jamie H
2808.Review: Easy enough to drink and wasn't disappointed (especially for the price). Probably won't buy another bottle though. Aberlour 10yo a much better option.

2808.Author: Greg J
2808.Review: Im pretty new to whisky in general, but I have tried a good few of the mainstream single malts i.e Glenfiddich, Penderyn, Glenmorangie etc, and I have to say this far out guns most single malts in this price range. YOU CANT GO WRONG WITH THIS! Beautiful on the nose, very smooth and has a great depth of flavours.

2808.Author: bingo wings
2808.Review: jura is bit too strong tasting for me and putting ice with it seems to turn it to a rude smelling peat - bit of warm water vastly improves it bringing out the sweet honey.

2808.Author: Andi
2808.Review: My favorite 'drinking' Whisky. £21.95 here is an excellent price as I've just paid £29.95 for a bottle! (a downfall of living in the Inner Hebrides lol). If you like this then move up a grade to Superstition - I'm on a quest to sample many more Jura expressions (and live 500 metres from the Ledaig distillery!)

2808.Author: ironandtri
2808.Review: Firstly great value for your cash £20 not bad! easy drinking lovely sweet nose ,honey, slight salt,citus fruits and a wiff of summer breezz. A good starting point for any up and cumming Whisky buff.

2808.Author: Ponderosa Pete DL
2808.Review: Good, warming, nice after taste, with a heavenly nose

2808.Author: Bennettonbeer
2808.Review:
I tried Jura 10 year old single malt for the first time today and found a whisky which has a good nose and an accessable and subtle flavour taken straight. 
Add a drop of water and other pleasurable aspects develope.
Honey after-taste, though with a somewhat short finish. 
Overall however, a very good dram!

2808.Author: Anonymous
2808.Review: very good

2808.Author: Anonymous
2808.Review: Hmmmmm, is 'bland' too strong a word for this tipple? Ok, i take it back, how about 'uninteresting'. Sorry. Agree with anonymous, 11th Nov '10 - "I've tried at least 50 different kinds of whiskey so far and this is the only one I can't say anything good about".

2808.Author: Anonymous
2808.Review: I'm a lover of rare and high end malts especially Mortlach and Aberlour.... I've just bought a bottle of this Jura 10yo and find it absolutely unique: Heather, Honey and Coffee Beans on the nose with a light and very well balanced arrival, white pepper and parchment phase with a tobacco and flint finish. Citrus, honey,tobacco and coffee beans linger... Anybody who doesn't enjoy this is clearly entitled to their tastes and opinions.... more left for those who appreciate it.

2808.Author: Jack E July 22nd 2011
2808.Review: Those who speak with anonimoty obviously don't want to defend their review, some must think the job of tasting is to be a critic. Found out about Jura while whiskey shopping, I asked questions and read the updated Scotch Whiskey Bible. Niether were critical so I purchased and must say enjoyed the subtle differences from other single malts, different isn't worse or better it's just different. An enjoyable adventure.

2808.Author: TWE Admin
2808.Review: I'd say that everyone should drink their whisky how they want - try it without ice, but if you prefer it with ice then go for it.

2808.Author: wallywhisky
2808.Review: beautiful, delicatley smokey, sweet, smooth, vanilla and burnt caramel, takes the edge of the day. To the lad who drank this with ice, this is a big NO NO

2808.Author: Old man river
2808.Review: More like a bourbon than a whisky,very disappointed

2808.Author: Anonymous
2808.Review: I'm 23 and have only really ever drink southern comfort as I don't yet like the taste of whisky my Dad drinks, but someone bought him Jura as a present and it's a very nice whisky to start on for a beginner. And my dad likes it! It's not too harsh on the throat and is very tasty with some ice. I will be buying a bottle when I've drunk my Dads!!

2808.Author: Anonymous
2808.Review: I was maybe a little harsh. This 10 yr old is certainly not as complex as some, but with time and breathing itd matures into a nicely accessible and pleasant dram. Its certainly not complex or suprising as some and does have a rather short finish, but its pleasant and actually quite lovely as an after dinner dram. I admit when I'm wrong, and love it when I am. This whisky would be good for a novice looking to explore the world of single malts. A nice dram !

2808.Author: Craig Bryant
2808.Review: First taste and impressions are that this isn't as complex as some unpeated whisky's. To be honest, it feels flat and the taste disappears too quickly for my liking. I don't like being negative about products because someone has put their heart and soul into producing the bottle that currently sits in drinks cabinet. Maybe I'll appreciate 10 yr old Jura with time, but I'll stick to my unpeated malts such as 12 yr old Old Pulteney and 15 yr old Dalwhinnie in future.

2808.Author: Mr E
2808.Review: A fair single malt. A progressive nose with an initial trace of menthol, giving way to a brackish character

2808.Author: chalky
2808.Review: lovely easy to drink and not to harsh on the throat nice and sweet and lovely smell to it

2808.Author: Kelly
2808.Review: Not bad. A bit salty, and an undefinable but distinctive (or 'peculiar', if I were feeling mean) taste in there somewhere. Light and easy to drink. Pleasant, but unremarkable. Obviously better than the bad end of blended stuff, but if had to choose between this and JW Black at the same price I would take the JW Black without hesitation. Worth a go if it were steeply discounted and your liquorist had unaccountably run out of Teacher's.

2808.Author: Anonymous
2808.Review: Very easy drinking single malt. Surprising for an Island in how smooth it is, very good place to start with single malts.

2808.Author: ghosthunter
2808.Review: Very, very light and delicate. Must be drunk on a totally clean palate to appreciate its subtle flavours.

2808.Author: phil
2808.Review: couldnt even stand the smell of whiskey until a friend encouraged me to try this.am now fully converted to the joys of whiskey

2808.Author: Ruben
2808.Review: Let's be honest here, everyone who has tasted more then 20 different whiskies knows this isn't the best whisky in the world.Then again...maybe it is.Let's take a closer look, this is a very simple and honest whisky. The nose gives away some nice wood, barley and sea influences, the flavour gives an honest barley taste with some hints of buttery candy treats. The only thing lacking is stamina, the flavour is very short and it does not develop any further.

2808.Author: Anonymous
2808.Review: Fantastic single malt very smooth and very very easy to drink.

2808.Author: Gary
2808.Review: Jura genius if you buy this whiskey. Full of flavour. Took it to my friends to taste with him and he said 'Jura good guy for buying me this'.

2808.Author: Anonymous
2808.Review: I've tried at least 50 different kinds of whiskey so far and this is the only one I can't say anything good about.

2808.Author: Anonymous
2808.Review: Where have I been for the past 50 years. Reasonably successful, happily married, faithful dog but never discovered JURA until now.   Wow what a drink. Sublime. Never mind the cough mixture throat medicine ones ( you know which I mean ) if there is one thing you must try before you die it's the heavenly nectar that is JURA whisky.  You'll want to live forever.

2808.Author: Anonymous
2808.Review: I am usually a blend drinker (Johny Walker Black) so what a nice surprise from a single malt (Jura 10 year old). Definitely one of my new favourites.

2808.Author: Mikko P
2808.Review: Well... this stuff tastes more like blended whiskey than single malt. This is not very ambitious malt. The nose is oddly cheesy and there is hanging around a disturbing menthol finish. I won't buy again, sorry.

2808.Author: Arvid
2808.Review: I enjoy my single malt and find Jura very enjoyable. Right up there with my favorits. Smooth

2808.Author: fi, liverpool
2808.Review: i dont really like whisky but this was sumthin else, really pleasant drink i will defo try it again

2808.Author: Dave
2808.Review: Just added to my single malt collection.  This is one the wife and I enjoy together as it has a gentle enough flavor for her, and enough kick for me.

2808.Author: TWE Admin
2808.Review: Please note, these comments have been edited and some posts removed due to an outbreak of petty mudslinging.  Please try to contain yourselves and respect each others opinions.  Thanks.

2808.Author: Neil
2808.Review: My first foray into the world of single malts and I thoroughly  enjoyed it!!! Very easy to drink and a lovely peaty taste, recommended.

2808.Author: simon
2808.Review: This is a nicely worked whisky. It has a Highland richness, Speyside delicateness, with a faint jura peat. probably too sweet for many, but, I like it.

2808.Author: aussi_sheragh
2808.Review: I fully agree with uuulala above! It really takes you away with its sweety mildness.

2808.Author: Stephen
2808.Review: I purchased this as it was on offer at a local superstore. I thought I would try something different. I thoroughly enjoyed it. Another malt that does what it says on the tin.

2808.Author: rico
2808.Review: When in France I had another version of this 10yo, i.e. Iura 10yo Legacy.It was mor sweet, sherried with fuller palate and longer, more warming finish. Amazing.TWE guys, please, get it for us!

2808.Author: MR DAVID HAYER
2808.Review: not the best wiskey but for the price not to bad .Got a bit of a kick

2808.Author: uuulala
2808.Review: It is mild, and not rough. To be tasted in summer, not in winter. You can empty a bottle without notice, so mild it is. It is boring if you are young and look for tough experience. The first glass tastes cheap for first 5 minutes, until your wife and kids leave you alone. Then the journey begins.Absolutely no smoke. Not rich in flavour. Delicate.

2808.Author: rob
2808.Review: At $19 with two tumblers included I decided to make up my own mind about this much maligned product. Lots of honey in the nose, pulls its punches on the palate and a very polite slightly smokey finish.  Do not add even a drop of water, since it is a delicate dram.

2808.Author: Kim
2808.Review: Smooth, easy to drink and sensibly priced. Surely nobody could be offended by it.

2808.Author: S.P.bristol (Badger)
2808.Review: If only we were of the same tongue,how boring would that be,however i found this malt pleasing on mine with soft overtones and a slightly sweet finish,floral to the nose,pleasant languishing aftertaste,most enjoyable.

2808.Author: Stephen
2808.Review: I agree with Andrew fae Auchtermuchty .

2808.Author: ben
2808.Review: i also regretted buying this, it isnt too bad but it just seems a bit bland

2808.Author: Danny Boy
2808.Review: I agree with Stevee. This tasted cheap and unmemorable.

2808.Author: Andrew fae Auchtermuchty
2808.Review: One of my favourite island malts. Easy to drink and with a taste to die for.

2808.Author: stevee
2808.Review: A boring whisky that tastes cheap. I regretted buying this, although I did manage to force it all down ;-)

2808.Author: Anonymous
2808.Review: Jura was my first experience with an island malt and it was good! Smooth, rich, a little salt, mildly sweet, and a hint of smoke. Well worth a try!!! I've paid more for less impressive whisky.

7088.Author: Falcon
7088.Review: This is the most popular malt whisky in Scotland.  Why?  It is the perfect marriage of a reasonable price point and superb quality.   Most of the renowned malt reviewers rave about this delightful malt whiskey.   There are many malts at double the price that don’t approach the finesse and quality of this dram.

7088.Author: Jeff
7088.Review: As a relative newcomer to the world of single malts (5 years or so), the Glenmorangie 10 year is at the top of my list. Very smooth with a hint of fruity aftertaste.

7088.Author: Vince
7088.Review: Very easy on the palate. I have an affinity towards smoke, and this is simply a lovely floral alternative.

7088.Author: Ian
7088.Review: Fantastic. A really mellow and rich speyside.  I have more experience with smokier whiskies, but this is a very pleasant change of pace.

7088.Author: KW
7088.Review: Silky texture to the tongue, and a very delightful toffee taste that lingers long at the the aftertaste

7088.Author: Juan
7088.Review: I fell in love with this speyside the moment I opened the bottle. And it remains my favorite highland whisky to date. The nose is very fruity, with lemon really taking center stage at the beginning, later giving way to other notes of citrus, light vanilla, enticing floral notes, and the scent of fresh baked banana bread encapsulating all of that. The palate starts where we left off in the nose, bananas hit you immediately, followed by those citrus and vanilla notes, then further developing into honey and coconut. The finish is once again a very bright and alluring sweetness with medium length. Just a great whisky in every way, if you want to get someone into the world of scottish whisky, this may just be the way to open that door for them.

7088.Author: Jimbo
7088.Review: Is malt, is balanced, is smooth, is the benchmark

7088.Author: Steve
7088.Review: Delicate fruit and toffee flavor, pleasant aroma. Medium sweetness, just a hint of smoke, much  milder than what I expected from a highland whisky. Very nice, great gateway Scotch.

7088.Author: Brunswick MD USA
7088.Review: I enjoy this whisky has been my daily drink for some time creamy nice mouth feel finish is nice recommend

7088.Author: Claire
7088.Review: After a lifetime of believing I just didn't like whisky (no matter the age or origin), I fell head over heels for this one.

7088.Author: Tony
7088.Review: I’m a newcomer to single malts so my nose and palette are very inexperienced, hence that’s why I have only gave it 4 stars. I do add a small splash of water to ‘open up’ the flavour of my whiskey and after a few sniffs and sips of this Highland dram, I could really smell toffee coming through, with a light, fruity taste on the tongue. Let the whiskey linger in the mouth for a second or two before swallowing and you will be greeted with a smooth, fresh finish which tingles my taste buds for a few minutes afterwards. This is my go to everyday dram and fantastic buy considering it was on offer from a major chain supermarket.

7088.Author: Anonymous
7088.Review: This is  the continuation drink after Glenmorangie Nectar Dor. Comparing to Nectar,  the Original is significantly rough. But ok  by it’s own..

7088.Author: Hanimo
7088.Review: Smooth, doesn't let you down, is sweet and balanced. It's amazing that among single malts, even the less expensive are outstanding. Glenmorangie has great value for its price, and is never a disappointing scotch to have a dram of. A great scotch for beginners and veteran scotch drinkers alike.

7088.Author: SURAJIT
7088.Review: As good as it gets from the Glen family....truly superior to Gle?fiddich and Glenlivet 12/15 years

7088.Author: John
7088.Review: Simply first class

7088.Author: guru
7088.Review: Its great drink, melodious in each sip......Cheers*

7088.Author: Anonymous
7088.Review: Very easy drinking and there is a lot to like about it, especially if like me you are relatively new to whisky.  Very enjoyable.

7088.Author: Ian
7088.Review: There are plenty of whisky snobs out there who talk rubbish. The bottom line is that if you like it, then it is great whisky. I don’t care for smokiness or peatiness as it tastes like TCP to me, but I recognise that others think differently and that is fine. I like smooth whiskies and this is an excellent and affordable example. I saw a review once that suggested MacCallan Gold was for people who don’t like whisky. These are the words of an idiot. Enjoy what you enjoy and I really enjoy this.

7088.Author: R. Shelor
7088.Review: Young, not pretentious.

7088.Author: Jeremy
7088.Review:
This is a very uncomplicated whisky but it is nicely scented and a nice color.
the more Glenmorangie's I drink just like this one they are all good!

7088.Author: Andrew
7088.Review: This whisky has an aroma of a lemon running through a mangrove at midday on Summer solstice whilst juggling mangoes which are in turn juggling mini bananas, which are in turn juggling peaches. The finish is an orange in a sports car backing down the M1 shouting 'tally ho' with unicorns in the rear seat completing a rubik's cube with its rear hooves. On the palate it is a 1930's jazz band playing 'Rhapsody in Blue' backwards whilst doing the can can trying not to step on the fluffy bunnies that frolic around their feet.

7088.Author: Matt
7088.Review: Being new to scotch, I tried this based on expert recommendations and reviews. It definitely is a great one, and will occupy a place in my cabinet!

7088.Author: Riley
7088.Review: One of my first whiskeys, very smooth. No peat.

7088.Author: JohnRstewart
7088.Review: Really nice whiskey, easy on the palate, definitely recommend

7088.Author: Anonymous
7088.Review: Gentle, smooth as silk, heavenly smell, delicious ??

7088.Author: ali mac
7088.Review: very consistant

7088.Author: Stuart
7088.Review: This is a great whisky to start on in my opinion. It smells heavenly and goes down easily. A lovely whisky to buy, and if it's ever on sale pick up a couple.

7088.Author: Anonymous
7088.Review: Slick, smooth, and tasty!

7088.Author: Anonymous
7088.Review: Outstanding whiskey.  Very smooth and creamy.

7088.Author: Hedge774
7088.Review: (Disclaimer: I've only been drinking Scotch for a year now, so my palate is as about as refined as a monster truck show. )This has to be the most gentle whiskey ever made! On the nose I get honeysuckle, white grape, mandarin orange in syrup, and Chanel No. 5. On the taste...I get a creamy Oak with a touch of pears... If you are looking for a scotch that kicks you in the teeth with each dram, look elsewhere. This dram is as soft as a mothers hug.

7088.Author: Matthew
7088.Review: This is the first sipping whisky I ever bought.  The smooth honey and citrus flavors made it easy drinking. A great whisky to start with. Very enjoyable

7088.Author: Terry
7088.Review: this is the only whisky that i can remember the words to of Flower of Scotland

7088.Author: Rara
7088.Review:
Citrus punch on the nose with a very malty palate, like digestive biscuits!
Smooooooooth smooth finish. 
Great all round refreshing classic. Could drink anytime.

7088.Author: dan the geezer
7088.Review: Tasty son

7088.Author: Sourav
7088.Review: I love this whiskey.. for the palate

7088.Author: J. Lensbower
7088.Review:
I have but three words for this: finish, finish and finish!
If judging a number of brands by finish alone, this one is near the top!

7088.Author: Anonymous
7088.Review: Very tasty. A floral and fruity taste with mild smokiness. An all around great flavor and I like the spicy finish.

7088.Author: Nathan
7088.Review: Great vanilla flavor, works well with the citrus. Going to buy another bottle.

7088.Author: Christopher Holmes
7088.Review: Just started out drinking whisky, my usual drink of choice is rum,  started of with Grants, teachers and a few other blended brands, I was abit sceptical about trying a single malt as I thought I would still prefer blended,  boy was I wrong, I love this sweet, fruity golden water, for me the finish is the best part.

7088.Author: john atlanta georgia
7088.Review: Wonderful Whiskey. I'm a Scotch guy gone coganac.  Bought this for my wife. Sweet, smooth with tones of vanilla and honey. Reminds me of a developed Remy. These guys are unbelievably dedicated to their craft.

7088.Author: Timothy Price
7088.Review: Being from Kentucky I'm more accustomed to my native Bourbon whiskey.  Frankly I wanted to branch out a little. Honestly I find this scotch amazing. The many different flavors I experience when drinking this to my untrained palate.  Are a hint a vanilla, citrus maybe a nutty flavor. Not sure. But one thing is sure I love it!

7088.Author: Donald Kohlmier
7088.Review: Smooth and sweet.  I immediately smelled the citrus.  The finish is fantastic.

7088.Author: Andrew
7088.Review: Very smooth. Lots of honey. Like it

7088.Author: Paul
7088.Review: Easy to drink, very fruity.

7088.Author: Angus Carmichael
7088.Review: Creamy sweet style with floral, coffee and nutty undertones..complex. Very little if peat and very ltd smoke. Nice if you enjoy sweet whiskey as I did a few years ago as this is a better one not to be wasted as a mixer.  But having now abandoned all borbon I'm now finding my palate is now doing the same for sweeter styles of whiskey. This isn't dry or peated enough for me now so will be last bottle for some time.  My go to now is laphroig 10 year, which ironically is sweeter than in the past but still 10/10 on the dry scale of whiskey. This one is a must buy for those who like highland and speyside malts and thoroughly recommended.

7088.Author: Ricky Jones
7088.Review: Beautiful.. Clean.. Sweet.. Crisp.. A must in any mans whiskey collection. Perfect

7088.Author: Ricky Jones
7088.Review: Beautiful.. Clean.. Sweet.. Crisp.. A must in any mans whiskey collection. Perfect

7088.Author: Shaggy
7088.Review: Far from a stand out whisky, although it's not a poor drink by any means. Missing all the flavour of smoke and peat, I think I'll go back to islay bottles

7088.Author: Phillip Jonker
7088.Review:
Aroma: A hint of vanilla makes the aroma something relaxing....

Amazing Palate you almost don't want it to end with an amazing finish.

This is absolutely the whisky of choice for an immortal Highlander!

There can be only one!

This is definitely one of the best whiskeys I have ever tasted!

7088.Author: Khushroo Daruwalla - London
7088.Review: Smooth single malt scotch. I was the taster at one of the scotch party and there were around 28 scotch and this one came out to be truly finest matured smooth spirit.

7088.Author: Matt Fearnsides
7088.Review: It is pleasing and very quaffable however it lacks intrigue, there's nothing that grabs you. Good for a prezzie, there's better if you're buying for yourself.

7088.Author: Anonymous
7088.Review: Pleasant enough with a cube of ice.  Sweet, juicy, a little bit of perfectly integrated oak. Not bad at all. Maybe a bit dry is all.

7088.Author: Phil B.
7088.Review:
I wasn't sure what to think when I opened this. I was expecting to be punched in the face with peat and burn.

The aroma is inviting. The taste is sweet but gentle enough to not make this like a fruity mix drink. The color is pleasing. 

This is a great alcohol for an astounding price that can easily be added to any party you visit or kept at home for when you need something on the rocks after a long day.

7088.Author: Bob T
7088.Review: Outstanding and it's mild.

7088.Author: Anonymous
7088.Review: first time I've tried this one very moreish has smell almost like d smell of cake cooked with orange zest when it comes out of oven, fast is malty but with  vanilla icecream left in the mouth once swallowed really delicious would recommend good value for money

7088.Author: Anonymous
7088.Review: In my opinion this is the best whisky of this style. Malty mixed with toffee, fruit and a delicious nuttiness on the finish. For many people Glenlivet and Glenfiddich are their introduction to songs malt scotch whisky. They were my first single malts after years of drinking blends, Irish whiskey and bourbon. It should be this. I like all styles of single malt whisky. This is my favorite amongst the lighter malty whiskies. Anyone who favors light whiskies who haven't tried this need to.

7088.Author: Francisco
7088.Review: When I tasted it by the first time, I felt something familiar, a whisky that I tasted before, the tyrconnel single malt NAS. In my opinion, G10yo is a good refreshing malt, but what I expect, even not being an expert, is something better that tastes like a malt like this one, but with more flavour and more delicious, even with less body (if so, with body, even better) e.g. Miyagikyo or Yamazaki.

7088.Author: Will J
7088.Review: Very nice, with the right sweetness, balanced and a touch of fire. Fantastic for those wanting a sweeter  taste

7088.Author: Stanley Stanner
7088.Review: Great single malt for the price!

7088.Author: Weeman of Highlands Castle
7088.Review: I can finally affordably drink my problems away, after another depressing day while look somewhat classy.  It's hard to stop drinking this hell water

7088.Author: Anonymous
7088.Review: This is a delicious whisky. It is a great value and happens to be better than any whisky of this style, most of which cost much more

7088.Author: Pushy Jhala
7088.Review: One of my favourite well balanced malt best for every day dram !!

7088.Author: Anonymous
7088.Review: It has just the right amount of burn.

7088.Author: gbdoc
7088.Review: While not the very best malt whisky, it's very good, straight (I like the bite), or with just a little water (my wife doesn't). Nicely balanced, good tastes come through, and a lovely finish. There's none better, or even as good, at that price. Our everyday whisky.

7088.Author: Jay
7088.Review: Sweet and fruity, very gentle, clean and balanced. Excellent.

7088.Author: Keith
7088.Review: This is one of my all time favorites. It's well balanced (for my taste).

7088.Author: Steve
7088.Review: I just purchased a bottle of the glenmorangie 10 year original and I can't wait to burst it open, but just out of interest, do these bottles increase in value much if I was to keep it sealed. (10/years or so) sorry if I offend anybody with silly questions

7088.Author: Nick R.
7088.Review: This is the whisky which navigated me away from peat in favor of great balance.  Fantastic bright notes, not-overly-sweet finish.  Highly recommended.

7088.Author: Anonymous
7088.Review: Great scotch at a reasonable price.

7088.Author: Paul Lawson
7088.Review:
I was raised in the Spey Valley area, I have been drinking malts for about 25 years now (legally anyway). I have tried hundreds of malts from over peaty Islay whiskies to heather, honey, citrus, sea salted etc. I always come back to my glen, its like my long lost best friend every time I buy a bottle. Sure it''s simple, not pretentious (though the tasters description is) It''s helped me through rough times, tough times and love. I actually like the lack of peat, the sweet honey taste (with a drop of h20). 
They have simply got it right with this simple pure whisky. 
I don''t agree its just for beginning single malt drinkers, it''s a dram for any liquor cabinet, happy times and friends.

7088.Author: Sam Pan
7088.Review: I love the Smoky flavor

7088.Author: John T
7088.Review: Wonderfully rich and complex with a delicious sweet, fruity and floral character and subtle hints of spice around the edges. It''s hard to believe that a scotch of this quality is so affordable. An essential dram.

7088.Author: James A. Young
7088.Review: Smother the Glenlivet easer on the palate then Glenfedich.

7088.Author: MrSerious
7088.Review: It has a very sweet citrus-honey notes with a burst of alcoho, wonderful aromas. The palate is very floral,  medium sweet with oak coming in the back, a slight tingling sensation in the nose and a medium long spicy and oaky finish. A satisfactory malt, worth the money.

7088.Author: Jason
7088.Review: An unbelievable Scotch that is still somehow affordable considering its high-quality. The nose is gorgeous...a rich and complex bouquet of spiced Christmas oranges, cloves, honey. Whereas I found my Aberlour 10 had a gentle nip of a burn near the end, this one definitely has a fiery bite to it. Renowned as being incredibly complex, this is a Scotch you definitely want to try.

7088.Author: DJBroo
7088.Review: I love the peaty, smoky Islays, and I also love the honeyed Balvanies, and omg, the Glenrothes Vintage 1985! And because I can''t be shelling out for the Nikka Yoichi (smoke & cherries!) more than once a year, the Glenmorangie Original (10-year) is my everyday. A teensy bit of pure water, and its floral character comes up so nicely. There is nothing better for the price.

7088.Author: Bill Runham
7088.Review: One of the best drops available in this price range if not the best. In any standard sort of pub this will always be my first port of call. A good introductory whiskey for new comers and I always recommend it. Suitable for all tastes

7088.Author: Anonymous
7088.Review: Its sweetness came as a surprise. It was a nice surprise at first but I liked it less by the next drink.

7088.Author: Andrew.B
7088.Review: Gamechanger. This is a whisky for people who think they don't like whisky

7088.Author: Anonymous
7088.Review: Fantastic toffee and vanilla flavours with some discreet floral notes. A morish and accessible whisky that should be tried by all.

7088.Author: Anonymous
7088.Review: Very nice, the perfect way to conclude a hot summers day.

7088.Author: Matt, Norfolk
7088.Review: Smooth on the palate, vanilla on the nose, light and easy whisky. Good pre dinner dram. In terms of Highland whisky's I personally prefer Old Pulteney 12.

7088.Author: Anonymous
7088.Review: This whiskey is very palatable and it is the only one i can drink easily.

7088.Author: Mark
7088.Review: If its the first thing you go to, then you will be impressed by its complexity and smell. If you're more familiar with whisky, or are tasting a few, this one comes out near the bottom for me. There's a lot of whiskys with far more interesting flavours and smells going on - for me this one is weak in comparison.

7088.Author: Rick.
7088.Review: Lovely & smooth,,,very "moreish".

7088.Author: Anonymous
7088.Review: Too much citrus, not for me.

7088.Author: The Guy
7088.Review:
I recommend this for beginner whisky drinkers. 

The flavour is perfectly balanced. It is sweet and complex without being overpowering. The fragrance is wonderful.

I would definately recommend people that a searching for a balanced whisky to try this first before something like Jura Origins.

7088.Author: MK
7088.Review: Lovely stuff. I agree with the comment below. Hints of orange. Almonds too. Yummy. And so warm!

7088.Author: Sir Huddleston Fuddleston
7088.Review: Very delicious. Orangey (get it, "GlenmORANGIE?"), lemony, and delightful. I can see why it's so popular.

7088.Author: Anonymous
7088.Review: A tad 'young' and depthless (is that a word? lol) for a serious drinker, but nevertheless pretty good for light sipping ..

7088.Author: James D.
7088.Review: This is a decent, light and safe. It won't blow you away but won't break the bank if you want to give it a try.

7088.Author: Ian. Bolton
7088.Review: A fantastic dram. Sit back, and relax with a fresh and very easy to drink single malt.

7088.Author: Nelson Lord
7088.Review: Taste buds almost destroyed by Johnny Walker Red. Coaxed into a lasting relationship with Dimple. Then I heard the grown-ups talking about single malts. Bought Laphroaig. Tastes like Creosote (used to retard rotting of fence-posts). Then came a litre of Glenmorangie Original. The education of my palette has begun; I may need multiple tastings of the Glenmorangie before moving on. Don't like the packaging? Get a life.

7088.Author: Anonymous
7088.Review: Rose Flower, Vanilla, Almond, hints of bonfire night. Elegant, Sublime. Only two rivals, The Glenlivet, and Jamesons Tripple Distilled. Well worth £27, ide pay considerably more for this gorgeous dram. Its young and supple.

7088.Author: Daniel
7088.Review: A good ol' dram. Up there with Glen Livet as one of the best I've tried.

7088.Author: Ricky P.
7088.Review: Really enjoyed this malt.  A lot like a Lowlander to me: sweet and floral.  Candy corn, apricot, buttery mashed potatoes.  Must be what a bee feels like when gathering nectar.  There's something familiar about this whisky.  Like deja vu.  Whatever it is, I like it.

7088.Author: Josh Giles
7088.Review: A truly wonderful scotch. Full of vanilla and toffee. Wonderfully sweet and a little bit spicey. Superb.

7088.Author: Anonymous
7088.Review: im sorry but glenmorangie is a fab drink

7088.Author: Anonymous
7088.Review: This is one of my favourites - nutty, fruity and moreish - beautiful

7088.Author: Bryan
7088.Review: A suberb malt. Needless to say I bought 2 litres

7088.Author: timbit
7088.Review: don't u get it. glenmORANGIE means orange thus the orange box!!

7088.Author: Sam
7088.Review: If I had to describe this whisky in one word it would be "safe". It's a decent, light sweet whisky, that's pretty agreeable and isn't really going to offend anyone like a Talisker might. However, for me, it stops at decent, there's nothing really that stands out and grabs you and commands you to drink it, like a Lagavulin or an Aberlour. This is one for the newcomers to the spirit I think.

7088.Author: O H Draw
7088.Review: After just starting to get in to single malts and loving, Talisker and Cragganmore in particular, I did not know what to make of this (to my tastes) rather effete drink, I have tried very hard to like it, I have done all sorts of crazy scientific stuff, water drops, warming glass in hand etc etc.. but I guess it is just to subtle for my earthier spicier tastes.

7088.Author: Lonnie Mason
7088.Review: Just finished off the bottle and all I can say is you can’t go wrong with this. This is the first Malt Whisky that I have ever had and I love it. With that said I do agree with the other reviews that the new packaging is ridiculous.As for the Producer's Tasting Notes… the only thing that was missing is that the Italian garden wasn’t in outer space… Yeah they must have hired a poet that has never tasted a drop of Whisky in his life.

7088.Author: Richard...
7088.Review: This is a big WOW, O-My-God what an amazing bottle of happiness this is. imagine coming home from a stressful day at work and sitting back in your favourite armchair with a glass of THIS 10yr old Glenmorangie, the smoothest bottle of happiness I've ever tested. What an amazing whisky, this has to be the next best thing to sex.  I've got to get me another bottle...

7088.Author: Steve
7088.Review: I got this on sale and was not disappointed. Initially I thought it was boozy, then more flavorful, fun to drink as I got down past the neck of the bottle. Supposedly Jack Daniel barrels were used for this. There's no indication of that fungal JD sour mash. It's a perfected bourbon with a wonderful fragrance and a little sip of this stuff goes a long way for me.

7088.Author: trebor
7088.Review: Quite a lively young malt - fragrant

7088.Author: Drums
7088.Review: This is a sophisticated drop. As the packaging notes suggest the mouth is very soft, with subtle complexity on the palate and a pleasant yet slight smokey finish. Class all the way.

7088.Author: John LaShay, LA.
7088.Review: Deliciously fresh, very easy to drink, with incredibile citrussy notes:) Though I prefer sherry wood whiskies, I really enjoyed a bottle of this amazing dram:)

7088.Author: Chuck, Wales.
7088.Review: I am a newcomer in the kingdom of singlemalts but still it really impressed me. It is more interesting than eg. Macallan 10yo fine oak which was too dry

7088.Author: James Saxon
7088.Review: Perfectly pleasant and straightforward. Personally, I wouldn't pay ?27 for it, but it's a safe introduction to malts, the dram many will come to for the first time. Just remember to carry on moving through! I think the producers hired a poet for the TNs who had sampled the marketing speak, not the whisky.

7088.Author: tenortelfer
7088.Review: Hello Mr Yuck.This whisky tastes nothing like Gin.You really are talking a lot of nonsense.It is highly perfumed,but where is the gin like bitterness,tell me?A blind tasting you say.Deaf and Dumb more like!

7088.Author: yuck
7088.Review: Sweet?  Are we drinking the same thing?  This tastes like gin.  The nose is too flowery for me.  I've conducted two blind tastings and no one liked this.

7088.Author: tenortelfer
7088.Review: The whisky has definately changed along with the packaging.A little sweet for my liking,but still a good introduction to single malt.

7088.Author: davey boy
