Big and spicy, raisins, plums, prunes and oak somewhere underneath.  A tad fiery upon first opening bottle.  Let a week pass and what was once hot becomes great warmth.  "Finish": Tingling oak, drying with smoke and somewhat winey.

12603.Author: Ran
12603.Review: Good 12YO Glenmorangie - taste as good as some other 15YO I tired before.

12603.Author: Travis Kingdon
12603.Review: I have had all current standard Glenmorangies excepting GM25 and love them but this is at the bottom in terms of this fantatsic distillery. Look elsewhere if you are sherry inclined, maybe Balvenie Doublewood, Auchentoshan 3 Wood or a young Macallan. If you want a quality Glenmorangie at a good price go Nectar or Original.

12603.Author: Anonymous
12603.Review: This is a great allrounder. I'm more of an Islay or Talisker fan myself but I keep a couple of smoother drams as well. This is one of the best with a good nose, a brief kick as it hits the centre of your tongue and a fantastic sweet lingering after-taste. Don't think just buy it.

12603.Author: Anonymous
12603.Review: At first, I found the overiding taste on the palate to be a strong flavour of sultanas / raisins, I presume from the sherry casks used to finish the maturation process for this fine whisky. But after a few more single and double measures I grew to like it very much. Typical Glenmorangie..very rich, complex and alluring, and definitely as smooth as it says on the bottle. I'd definitely recommend this one purely for its quality of combined richness, and smoothness.

12603.Author: Anonymous
12603.Review: Nose: Sherry! Sweet, honeyed barley, dark Chocolate/ slight liquorish bitterness perhaps, slightly briny, some slight sweet pine wood notes.Palate:  Immediate sweet barley arrival. Heather honey, dark taffy, barley sugar, not a liquorish but a chocolate note that starts as dark chocolate and then turns to milk chocolate, sherry, all hit your palate at the same time and all are beautifully woven together. Finish: Crisp and lingering. A Chocolate finish. Wonderful! An after-dinner/dessert dram!

12603.Author: Anonymous
12603.Review: Just got this bottle and all I can say is WOW! I love it! Even more so then the highland park 12 year old I recently got. This is smooth full flavor after dinner great nosing scotch. Buy with confidence you just can't go wrong with this dram!

718.Author: Cvok
718.Review: Wonderful whisky. Really, REALLY need to catch a breath, and quite a long one. My experience is at least 15 minutes. Then the initially boring whisky just blooms with fruity and flowery tastes.

718.Author: Anonymous
718.Review: Great for the price - really smooth, but full of flavour

718.Author: Jay Sunshine
718.Review: Not bad....but a bit too dry and wood dominated for me.

718.Author: Mike O'Hearn - Canada
718.Review: Took the distillery tour a week ago and after sampling I bought a bottle.  Good scotch for the price.

718.Author: T.Dearn
718.Review: Bought a bottle last week after a tour of the distillery. Very impressive whisky with a distinctive flavour.

718.Author: Sonny
718.Review: The best original bottling single malt under 18 years I've had. Double the price, and it would still be a bargain.

718.Author: John Donaldson
718.Review: Purchased at the Ben Nevis distillery whilst visiting the west coast on a touring holiday, my first attempt at a single malt, loved it, I now need another bottle just hope I can find it down south.

718.Author: Anonymous
718.Review: Wow!  great whiskey, great price. I'm tasting coffee, vanilla and yes agree with the sherry

718.Author: Manu
718.Review: Seeing that it's bottled at 46% ABV, is it non-chill-filtered?

718.Author: FM
718.Review: Tried this at the whisky experience in edinburg a couple of years ago and loved it, although I couldn't remember why.  Bought a bottle from the WE a couple of months ago and although I was a bit underwhelmed at first, it's really grown on me.  I think now it's mixed with the air in the bottle a bit, the flavour's developed a bit.  Has a very full flavour and a great mouth feel.  Not sure if it's been matured in a sherry cask but certainly getting some of that coming through.

718.Author: DavidUK
718.Review: Fantastic stuff and strangely neglected by the 'experts'

718.Author: Dasir
718.Review: wow it is sold out now! guess was lucky with my purchase just in time hehe. Anyways beautiful dram worth getting if they restock. go for it you wont regret!

718.Author: Anonymous
718.Review: There is a whole host of flavors in this excellent whiskey, the aftertaste is superb. Yum yum

718.Author: Anonymous
718.Review: Lovely whisky. Tastes much older than 10 years

718.Author: Anonymous
718.Review: As above a very easy drink, my favourite whiskey.

718.Author: Anonymous
718.Review: had this about a month ago. friend brought this back from the ben nevis distillery, very easy drink, very good for the price

1665.Author: Whisky4life
1665.Review: My third bottle in last couple of years. This might be my favorite (with Bunnahabain). Worth every penny!

1665.Author: M J P
1665.Review: Take your time with this malt, let it develop in the glass, add a little water and you'll be awarded for your patience. Slainte

1665.Author: Kevin H
1665.Review: Needs time opened, a couple of weeks or more, to show at its best. Then it is really excellent. Malt, spice, coastal notes, honey. Excellent.

1665.Author: Highlander
1665.Review: Very good 14 yr old this one...nice flavours and quite complex for its young years...impressive!!!

1665.Author: J Edwards
1665.Review: A really underrated whisky, in my humble opinion, and full of paradox: refined and firm, complex and subtle, spicy and delicate. And somehow never quite the same twice. And a bargain to boot

1665.Author: Jon Boy
1665.Review: Very agreeable.  Bright, rich golden colour. An aromatic, spicy nose - somewhat earthy. The palate is superb - a wildflower honey & citrus taste to begin with, giving way to a waxy, slightly peated taste. I particularly enjoy the fiery mouthfeel, which vanishes as you swallow - very smooth on the way down, leaving a light zesty finish, which is also somehow wonderfully salty.  I was fortunate enough to visit Brora and the distillery over the summer - highly recommended tour. Overall a wonderful whisky best kept for long, dark, cosy nights with an improving book, a cigar and a log fire.

1665.Author: john weatherill
1665.Review:
Its a very  sophisticated , rewarding drink , giving 
 a touch of peat in the after taste, but does not spoil , in fact enhances its unique taste

1665.Author: Jeremy
1665.Review:
Many people suggested to me to try this Whisky it is absoultly oustanding.
Beautiful color.
Amazing fruity and sweet taste and extremly good value at the price in the UK.
so easy to drink and so pleasurable 
This is a drink I will never tire of!
I aim to have it always in my collection

1665.Author: Jeremy
1665.Review:
Very nice tasty and easy to drink Scotch love the color the sweetness.
This will go in my regularly drunk section.
all my friends love it to which goes to show me that my love for this whisky is correct.

1665.Author: TheRareMalt.co.uk
1665.Review: Strong alcohol on the nose, with a hint of summer fruits. Fruit continues on the palate with slight dryness and reasonable length. An easy drinking start to the evening. A few drops of water adds sweetness on the palate but reduces the length.

1665.Author: Anonymous
1665.Review: A great whisky at a reasonable price; a rare thing these days.

1665.Author: Student of Whisky
1665.Review: This is one of the best drams on the market. Every time I drink it it with water it reveals something new and delicious.

1665.Author: Argha Sueb
1665.Review: Easy to drink

1665.Author: K
1665.Review: A big, big dram. Recent bottlings of Clynelish 14 are superb, non-chill filtered, very less colour, and such great complexity. It can take a lot of water and its the kind of malt that keep giving more and more layers, just fantastic.

1665.Author: Martine
1665.Review: Very good easy to drink whisky.

1665.Author: Anonymous
1665.Review: This is a delicious coastal whisky that all malt lovers should really try. Coastal malt should be a category to itself or at least a style that gets more recognition. Think Oban, Old Pulteney and Talisker. This fits in well. On the nose you get heavy malt mixed with fruit and sea air. The palate is really interesting. The mouthfeel is oily with a lot of fruit, salted caramel and spice. The finish is unique as well. It is briny and drying with a waxy feel. There is so much going on here. Heavy malt. Salty and sweet. Nice spice and fruit underlying. I highly recommend this stuff. Put less into blends and more onto the shelves of liquor stores

1665.Author: Colr
1665.Review: Lovely stuff. Salted and honeyed caramel

1665.Author: Eisaggeleas
1665.Review: Very complex exceptionaly crafted single malt although its only 14 years old. In the nose salty and floral, the taste is a burst of saltiness with spices and of course young flowers combined with a hint of smoke a hint of peach/green apple skin and a bit of bitter wax. Aftertaste kinda medium. A trully great single malt.

1665.Author: Anonymous
1665.Review: Well worth the price.  Just something different and quite interesting about it.  Quite light, not too full bodied but plenty going on in your mouth.  Would have another bottle.

1665.Author: Scotch fan
1665.Review: I am not an established authority such as Jim Murray or Serge Valentin but I know my single malts and hence I am well aware of the very fact that Clynelish 14 is a fantastic dram with distinct personality and it is possibly the best value single malt in the 14 YO segment, along with The Arran 14, of course. Well done, Clynelish. Strongly recommended.

1665.Author: Grant Melville, Falkirk
1665.Review: An absolute cracker of a whisky.  I can't add to the descriptions already put forward by previous satisfied customers, but I will say that this is a coastal beauty.

1665.Author: Lord of the Malt
1665.Review: Patience... Give this one a chance to 'open up'.  When you get this one home, have a wee dram.  Periodically over the next 6 months, have another to assess any changes.  I found that its esters will eventually reveal themselves quite nicely.  This one (like Dalwhinnie 15 and Glenmorangie Original) requires patience.  Alas many a bottle has been consumed before its such time and a surprisingly quality whisky undiscovered.

1665.Author: Tudval
1665.Review: This is a delightful malt, more comparable to Oban than Genfiddich 15, i.e. a class above. Just a touch sweeter (yes, honey) and less salty on the finish, very classy. I cannot find a criticism at this price, but if I wanted to be picky, i'd say that the finish is a little short and (like Oban) I would have liked to taste it at higher strength, given it's smoothness the alcohol is barely noticeable.

1665.Author: Tero max (whall.ru)
1665.Review: A good whisky to leave for waiting. Probably it's an autumn dram, smooth coastal malt for the smooth september.

1665.Author: James D.
1665.Review: This is good but not as good as I expected; has a floral nose a rounded flavor and and doesn't burn to much going down. Very slight hint of smoke but honey?? nope. OK finish but didn't leave me wanting another. It's comparable to a Glenfiddich 15, not quite as smooth but a better initial taste. Maybe I'll try one of the 90's when I sober up.

1665.Author: Danny Hughes
1665.Review: This has a sweet and inviting nose with hints of plumb. The body is smooth and warm, fading to a salty finish. My one complaint is that the finish is a little short.

1665.Author: VM
1665.Review: A bold Northern Highland Single Malt with a unique mouthfeel. Honeyed and fruity, but also slightly smoky and packing more than a decent punch at the end. The "coastal" nature opens up nicely with a drop or two of water. While this 14yo is great for its age, I wish there were more reasonably priced official bottlings of Clynelish. 8 out of 10

1665.Author: Davepat
1665.Review: Really impressed by this, lovely briney, smooth sippin whisky, not one of those that burns its way down, this just glows and lights up your evening.

1665.Author: Samuel, Northeast Indiana, USA
1665.Review: I think it smells like honey and citrus peel, tastes like buttery flower petals, and finishes a bit salty and smoky.  This is such a nice introduction to scotch...  It will be my go to bottle when my friends wise up and ask to know more about this fabulous hobby.

1665.Author: AJ Smith
1665.Review: I would agree with Mikko, Jason's, and others here, so I can't add a lot to what they've said on the specifics, (although I'm not getting the chocolate of Derek Wheeler's description). However, I can say this is an exceptional find. Shows a clean pair of heels to several better known (and much pricier) single malts.

1665.Author: Mikko
1665.Review: A very nice waxy, full, fruity mouth feeling. The peat stays in background as a heavy artillery. The waxiness is a trademark of Clynelish. It's a very unique character, no longer seen in single malts today. In perfect strenght of 46 -% this is what single malts are really about.

1665.Author: Jason's Scotch Whisky Reviews
1665.Review: This is a fantastis single malt!  Age statements are not necessarily indicative of quality and Clynelish 14yrs is proof of such a proposition.  I'd put this up against many 18yr old single malts and there is not a shadow of a doubt that the Clynelish would come out on top!

1665.Author: J.C.S
1665.Review: simply superb nothing else to say

1665.Author: alan evans - sidcup
1665.Review: Wake up Herr Botha and try and express yourself a bit better. Maybe some malts are too complex for you!

1665.Author: chandra manatta
1665.Review: The best recomendation for this is that this is a base for a JW Gold Label

1665.Author: Ashok Mathur
1665.Review: A fantastic single malt, the riot of flavours is just awesome - much better than the likes of MacAllan or Glenmorangie and other better "marketed" brands . Wish this could be made available at the duty free shops at Delhi, Bangalore and Bombay airports.

1665.Author: Derek Wheeler
1665.Review: There's a lot going on in this dram. A superb aroma as you take a sip, then the flavours race about your mouth one after another in quick succession. A slightly astringent quality hits your tongue as you swallow, leaving a warming finish of chocolate, peat and woodsmoke. Talk among yourselves; I'm off to get another...

1665.Author: Herman Botha
1665.Review: I read all of the above. Wierd mix, if you ask me. Honey, brine oranges, burst fruit, caramel, sea salt. For God's sake people. This is only a very good whiskey. Stop all these nonsense pompous descriptions which are only supposed to boost the ego of the taster!

1665.Author: trebor - kent
1665.Review: Classic Northern Coastal malt. Pale orange colour and full sea salt nose. Starts with touch of orangey sweetness and has a medium long finish of spicy pepper. A unique malt from a treasured distillery and a superb bargain at this price.

1665.Author: Daicos
1665.Review: Spicy, caramel scent with smooth overtones.  Nice single that sips great!

1665.Author: FM
1665.Review: Had this recommended by one of the fine fellows in the Whisky exchange.  Robust, warm and spicy, yet with the gentle peaty, smokyness I was after.  Very, very moreish: I'm having a tough time making it last, had to buy a couple of other malts to do so.  For me, it knocks the socks off any other single malt in this price band I've yet tasted.

1665.Author: davey boy
1665.Review: Great balance and subtle too. Illustrates the difference between Island, Speyside and Highland malts perfectly. A winner.

1665.Author: Anonymous
1665.Review: This scotch is delicious.  Picked it up from the store blindly, wanting to try a new kind of scotch (I'm a Chivas Regal fan normally) and this has won me over.

1665.Author: David
1665.Review: Absolutely fantastic whisky, my auntie brought me a bottle back from scotland when they went on holiday, and the bottle was gone within about two weeks.  I don't know all of the fancy words to describe it but it was the nicest I have tried so far.

1665.Author: Anonymous
1665.Review: This is my first attempt at a single malt.  In my amateur opinion, Clynelish has a full flavor taste with zero bite or burn.  I now know what all the noise is about.  Though I will now try other brands, Clynelish is the name that I will remember as the single malt that got me into quality whiskey.

1665.Author: Anonymous
1665.Review: I was given a very generous measure of Clynelish last night. This is by far the most yummy , easily sipped, single malt I have tasted  very mellow to start,followed by a flavour of burst fruit and finally the much appreciated very warming glow very moreish!!

1665.Author: Anonymous
1665.Review: One of the most pleasant surprises I've ever had when trying a new single malt.  The stronger than expected bitterness on the finish was a bit of a surprise at first, but it contrasts brilliantly with the rounded sweetness of the initial taste, and I very quickly came to appreciate this expression on its own terms.  Will no doubt appeal more to those who prefer a more full-bodied, upfront, single malt.

2393.Author: DUP
2393.Review: Yes, sweet and smooth but below expectations. Am I the only one to find some undesired wood in aftertaste ?

2393.Author: Kain
2393.Review: A smooth almost magical tasting Scotch. A great casual drink.

2393.Author: Anonymous
2393.Review: The perfect easy-drinking malt. Smooth and spicy, with apples and pears. Hard to beat.

2393.Author: James P
2393.Review: A nice drink with a wonderful finish.

2393.Author: Luc
2393.Review: This one never disappoints

2393.Author: Sam T
2393.Review: Very impressed!

2393.Author: Mik
2393.Review: Very very good !!!

2393.Author: Toby Castor
2393.Review: Super smooth... I love this whiskey.

2393.Author: Ding174@aol.com
2393.Review: It's a single malt that taste like a single malt should.  Enough spice for me to say aaaahyesss!  And just the right hit when I fell it going down.  The buzz is pleasantly warming and after a dram or two I wake up up clear headed.  And it goes extremely well with my favorite cigar.  While my 12 year old Yamasaki  is smooth and sweet the livet 12 has just enough kick to remind you it's a speyside scotch.

2393.Author: Eliudmulla
2393.Review: Very super malt smooth taste

2393.Author: G brown
2393.Review: Best I have ever drank. So smooth

2393.Author: Tam the Maltman
2393.Review: Beautifully smooth and pleasing in the pallet

2393.Author: Michael Veitch
2393.Review: I cannot be without this wonderful amber nectar, 38 years of fantastic whisky

2393.Author: Roy
2393.Review: There are a few classic malts and this is no exception. Superb far superior to the no age statement that replaced it . Bring it back please for everyone.

2393.Author: Blake
2393.Review: I was a MacAllan 12 man, but Glenluver has won me over. So smooth.

2393.Author: Sandeep
2393.Review: Excellent malt. Not overly complex

2393.Author: Erma
2393.Review: First time Scotch drinker here this is extremely smooth would recommend for anyone wanting to try Scotch for the first time

2393.Author: Anonymous
2393.Review: Enjoyed the clean, delicate flavors.  Very smooth and pleasing.

2393.Author: peela
2393.Review: its smooth excellent flavor no comparison with other scotch the best.

2393.Author: James Kendrick
2393.Review: I’m an American, however, my heritage is of Scots/Cherokee from many years ago! I live in Athens, Ga. after my time in the Army. I have always loved Scotch Whiskey, then I tried this 12, and now I will not drink anything else. Superb!!!!!

2393.Author: Anonymous
2393.Review: I don’t know much about scotch at all, but this stuff is delicious. Very smooth.

2393.Author: Allikerdup
2393.Review: Like nothing I've ever tasted!

2393.Author: Anonymous
2393.Review: Just tried a slug. "Long, gently warming finish." Yes.

2393.Author: Jeremy
2393.Review:
I agree with what most others have said about this whisky this is a good whisky to have if you can't afford expensive whiskys.
This is a very good and easy to drink whisky.
The only thing I find slightly different to other opnions written here is that I find this whisky to be Semi Sweet and not 100% sweet as previous reviewers have said.

2393.Author: Steven Scot Hill
2393.Review: The most excellent Scotch ever!  Im half Scottish and English.  But I swear to my ancestors that this is the best ever!!!!

2393.Author: Earl M. Inge, Sr.
2393.Review: I cannot discern all the tastes that some others describe with such precision and  clarity.  I just know the taste is extremely smooth and to my liking.   I wish I could afford to drink this all the time.  I love single malt Scotch and this is among the best I have tasted.

2393.Author: Jake Nulty
2393.Review:
I am a typical peat head so I wasn't expecting to be too wowed. This is a very good speyside. It is soft and sweet as to be expected, but also complex enough that I'm not bored.

Nose: Flowers, cream, pears, green apples

Palate: Soft and creamy, then spicy a citrus fading into peppermint

Finish: Oranges and lemons, the cream comes back, then more spices and peppermint teeter tottering back and forth with the citrus and just a hint of copper

2393.Author: Daniel G
2393.Review: This it another of my favourite single malts, it's very smooth and moorish, I find I drink it quite quickly, I only drink this on special occasions as it such a good quality, I would advise this as a gift

2393.Author: Chungstick
2393.Review: The 12 is a definite stand by in my collection. For those of us that collect and drink scotch but can't afford 300 dollar bottles, this is one of those drams that needs to be in the cupboard. It's not the greatest whisky around, but it is very good and very smooth. Vanilla and fruit abound. Not a lot of depth to it, but a fantastically easy drinker at a very nice price

2393.Author: Anonymous
2393.Review: Amazingly sweet! And great value for money too. Love the floral notes. Very easy to drink with tastes of fruit, apple, pear. Lovely.

2393.Author: M?rio Louro
2393.Review: I like very much i worked in 1975 in Blandy brothers in lisbon Extraordinary for me

2393.Author: Anonymous
2393.Review: Very good

2393.Author: Anonymous
2393.Review: Smooth, sweet and delicious.

2393.Author: Timothy
2393.Review: One of the best single malt's of Speyside, superb balance and finish, sad too see it decommissioned in the UK.

2393.Author: Anonymous
2393.Review: Smooth, great finish

2393.Author: Scott
2393.Review: Beautiful bouquet, the body is a smooth and inviting.Slight floral scent and citrus comes through at the end.. alcohol is a little lacking in the mix.

2393.Author: Anonymous
2393.Review: I never thought I could be a scotch drinker until I ditched my go to bourbon and tried this stuff. Nice flavore fruity finish fantastic!

2393.Author: Anonymous
2393.Review: Easy sipping great finish

2393.Author: Jimmy the drill
2393.Review: This is my new favourite Scotch. gentle, extremely smooth and so moreish that I had to seriously discipline myself not to make half a bottle disappear very easily.

2393.Author: Andrew
2393.Review: With citrus notes, almond and hazelnut. Not smoky at all. But good option for killing a bottle with friend :)

2393.Author: Lee Larson
2393.Review: Finest Scotch whiskey I've ever had in my life.

2393.Author: Anonymous
2393.Review: I don't know what it used to be but I had 3 bottles in the last year (2016) and it's just an average whisky now. On nose, vanilla and green apples. On palate, honey and apples. Development is negligible. Finish is unnoticeable.

2393.Author: Jay
2393.Review: If you take honey and add it to immature spirt this is what you get.  Thank god I got a free dram.  It's still better than mass produced american spirits though.

2393.Author: Henry
2393.Review: Amazing and smooth, mild smokey taste with a complexity to the flavours. Slight taste of orange and peach. The bartender made a mistake and accidentially gave me a glass of this, and I fell in love with it instantly.

2393.Author: Ken
2393.Review: A smooth single malt. fruity with a touch of orange and a slight smoky taste. The finish is long, and has a nice warm feeling.  Great for a cold winters night!

2393.Author: Anonymous
2393.Review: Smooth!

2393.Author: Mackenzie
2393.Review: Smooth and tasty, easiest way of describing it, a great whisky for someone new to the spirit

2393.Author: Anonymous
2393.Review: I just received a bottle of this for my birthday. This is the first single malt I ever tasted many years ago before I graduated from blends. While my tastes have since grown more sophisticated I can still appreciate how good this whisky is. You can find it in every liquor store in America and on the top shelf of most bars. It deserves to be there. In my opinion you will discover better malts as your tastes change but there will never be a better introduction to the world of single malt scotch whisky

2393.Author: MCJ
2393.Review: I am used to drinking blended Johnny Walker Black.  Until now that is. This is the smoothest scotch I've ever had.

2393.Author: Dave
2393.Review: A smooth whisky with an inner warm satisfying feel of contentness

2393.Author: A. Wahrhaftig
2393.Review: ... it seemed too malty at first. After I gave it three more tries, I sure noticed some more tinges, but couldn't get rid of this "beerish" trace. Is it what experts call "sweetness", I just wonder :)

2393.Author: K. E. Davis
2393.Review: A beautiful whisky.  Delicate and smooth. The nose is sweet cream and almonds, definitely pear.  On the mouth...honey, vanilla and toffee with a bit plums.  The finish is mellow. Not intense but very satisfying.  The toffee lingers. Warm with a subtle taste of buttery biscuits.  The Glenlivet is exquisite and is simply the genuine article and should be expected in any public house or bar in any good town or borough in any country or state.

2393.Author: Jason
2393.Review: Not every scotch, in order to be great, needs to be some psychotic smoke-bomb from Islay that leaves one feeling like their drank liquefied fireplace. Glenlivet is a fine Scotch, bright and inviting, with some pronounced floral notes on the nose, and a gentle smoothness. Scotch snobbery results in missing out on the full spectrum of what scoth whisky has to offer. Give this one a try - affordable, welcoming, delicious.

2393.Author: Matthijs
2393.Review: Nicely priced. A bit of a beginner''s single malt to be honest. Light, vanilla but not very distinguished. It''s a good solid whisky, but didn''t give me a "special" feeling.

2393.Author: Santanu
2393.Review: I am so disappointed with this product. It''s finish and flavors were not even beating usual blended whiskeys.

2393.Author: Brends
2393.Review: The best nose, palate, aftertaste and kick! What else should I say?

2393.Author: Anonymous
2393.Review: Swave!!!

2393.Author: Anonymous
2393.Review: Smooth and flavoursome.

2393.Author: Anurag Jagroop
2393.Review: Splendid.

2393.Author: Brends
2393.Review: Mellow delivery with a heavenly kick!

2393.Author: Jake
2393.Review: First time trying this whiskey. Generally I''m a cognac drinker but tonight while at the bar this bottle of Glenlivet 12 just kept staring at me so I tried it. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. This is a damn good drink.

2393.Author: Robert of Ham
2393.Review: Sometimes a lighter, smoother whiskey is desired and when it is, Glenlivet 12 fits the bill. I enjoy all ranges of smokiness in a Scotch, but not all the time. Glenlivet 12 never disappoints.

2393.Author: Jamie
2393.Review: Frankly I''m a bit disappointed with Glenlivet 12yo, its mellow and light, but simple and almost tasteless.

2393.Author: Mikko
2393.Review: This maybe great for beginners but whisky enthusiasts do not approve. Very plain and simple, an industrial standard single malt.

2393.Author: S/F Brian Durrant
2393.Review: I received this has a Christmas gift from a good friend. And as soon as it entered my mouth I just knew that this was a very, very good whisky. Thanks you very much and I will be buying it again.

2393.Author: Anonymous
2393.Review: A Scotch I actually enjoy more with ice. Typically I will add a few drops filtered water to my whiskers, but actually I find the Glenlivet 12 to be too harsh this way. With a large cube of ice, suddenly the liquor is creamy and of tart apple. Very curious.

2393.Author: Pat 18/09/2014
2393.Review: No doubt as soon as it touches your taste buds you will know this is quality and smooth, cannot imagine it being better with a longer maturation.

2393.Author: Craig Bryant
2393.Review:
I really like the sweetness of Speyside whiskys and this certainly doesn't disappoint.  Colour is bright with shimmering gold. Nose is of a summer meadow with ripe fruits. Palate is again ripe fruit wirh fresh but sweet notes. Could perhaps be a little smoother for my palate. Finish is long with hints of fresh coconut and a hint of almonds.

For the price and age this is a lovely dram. Like I said could maybe be a tiny bit smoother on the palate but nothing to really gripe about and I'm probably being rather picky! Maybe competes with my favourite Old Pulteney 12 - although they are very different whiskys !

2393.Author: Tom
2393.Review: Fairly new to this whisky lark, I'd been avoiding paying for the more common malts, wanting to get a taste for the more unusual, and so I imagined, the more interesting. However, I picked up a bottle of this cheap last week, and now all I want is more of it. It's delicious. You can drink it neat as a warming nightcap or with a couple of ice cubes if you're after something a bit fresher. Ice, rather than spoiling it, brings out a different taste altogether. Very, very impressed.

2393.Author: Johnny Norfolk
2393.Review: Great whisky, great value. With all its history it is still the malt to beat. I would recomend it without reservation.

2393.Author: Tommy
2393.Review: Very creamy and fruity, somewhat complex. Very pleasant drink without doubt.

2393.Author: Anonymous
2393.Review: A great whisky at a great price. Very approachable.

2393.Author: Anonymous
2393.Review: A very nice drink indeed, no burnt barrel taste and no taste of peat. A very nice smooth whiskey.

2393.Author: Mikko
2393.Review: Plain and simple indeed, but I like that cocoa-mint-cream nose.

2393.Author: Anonymous
2393.Review: It's a great entry single malt however I find it rather bland compared to such as bushmills 10yo and singleton.

2393.Author: Anonymous
2393.Review: Great Speysider for the money, plain and simple.

2393.Author: Anonymous
2393.Review: Got to be one of the best Speys going. Sure, you can try lots of other malts, but i bet you will be returning to this one time and time again. Georgious. Much better than Glenfiddich IMO.

2393.Author: Anderson
2393.Review: Optimises the standard in everything I look for in a Speyside single malt, just drink and enjoy. Creamy and smooth, subtle yet rich-underlying flavour, however not too subtle that's it's watery - just perfect. Always provides for me a bubbly happy level of tipsiness.

2393.Author: Grant Melville, Falkirk
2393.Review: The floral explosion definitely sells this one to me, it has a very distinctive flavour.  I'd highly recommend it!

2393.Author: MK
2393.Review:
As far as 12 year old Speysides go, I prefer Linkwood 12yo (though it is also more expensive).
Glenlivet 12 does have those flowery, malty dryness notes. But definitely no peaches and no vanilla. If not for the lovely warming finish, this would have been a little disappointing.

2393.Author: mark brailsford
2393.Review: I cannot believe someone thinks JW black is better than this! GL is a malt of the highest quality. Try the 18yr old...sublime!!

2393.Author: JR
2393.Review: Once upon a time, my love of Bourbon convinced me that I would never like the taste of Scotch of any type - full stop. Until that magical day when I opened up a bottle of this that my girlfriend had been given as a gift many years ago and hey presto! - my taste buds were conquered. A lovely drink that you will never know if you do not try.

2393.Author: jon 05/08/11
2393.Review: 1st time i've bought this and impressed.  coming off a few of the islay single malts this was a pleasant change.  very smooth with plenty of sherry and not too much of the malty dryness.  a fan!

2393.Author: Manu
2393.Review: I see what you mean, Richard. Glenfiddich is more fruity and 'ripe' on the nose than the Glenlivet. It also has a slight touch of smoke, which is absent in the Glenlivet. However, I find the Glenlivet more complex and ultimately a bit more satisfying. They're both really good though and deserve their popularity. Keep an eye out for the Glenlivet 12 First Fill - it's better than the regular 12.

2393.Author: Richard Murfin
2393.Review: Voicing the many others I'd have to agree on the nose. Flowery and vanillery ( if thats a word) . It is smooth and easy to drink. It leans towards a floral taste, yet its mildly sharp, bitter and acidic. It's not a bad tasting 12 year old but there are better options out there. If you are going to buy a 12 year old Scotch in this price bracket in opt for Glenfiddich....of course its all subjective.

2393.Author: Anonymous
2393.Review: agree with most of the above, those who like it, that is, the glenlivet 12 is a classic speysider, period.

2393.Author: Anonymous
2393.Review: Not really a Speyside fan but got bought this for my birthday last year and it's certainly not unpleasent.

2393.Author: LegTaste
2393.Review: Probably ideal for people new to whisky or those who dont enjoy stronger flavours.Just in case Jason (further up) scared anyone off, dont worry, this whisky isn't chewy, it is indeed a liquid.

2393.Author: KILLJOY306
2393.Review: Beautiful  whisky. simply the best thats all i have to say

2393.Author: Ronnie From Missouri,  USA.
2393.Review: `First Single Malt I Tried...Smooth and enjoyable.. BUT I am also tasting Johnnie Walker Black. To me JW Black Label is so much better,especially for about the same price..

2393.Author: Iain
2393.Review: Bought it on offer for 20 quid, not too bad but after trying Ardbeg and Glenmorangie Quinta Ruban and Lasanta I would rather spend the extra few ponuds and buy any one of them. Pretty standard stuff and nothing to rave about.

2393.Author: Ian
2393.Review: Standard top shelf fare that should offend no reasonable palate. I grew up drinking this and it still oils the wheels of business for me.

2393.Author: Derek Wheeler
2393.Review: One of the first single malts I tried (of many); The Glenlivet remains one of my favourites to this day. No need to over analyse it, just drink and enjoy all it has to offer. An enduring classic.

2393.Author: Anonymous
2393.Review: Great taste, smooth and easy drinking.  No hangover at all. Posted by: Deepak

2393.Author: Jason's Scotch Whisky reviews
2393.Review: Palate (without water/ice)Medium bodied, chewy, dark toast, cinnamon rolls, fresh bread, a little apple, and plenty of dark plums.Finish (without water/ice)Fresh ground pepper on the finish with gentle sherry notes and a maltiness that hangs on the palate for quite a while.

2393.Author: Smithery-Baggins
2393.Review: Very good whiskey, similar to Glenfiddich 12 but better as this is not quite as fuity so it doesn't mask the oak flavor.

2393.Author: Anonymous
2393.Review: Very sweet beautiful caramel, florral, vanilla

2393.Author: Mr Pickles
2393.Review: Sweet and juicy with a long, fruity finish. An enduring classic.

2393.Author: Drums
2393.Review: Great introductory single malt. You can't go wrong with this for a great value whisky. Yes, florally, vanilla on the nose, soft well-balanced palate and smooth

2393.Author: s,p,bristol (badger)
2393.Review: Enjoyed this malt,very impressed by its complexity,smooth to drink,floral on the nose with hints of vanilla and maybe a subtle burst of chocolate,all the same a very nice dram.

2393.Author: Anonymous
2393.Review: Very smooth and easy drinking. I'd say the aroma is more caramel/vanilla than flowery, but that's just me.

2393.Author: davey boy
2393.Review: A touch of water can release more flavour i agree. Just don't put ice in it ! A fan of this but lacks big enough flavours for me i go elsewhere for my thrills ...

2393.Author: Kim
2393.Review: One of the best things I've ever tasted. Rich, smooth and gorgeous. A real classic.

2393.Author: Stephen Williams
2393.Review: I purchased a bottle of this over ten years ago and am drinking it as I type. Its as smooth as the day is long and the flavour is excellent.

2393.Author: Anonymous
2393.Review: A classic never disappoints, do not let others say thisis not a challenging single malt. It is consistent andelegant in flavor ...no need to look further, its perfect.

2393.Author: Fraser
2393.Review: The proper way to spell it is whisky, the proper way to taste it is with half a teaspoon of cold water,,,,

2393.Author: matt13
2393.Review: Lovely whiskey and very smooth but, for the same money, I'd recommend Glenfiddich or The Balvenie.And don't we all drink whiskey neat???

2393.Author: Venezolano
2393.Review: I had some of this whisky and it's taste was very pleasant, smells like a combination of fruits the the finish is warm and somewhat dry but you can taste it's full flavor in the finish, very good whisky for the money. I drank it neat.

2393.Author: MIke
2393.Review: Fantastic for the money, very rich and flavourful.

2393.Author: Bryan Molinelli
2393.Review: Complex aperitif whiskey, with a fragrant nose and incredibly smooth finish. Probably the finest whiskey I've ever tasted.

2393.Author: Ernie Hulme
2393.Review: A fine malt, with a dry body. Fragrant with a smooth finish. Unique taste coming from the springwater of Josies Well.

27394.Author: Mario
27394.Review: Definitely one of the best whiskeys I ever tried! LOVE IT!!

27394.Author: Full of flavour
27394.Review: Never tried this before and don't see it too often, don't know why it's fantastic

27394.Author: Whiskycoffeerum
27394.Review: What a find !!! Such depth of flavour and character... my favourite Speyside for sure.

27394.Author: Simon
27394.Review: A lovely first Father's Day gift. Add a drop of water to bring out the flavours.

27394.Author: Anonymous
27394.Review: My first bottle and now my favourite Speyside, on first view looks like a lightweight but quite the reverse!

27394.Author: Trevor Birch
27394.Review: This is a pleasure to drink one of the best malts I've had

27394.Author: James
27394.Review: This is my favourite Scotch in the world, So elegant,smooth, and layer upon layer of subtle flavours. Just brilliant

27394.Author: Anonymous
27394.Review: Very clean taste, and very good value for money. Easily the best bottle of whisky i've bought.

27394.Author: Bivirgerry
27394.Review: I was VERY surprised when Foggie became one of my favourite whisky just by 1, FIRST portion..!!

27394.Author: Tony M
27394.Review: Light, fresh and tangy. Nice for me to move away from the sherry flavours, this is a great summer Whisky. One of my favourite bottle designs also. Expensive here in Oz but worthy addition to collection

27394.Author: R mcDonald
27394.Review: Great to see Aultmore updated and re-packaged,A wonderful Speysider light and smooth and with a hint of smokiness i detect in the finish.Lovely but pricey for a 12 year old is my only gripe.Less is more if you want to sell shed loads chaps !! work it out!!

27394.Author: Mark
27394.Review: Fast becoming one of my favourites. Beautifully light and creamy. Fantastic value. Great-looking bottle too.

27394.Author: Stewart Orr
27394.Review: I'm not sufficiently experienced to really give justice to the tasting notes, however it was a very pleasant experience and of course very more-ish that alone gives it my 5stars

27394.Author: Damian
27394.Review: Incredible whisky... Explosive Flavour and so well structured.

27394.Author: Anonymous
27394.Review: I agree with the tasting notes, deliciously clean and fruity , a lovely whisky, would recommend!

34497.Author: Eve
34497.Review: Yes, I have tried Glenfiddich IPA several times it's great. I   also tried the 18, 15, and 12 years, but I prefer the IPA

34497.Author: Rhi White
34497.Review: I am shocked! Wonderful, great stuff! It was an explosion in my mouth of wonderful flavors combined together.

34497.Author: Anonymous
34497.Review: Definitely a winner I would call it a dessert scotch it definitely has a slight influence of the hops hope it becomes a regular in the gf stable it's damn good

34497.Author: Bacon Fries
34497.Review: I had high hopes for this, and it is fine, but expensive for a whiskey which lacks any depth. It tastes young and has no level of flavours. The idea is great, but the actual execution is lacking.

34497.Author: kev c
34497.Review: This whisky is fantastic !  Wonderful sharp citrus then amazing warm sweet toffee finish that is very moreish .  This is a winning combination.

34497.Author: Glen D
34497.Review: Delicious scotch, preferred it over the 18 year!

34497.Author: BARRY STANTON
34497.Review: Beautifull warm malt...i got most of the flavours listed in the tasting notes.. would purchase again

34497.Author: costaycampo
34497.Review: I loved the rich slightly thick taste and texture a real must try.

34497.Author: Brian
34497.Review: Very good

34497.Author: David Wynn
34497.Review: An interesting, smooth and satisfying whisky.  Good enough that I've bought 2 now!

34497.Author: LOKNES
34497.Review: Just into my first few pours of this one and it is extremely good for an NAS scotch. I do enjoy craft beer from local breweries here in Ontario Canada and don't really fine much in the way of a hops influence in this so far. I would highly recommend if you like something a little different but delicious.

34497.Author: Anonymous
34497.Review: It is quite lovely.

34497.Author: Anonymous
34497.Review: Quite delightful

34497.Author: Anonymous
34497.Review: Very pleased.

34497.Author: Tim
34497.Review: Excellent! Exactly what you expect from a Glenfiddich but with something else. More rounded flavours and a little more citrus. No beer here but can see what has been done. Defiantly worth a go!!!

34497.Author: Laurence Smith
34497.Review: I have just sampled Glenfiddich IPA and am very pleased with it.  The hoppiness may be a challenge for some, but to an old beer drinker, no challenge at all.  It makes a terrific sweetener for black coffee.  The price per bottle is very acceptable.  This is a good product and well worth keeping on hand in the liquor cabinet.  I will buy it again

34497.Author: Matthew Butterly
34497.Review: Superb whisky smooth flavoured and full of character will buy again

34497.Author: Anonymous
34497.Review: Really nice! Took a gamble on this, and glad I did

34497.Author: Anonymous
34497.Review: Exceptional will definitely buy again

34497.Author: Anonymous
34497.Review: A real effin' disappointment. Only good for cleaning carburetors. It's crap.

34497.Author: ChiccoZonca
34497.Review:
The idea was interesting but the result exceed all the expectations: a fantastic surprise!!!
Excellent whiskey at the beginning with a distinct but also simple aroma and later some slightly bitter, floral and spicy notes typical of the IPA beers emerge.
A fantastic idea to follow for a fantastic product!

34497.Author: Anonymous
34497.Review: Divine sips! Much better than I could have hoped for.

34497.Author: Anonymous
34497.Review: Definite noticeable interesting aroma. Smooth, worth picking up a bottle if you have the spare cash to try something different but not something I'll be buying again.

34497.Author: SwissBrit
34497.Review: A fantastic Whisky far better than expected. We were instantly warmed by the idea of an IPA cask but great for those whom aren't even an IPA drinker (It doesn't taste of beer!) . Oily, smooth and great taste throughout. I'll be stock piling if this one is only around for a short time!

34497.Author: Anonymous
34497.Review: One of the best drinks I have ever had.  The IPA infusion really makes this drink something else.  Perfect for a warm evening sat outside

34497.Author: Brain
34497.Review:
Really nice. 
Enjoyed it flavour. Better than i expected.good taste

34497.Author: Darren Wynn
34497.Review: Phenomenal. I get, for some reason, marzipan and cherry, almost like an amaretto, on the nose and taste, but that may be my palate rather than what was intended! As much as I enjoy good whiskies, I would profess to be an expert.

34497.Author: Rich b
34497.Review: I personally do get the note of molt on the pallet however I expected a little bit more complexity to be honest not bad though by any means

34497.Author: Alan Tusa
34497.Review: This is great  I usually like smokey peaty scotch. I'll make a rare exception in this case want at least 2 more bottles

34497.Author: AB
34497.Review: Bourbon nose and first sip. Unusual. Glenfiddich comes through after. No real IPA or hoppy notes. Quality, yes. Interesting, yes. Traditional, no.

34497.Author: Nick Dawson
34497.Review: Nice smooth dram. Good fruity nose followed by smooth, sweet taste with a hint of lemon zest. Long smooth slightly malty finish but little hint of the IPA it was named after. Worth adding to your cupboard

34497.Author: Phil
34497.Review: Won this bottle from a bet with my father. Very glad I won! Sweet at first then hips the roof of your mouth followed by a dry and yes slightly hoppy after taste. I will try and win it again.

34497.Author: Anonymous
34497.Review: Very good taste. Excellent!

34497.Author: James
34497.Review: Interesting whisky; definitely tangy with a lovely spice to it.  Not what I was expecting but very nice indeed. Glad they went for 43% abv, cannot tell the age though!

7957.Author: Anonymous
7957.Review: Excellent. Great value. Better than many more expensive scotch.

7957.Author: Anonymous
7957.Review: Very smooth and flavorful. A little spice under the tongue. I don't usually like lowlands, so this was a very pleasant surprise.

7957.Author: Highlander
7957.Review: Lovely dram this one..the Oloroso andP.X sherry maturation really works wonders!!!Amazing value for money...highly recommend!!!!

7957.Author: Anonymous
7957.Review: This is a whisky that is bold and complex. It is perfect for those moments when one wants to sit and relax for a few minutes.

7957.Author: Anonymous
7957.Review: The only Scotch whiskey I have found to be that smooth. My favorite along with Bunnahabain.

7957.Author: Anonymous
7957.Review: Really enjoy this whiskey. Easy drink and very relaxing. I would buy it again

7957.Author: william
7957.Review: excellent whisky lovely taste

7957.Author: Bobk
7957.Review: The best scotch I have ever had the honor to open and drink!

7957.Author: Nick Ankers
7957.Review: Your description is spot on - to keep it simple I'd say "think christmas pudding".  A great whisky for anyone starting out on the whisky appreciation trail.

7957.Author: Colin
7957.Review: I firmly believe there's a scotch for everyone. This will suit those who don't think they like scotch, but who equate scotch with peat and smoke. Sweet, fruity, buttery, delicious. When your friend says, I don't really like scotch, give them a dram of this, and watch their face as they change their mind.

7957.Author: Stephen
7957.Review: Excellent!  Very smooth and easy to drink.

7957.Author: Gary
7957.Review: I found this whisky quite disappointing.  Tasted very one dimensional.  Smells like prunes, tastes like cinnamon.  Not much else going on as far as I'm concerned.

7957.Author: Jeremy
7957.Review:
This is a excellent whisky
Great color and taste!
It is easy to drink.
my only very small problem with it is that it is not as sweet as the 12 year old.

7957.Author: Jaker
7957.Review: brine and tobacco with a long hazelnut finish

7957.Author: H K Han
7957.Review: Three Wood has been my single malt of choice for a while - as I enjoy its complex rich flavor that is a mixture of caramel, raisins and and overtone of citrus - long lasting and satisfying.....

7957.Author: Anonymous
7957.Review: With first bottle opening a dank wet forest/wood smell. Could not appreciate this again with subsequent pours. Very nice, smooth character. The finish had a very pleasant tobacco flavor for me.

7957.Author: Anonymous
7957.Review: Lovely, had it in Edinburgh and couldn't get over the smoothness. The finish lingers pleasantly.

7957.Author: Anonymous
7957.Review: One of my favorites. Great price point for this scotch.

7957.Author: Steve
7957.Review: Sweet and chocolate on the nose - after that it's all gold!

7957.Author: Trey
7957.Review: Lovely scotch. Nice flavor, easy to swish around.  No spicy burning when swallowing.

7957.Author: Jacob Rivera
7957.Review: Well priced but I find it a bit overpowering with cinnamon

7957.Author: Craig P
7957.Review: Just want to say, anyone on here who uses the word Peat in a review on this obviously has real no idea, this is a fantastic Whisky, arguably my favourite ever, but if you do a tour of the distillery which is just outside of Glasgow, you will find that it's the only tripple distilled Whisky producer in Scotland and that NO PEAT is used in any of their produce, its a gas powered distillery, I'd highly recommend doing a tour of the place if you get chance as they have some other wonderful produce and this was the highlight of my visit to Scotland...

7957.Author: Varley
7957.Review: Yes, it's a NAS and yes it's a bit on the light side but this is still a very enjoyable malt. The peat-freaks won't like it but anyone else who enjoys a red berrie crumble topped with syrup will love it. I know I do...

7957.Author: Ribas
7957.Review: Very good!

7957.Author: Mac Monet
7957.Review: Very good! I experiment with many flavors of Single Malt and this one is a keeper.

7957.Author: Johnny rebbo
7957.Review: Best under ?50 whiskey I have experienced in 15 years of drinkink whiskey.

7957.Author: Nick
7957.Review: Floral notes on the nose. Quite a bit of burn. Dry finish. Medium length palate. Relatively smooth and comparable to a 5-6 yr old.

7957.Author: Graham
7957.Review: Very nice.

7957.Author: Jason Debly
7957.Review:
"Nose" (undiluted)
Peat and floral.  Really floral.  Fragrant.

"Palate" (undiluted)
Sweet, smooth entry of chocolate, hazelnuts, malty notes, with oak and subtle orange rind.

"Finish" (undiluted)
Sherry/raisin, black grapes and peat.  Some black coffee.

7957.Author: tHe_tRaNs1eNt
7957.Review: My favorite Scotch so far.  I moved onto scotch to try something different (perhaps better) than the fine cognac's I am fan of. At first I almost went back to cognac's since I like the sweetness. My first introduction to Scotch was The Glen livet 12, and 15, which were okay. Than the McCallan 12 (and also 15 I believe) which were also just okay  as well. Than GlenMorangie 10 year which was a bit too mellow and fruity for me, not very complex. Then I found AUCHENTOSHAN THREE WOOD (which had no indication as to how old it was) this is THE CHAMP!!! This is the best cognac like Scotch, yet more complex with better and more variety of flavor notes. I won't go into all the different flavors, it seems to vary among different individuals. All I have to say is if you like sweet and malty notes (among others), rich and complex, but smooth with just enough bite, this is it.  Thank You Auchentoshan now lower the price a bit $58 for 750ml makes me limit my consumption. Five Stars.

7957.Author: I like it
7957.Review: I like it.

7957.Author: JJ
7957.Review: Has a rum like smell, nail polish remover, thick chocolate ganash, sherry, green apples, blackberry, toffee. Smooth on palate, no real after burn. Nice bottle.

7957.Author: DRS
7957.Review: Raiseney sweetness and spicy flavours. One of the best I''ve had.

7957.Author: Mr. Reeds
7957.Review:
Beautiful Fruity & Dark Chocolaty Dram!
A must have for your collection!

7957.Author: Michael (Houston, Texas) USA
7957.Review: This Scothc is amazing for just something to sit back and enjoy - whether woman or man - nothing better than this scotch, your hot wife next to you, and smoking cigars together and enjoying this fine Three Wood.   It''s something that both of you can enjoy.   After many trips to Scotland, this is something we both enjoy together!  We will order many more bottles.

7957.Author: Ken.       Aberdeen
7957.Review: Where  have you been all my life .........?    As a big follower of the Islay's and the Macallan's  this was an unexpected Christmas present. It tastes great, and full of high sherry notes and long after tastes of thick dark  spicy chocolate and hazelnut, very slightly bitter at the end, but that's probably a personal note, which is what it's all about any way.  Very impressed.

7957.Author: Dave H
7957.Review: I'm fairly new to whisky but this was recommended and was by far the smoothest I've tried. Dangerously so, as one painful morning revealed. It's not stopping me buying another bottle, though.

7957.Author: Scotch Fan
7957.Review: Unbalanced and awkward dram with particularly strange notes on the nose. Not what you would typically expect from Auchentoshan. I don't understand this Three Wood expression winded up with multiple gold medals, maybe the bottle that I purchased was bunk? At any rate, after finishing a bottle of Laphroaig Three Wood, this was a major disappointment. I guess you get what you pay for...

7957.Author: Al
7957.Review:
So is this a 12 year old then? The guy in the shop said it was a 9 I believe (I know, that is rare).

Great aroma and aftertaste, very smooth I miss a heavier body though... Could this be because of not being quite and old whisky? Is it just a Lowland thing?

I suppose the reply Dave Worthington got was right anyway...

Don't miss out on the Fino wine scent on the cork!

7957.Author: Pat
7957.Review: old fashioned three wood is epic.

7957.Author: Anonymous
7957.Review: This one here is a TRUE VALUE! If you are a sherryhead, well, price wise it doesent get any better. BIG sherry, Big cream, SUPER sweet. if your not into any of those profiles, stay away, if you DO LIKE them, well, your in for a real treat. Definateley a desert scotch as the PX does wonders for this malt and it is one that I'll continue to stock.

7957.Author: Ivor Kirkpatrick
7957.Review: I am lucky to have about 70 different malts to choose from, but for a winter warmer by a peat fire this is the one.  I have the Malt so where is that peat fire.

7957.Author: Jason's Scotch Whisky Reviews
7957.Review:
"Nose" (undiluted): Peat and floral.  Really floral.  Fragrant.
"Palate" (undiluted): Sweet, smooth entry of chocolate, hazelnuts, malty notes, with oak and subtle orange rind. "Finish" (undiluted):
Sherry/raisin, black grapes and peat.  Some black coffee.

7957.Author: Dave Worthington
7957.Review: I wrote to Auchentoshan and asked what age this whisky was. They kindly replied that this was a 12 year old whisky, matured for 10 years in bourbon casks then finished for one year in Oloroso Sherry and then one year in Pedro Ximenez Sherry. Just opening my bottle now.....

7957.Author: TWE Admin
7957.Review: HH Blair: They don't list an age, but it isn't a particularly old whisky a far as we know.

7957.Author: HH Blair
7957.Review: How old is this?  Cannot find references to age.  Whilst pleasant flavour notes it is lacks mature depth.

7957.Author: Hunter
7957.Review: Just picked up my third bottle of this, and for good reason. I buy a lot of scotch, and I mean A LOT, but I keep coming back to this one. I've just tried a side-by-side of this against the 'Toshan 12, and the Toshan 18... This still comes out the best.You will not believe this is only a 10 y.o, I've tried 21's that don't hold a candle to this. A truly amazing dram.Pros: Overall character, smooth delivery, great priceCons: 43%? Please Auchentoshan give us a 46% as standard!

7957.Author: The Flying Scotsman
7957.Review: The other night there, I sat down with some Scottish oat cakes, an apricot goats cheese and filled a large sherry glass with some 'Toshan three-wood. It was a deep, delicious, pleasure-giving experience... Slanje...

7957.Author: Davepat
7957.Review: I agree with Steve above, is this the Jack Daniels of the malt world? - a "filtered and fruit fantastic", with a wonderful note of Christmas cake, gentle warmth, my last winter dram as we move into spring at last.

7957.Author: Steve
7957.Review: If I had the pleasure of having this again I'd make sure to hide the bottle. Slightly syrupy and it has this flowery fruity wood flavor that explodes on the palate. I saw on the label that the brand triple distills, but this whisky almost seems charcoal filtered. Very dark, heavy and pungent for a 10 year!

7957.Author: Mark Dermul at Whivie.be
7957.Review: Simply delicious. Much better than the Classic or Select, almost as good as the 12 year old (which I still think is the best in the Toshan range). At this price, a must have!

7957.Author: Dom Olds
7957.Review: A real fan of this one. Very smooth and delightfully fruity taste but still warms the cockles like a good malt should.For me it falls somewhere between the smokey and peaty Lagavulin and the rich fruity Bowmore Dark. Simply superb.

7957.Author: James Saxon
7957.Review: Drink #3: With the help of our dizzyingly (after the first two drinks) knowledgeable guide, we could have sighted the three casks used for this whisky in the cool, alcoholically atmospheric dunnage warehouse. Just gorgeous.

383.Author: Anonymous
383.Review: Discovered this whisky whilst  out and about on trip to Scotland and loved it

383.Author: Anonymous
383.Review: Discovered this gem on a trip to Scotland. Love it and have it shipped to us in the USA. Worth every penny.

383.Author: Peter Kiviat
383.Review: The nicest highland malt I have ever had. Needs a drop of water to let its favor and scents burst forth.  Delivery forecast could stand a little improvement.  My  favorite whisky at any price.

383.Author: Joey
383.Review: I'm from the US. I accidently found this bottle here. It was really good for a 12 years old bottle. Worth every penny. I shared this with my friends and they all love it. I really wish if this can sell in US and can grab it anytime.

383.Author: Peter R
383.Review: I first tried this when I went fly fishing in Scotland.  Our guide asked me what I wanted to drink for lunch.  I suggested red wine.  Every day he asked again.  In the fifth day he asked again.  I answered that I had not had any scotch in over 35 years.  I did not do well with with scotch and it did not do well with me.  He asked me if I would try two fingers and I said yes.  Now i drink it routinely.  By the way the two fingers were from the thumb to the little finger.

383.Author: Anonymous

I agree with the other reviews of the soft fruit flavours but this unlocks a richness all of its own. This will now be a regular resident in my cabinet for Christmas. Up there with the very best on my palate.

383.Author: Marc K.
383.Review: Like it more and more!

383.Author: Will
383.Review: My wife brought this back from Scotland with her and it is an amazing drink. I like Irish whiskey and she thought I would like it.

383.Author: Mojo

383.Author: DAD

383.Author: Anonymous
383.Review: New to whisky but this is really beautiful.

383.Review:
I have bought a bottle during my stay in Scotland last year.
For it''s price it really is a nice tasting Whisky :)

Just ordered 2 more bottles :)

Superb all round quality enjoyed by Llanfair Clybogau
whisky club

383.Review: wow! is all I can say!

383.Author: B. Y. Marshall
383.Review: Best whisky i've ever had.

383.Author: Graham Mercer
383.Review: I tried this at the distillery a month back. It is now one of my favourite malts, stupendous, well balanced, Christmas cake & sherry.

383.Author: Anonymous
383.Review: just came back from Scotland and after touring 20 distilleries this is one of the bottles i brought back only 7,000 made a year

383.Author: Ceilidh Callum lcb
383.Review: Totally fantastic dram . Get one doon yir neck you will no be disapointed

383.Author: D Richards
383.Review: I absolutely love this whisky. Received a bottle for Christmas, and am now struggling not to finsh it too quickly!! Really sweet with honey notes and a long finish. Highly recommended.

383.Author: Anonymous
383.Review: My favourite. Can't bear anything light and 'honeyed', this is slightly caramel on the nose and then it's big, smooth and delightful.

383.Author: Pete Lovell
383.Review: Tried this whisky years ago and thought it was excelent have not seen it for ages, agree with yor comments

383.Author: David
383.Review: Just a brilliant whisky! I love it!

383.Author: Anonymous
383.Review: Yeah!  When can we get this in the states?  We can't afford to go to Scotland every few months to replenish our stock?  If it is sadly neglected, open a new market!!!

383.Author: JBR
383.Review: One of my all time favorites. When will it be state side?

383.Author: Michael Sullivan
383.Review: Looking forward to receiving your wonderful whisky

383.Author: Anonymous
383.Review: Can't fault it. Superb

383.Author: Anonymous
383.Review: its back on my wish list

383.Author: Anonymous
383.Review: flippin lovley

13195.Author: Anonymous
13195.Review: Probably one of the nicest, smoothest and warmest whiskys out there. It's pure bliss in a bottle, not to mention an unusual find. You won't get it in Tesco that's for sure.

13195.Author: Edd
13195.Review: I actually prefer the 10 Year Old Original over this. I had one bottle and although this is excellent but it just isn’t as good, hence 4 stars. I may be in the minority but I feel the Original is the better product. That remains my drink of choice

13195.Author: Anonymous
13195.Review: Taste at it's best

13195.Author: Paul
13195.Review: A lovely enjoyable whisky at a super price.  I'm no expert but I found the style and character references spot on which reflects my high rating.  For my taste however I found it a fraction too sweet.  Even so, have and am enjoying the experience.

13195.Author: Peter
13195.Review: I bought several times at the airport and thoroughly enjoyed it.  It’s been a year since the last one so I picked it up locally and was really disappointed.  Not nearly as good as I remember it

13195.Author: Matthew
13195.Review: Basins, chocolate, and a slight taste of orange.  Very delicious scotch.  Pairs well with a cigar.  One of my personal favorites.

13195.Author: Anonymous
13195.Review: The port comes through strong.  It smells like port and tastes like port.  Which is great!  It carries with it all the complexity of that sweet wine.   All that port flavors comes over, under, and through the Glenmorangie.  It's a cutting taste.  Get it before it's gone!

13195.Author: Matt
13195.Review: I tried this at a high end restaurant recently. After dinner, I immediately bought a bottle! It's luscious, and will be one of my favorites at the sweeter end of the spectrum!

13195.Author: Hazza
13195.Review: This is an excellent whisky to give someone who thinks smooth=good when it comes to whisky. It's 46% so it's far from smooth and yet the taste is so immense and in-your-face that it should be instantly accessible to even the most inexperienced of whisky drinkers. Delicious!

13195.Author: Linate
13195.Review: Best quality whiskey!

13195.Author: Anonymous
13195.Review: If you like Glenmorangie the you'll love this..

13195.Author: Mike W
13195.Review: Extremely good whisky. Best I've tasted so far. The flavor lasts an extremely long time.

13195.Author: Anonymous
13195.Review: Beautiful whisky, elegent taste, quality

13195.Author: Steve Martin
13195.Review: Exceptional whisky, just amazing, ultra smooth, deep  flavours, 10/10.

13195.Author: Egis
13195.Review: Nice

13195.Author: Anonymous
13195.Review: Cask finished whisky has never been my thing.  Even though I prefer big peat and/or sherry maturation, I have a soft spot for the Glenmorangie 10yr original because it is the first single malt that I ever had.  While there are some of the nutty banana flavors of the 10yr present, this stuff is completely different.  In the glass it almost looks like rose wine.  On the nose all I get is fruit.  On the palate there is some spice (nutmeg?) mixed with the fruit.  This is not the fruit of sherry maturation.  It's the kind of sharp sweet/tangy that was present in the fruit punch I loved as a kid.  The finish is sweet and of medium length.  The port is always present throughout.  Overall, this will do nothing to make finished whisky ny favorite.  That being said it's good unique stuff,  that is a nice change of pace from the Islay, coastal and sherry matured whiskies that I love.  I recommend that you give it a try, if you haven't already.

13195.Author: Scott.
13195.Review: To experience the taste notes, you really have to place it on the tip of your tongue. There is orange, raisins and bit of spices.  I thought the smokiness could be improved to increase it a bit more as that would have balanced the sweetness of orange. The sweet aftertaste of orange and raising is a bit overpowering and does injustice to otherwise a great malt.

13195.Author: Arisnotle
13195.Review: Not everyone will like the idea of whiskey with a slightly sweet aftertaste.  With products such as Jack Daniels Honey becoming popular, these drinks seem to be in ascendency. In my opinion, Quinta Ruben is one of the best.

13195.Author: Anonymous
13195.Review: It has a gorgeous faint ros? hue that is bright and clear. On the nose it is floral and fruity, with red berries, honeycrisp apple, watermelon and an allusion to cotton candy. To taste it is quite thick and rich, with a little bit of heat on the tip of the tongue; a sophisticated integration of wood and wine-soaked fruit leads to a long finish with a subtle mint note. Perfect after dessert. It's excellent.

13195.Author: Midnight32
13195.Review: Very fullbodied. Perfect for man company.

13195.Author: Demetri
13195.Review: Lovely rich flavor.  Sweet, but not cloyingly sweet.  I typically enjoy a bit of smoke, but didn't mind its absence in the Quinta Ruban.  No hint of astringency at all.  Finished very smooth.  I kept going back for more which was disappointing since I only had a small taster from a set.  I will definitely pick up a bottle soon.

13195.Author: Christiano
13195.Review: Fruitcake, Christmas spice, bandage, raisin, sweet decadent caramel, thick & syrupy, oak, buttery. This has been my number one Scottish whisky. THE Scotch that got me into scotch.  Even when I got my hands on a bottle of Nectar D'or and I first opened the bottle, QR won. Now that Nectar D'or has sat for about 3 weeks, it has officially settled down and became the nectar that I imaged when I bought it and has officially surpassed QR in taste/aroma. However, you can't beat the quality of QR for the price/availability. It is my favorite Scottish Whiskey, and will forever have a place on my shelf.

13195.Author: Jason Debly
13195.Review:
"Nose" (undiluted)
Orange peel, dark chocolate, faint hospital bandages with medicinal ointment, and freshly turned over, early morning, damp earth, as you hunt for worms for that fishing trip.

"Palate" (undiluted)
Rich, velvety, mouth filling body of loganberry, blackberries, raspberries.  Think Christmas fruitcake with lots of chunks of dark plum, raisins and dark cake bread.

"Finish" (undiluted)
Fantastic finish.  What started initially as sweet quickly became mouth watering, and then dry and by the time you swallow, you are left with dusty apricot and port wine notes.

13195.Author: DrWhisky
13195.Review:
Color: deep and thick gold red. Style: m?dium body and richness without smoke. Nose: full of diferents berries and port wife notes. Palate: sweet and thick. Full of port and diferents berries notes mis and asociares of Orange.
Very good expression of the port Cask extra mature.
Finish: great and prolong port wine notes and a little nut taste. Very good Single Malt Scotch

13195.Author: Shea in Tulsa
13195.Review: I doubt that there is a scotch or Irish Whiskey under $300 that I haven't purchased a bottle of or at least tried at my whisky watering hole.  There have been many a dram sampled above that price range in the last 3 years.  Without question, and by far, this is the best of the bunch.  I love the Macallan 25 year old Sherry Cask, but it doesn't hold a candle to this diamond in the rough.  It won't be my sole whisky on the shelf.  I'll have a Redbreast 12, a Midleton rare, a Balvenie 12, and this bottle.  I'll say this though, I can live without the others if I run out.  I will not wait to run out of this bottle before buying another.  There will always be a full bottle waiting in the wings.  This is the only bottle that I take so much care in insuring availability to myself and my guests.

13195.Author: BRNMaynard
13195.Review: First tried this scotch when it was called Glenmorangie Port...Loved it from the first sip....With water and ice, this scotch goes down smoothly...proven by myself and friends... As stated by others, this bottle seems to empty itself !!

13195.Author: M. Helminen
13195.Review: I find the port, spices and a lot of youngish wood (pencils, vanilla), but this malt is way too short on actual malt notes IMO.

13195.Author: Mike (from Winchester)
13195.Review: Just poured my final glass of the bottle, my grandfather and I have gone through this bottle a lot faster than planned. This is a very morish dram with a sweet nose with a hint of berries which is also present in the taste, a hint of vanilla too. The palate is a bit watery in texture, sweet and slightly spiced with a slight burn, a touch of dried fruits with orange peel too. The finish lingers just enough to leave you wanting more. For the price I would highly recommend to anyone wanting a drop of something different and to feel like you are drinking expensive scotch without breaking the bank

13195.Author: QuackJak
13195.Review: I have to agree that the kick is something one needs to aware of. Otherwise, a fine,aromatic Single Malt that often goes unappreciated...

13195.Author: tomh
13195.Review: Love it. First bought a"baby bottle" of it at the Edinburgh castle in Scotland. Have been hooked ever since.

13195.Author: QuackJak
13195.Review:
For those who like to taste their Scotch, beware the first sip; it''s got a bigger kick than most in this range. Later sips bring out the nutmeg mostly, less so the raisin and there is no hint of orange here.
Still, a fine, hard Scotch one needs to be careful with. I use ice here where I would not usually do with others, including Glenmorangie''s 10 y.o. standard.

13195.Author: Sam
13195.Review: Very nice indeed. Love the burn. Freezes the mouth for a few moments after a hearty swallow.

13195.Author: Jay
13195.Review: I love this.  Best one out of the Glenmorangie group.  Best $40-50 scotch you can buy

13195.Author: Derek
13195.Review: Not normally a Glenmorangie drinker but picked up a bottle of this on special offer at the supermarket, very impressed indeed. Wonderful nose and very very smooth indeed! Definitely will buy this again.

13195.Author: Ross
13195.Review: A superb whiskey, you can just settle down with a bottle and let it empty itself, the depths are fantastic and very smooth and warming

13195.Author: Anonymous
13195.Review: As a newcomer to Whisky i was bought a Glenmorangie Original for xmas and am now hooked. So now ive got a bottle of this, loving it only trouble is these bottles seem to leak as they empty rather quickly.

13195.Author: MrDJB
13195.Review: I bought a bottle of this just before new year (from a supermarket sadly, but only because I had a gift voucher). I opened it as the film "Avatar" was coming on, and settled down into the film with the bottle within reach (which we all know is a rookie mistake). The whisky is sweet and divine, far better than the Lasanta in my opinion. You can keep your 3D glasses; I recommend the Avatar Quinta Ruban version! It made my new year :-)

13195.Author: B.
13195.Review:
I have to agree with jorj. The nose is stunning. Turkish delight and...Christmas, basically. Chai spice. 
Theres definitely a very faint, almost unnoticeable hint of Fresh hospital bandages and sweet orange peel.
Quite different. Short burn, Wonderful long aftertaste. Worth the Zlotys (I'm in Poland at the moment.)

13195.Author: Jason's Scotch Whisky Reviews
13195.Review:
"Nose": Orange peel, dark chocolate, faint hospital bandages with medicinal ointment, and freshly turned over, early morning, damp earth, as you hunt for worms for that fishing trip.
"Palate": Rich, velvety, mouth filling body of loganberry, blackberries, raspberries.  Think Christmas fruitcake with lots of dark, chunks of plum, raisins and dark cake bread.
"Finish": Fantastic finish.  Dusty apricot and port wine notes.

13195.Author: Travis Kingdon
13195.Review: Good stuff Billy, indeed it is very good. Nice mint and chocolate notes. If your dollar can spare it maybe try there Nectar Dor or Original aswell.

13195.Author: Billy
13195.Review: This is the best Scotch I have ever had. I received it for Christmas and I only drink it on rare occasions because I am a college student and it will be a few years before I can buy this on a regular basis!

13195.Author: Anonymous
13195.Review: one of the best what a taste my number on for smooth whiskies.

13195.Author: Edward
13195.Review: I love the taste of this Whisky best. Anytime ,Anywhere, just a great warm,and heartfelt hug from Scotland.

13195.Author: Jorj
13195.Review: This one has had a lot of praise but I dont think it's as smooth as some make it out to be. The nose is something very special though. Let it sit in the glass for about 15 minutes, then instead of sticking your nose right in, hold it just above the glass and gently inhale. Nutmeg and turkish delight. Beautiful.

13195.Author: twinington
13195.Review: Different. nice, one you should try but not the best. definatly worth the price

13195.Author: Anonymous
13195.Review: Sublime. Close your eyes - Christmas in a bottle.

26055.Author: Paul
26055.Review: Delicious.. reminds me a bit of Highland Park 12... (a bit odd for a speyside) but more expensive. Very rich and full bodied. Definitely for an advanced palate tho. Add 1/4 water for best results imo.

26055.Author: allan
26055.Review: why is this my first bottle, not for long.

26055.Author: Kir Rodriguez
26055.Review: Wonderfully warm and fruity. Soft smokey aftertaste and caramelized  pineapple.

26055.Author: Anonymous
26055.Review: Delightful! The nose is vibrant and quivering with green apple, lemon and a faint minerality - the smell of grass and earth in the aftermath of a heavy spring rain shower. The palate is bolder than the nose suggests, a gorgeous mouth-filling expression of wood, ginger, pepper, a whiff of smoke, with a slight honey note at the end  to usher in a fairly long and slightly spicy finish. Highly recommended.

26055.Author: Simon Taylor
26055.Review: I didn't know this malt at all but it's a new favourite.  A brilliant mix of citrus notes and strong body. Delicious.

26055.Author: John N
26055.Review: very easy to drink. Too easy. Could become addictive.

26055.Author: Andrew
26055.Review: Surprisingly smooth & easy drinkable. Sounded like average balance between all parts.

26055.Author: Chris G
26055.Review: Perhaps a little too sweet but has a lot more depth and character than a lot of Speysides.

26055.Author: John McGowan.
26055.Review: WOW! This took me by surprise when I took my first mouthful. A bright vibrant sensation on the tongue. Wonderful flavours, pear, green apple, and a lovely sweetness. A little water brings out even more. Fabulous.

26055.Author: A Canadian with deep Scottish (and scotch) roots
26055.Review: Utterly superb:  balanced, layered, accessible but still interesting, complex but still strongly-formed.   This is brilliant whiskey-making (sorry for the 'e'....can't help myself).

26055.Author: Anonymous
26055.Review: This is a great whisky that has a great smokey taste along with a wonderful finish.

26055.Author: Todd Stevens
26055.Review: Wonderful dram! Rich, oily, bodied, melting mouthfeel. Honeyed malt nose, cognac notes. Peppery punch and full of flavor, though no smoke as of yet (I'll let the bottle develop from being opened awhile). Somewhat drying finish, hint of bitterness which melds perfectly with the sweetness.

26055.Author: John R Ledder
26055.Review: a beautiful citrus malt when drunk with still water a very moorish dram great with smoked cheese

26055.Author: Jledder43
26055.Review: A malt with citrus tones that improve with a small "Drop" of Highland Spring still water. Serve with all butter shortbread biscuits and a slice of your favoured cheese [Not Blue] then a match made in heaven

26055.Author: Anonymous
26055.Review: A great  smoky taste to enjoy, which goes well with spicy food !!

26055.Author: Ian T
26055.Review: This is very drinkable with large amounts of body. I''m very impressed, and sure I''ll be buying more!

26055.Author: Anonymous
26055.Review: A very rewarding malt plenty of body fairly complex with a smoky backbone and a good long finish . It feels like a whisky made in a more rustic way then most others

4132.Author: Capt. Teddy. (Ozone Ranger)
4132.Review: Oban represents!!!

4132.Author: Morten
4132.Review: Perfection for a standard bottling

4132.Author: Jan
4132.Review: Lovely whisky, very smooth. I don't share this one.

4132.Author: Felix cappuccio
4132.Review: Simply some of the best scotch ever.

4132.Author: Scotch lover.
4132.Review: One of the softest and smoothest that has graced my taste buds. Dangerously easy to drink.

4132.Author: Antonio  Cortese
4132.Review: I did the distillery tour and 14yo was great!
Dried fruit and gold coins.

4132.Author: Steve
4132.Review: The Oban 14 is smooth and rich. No hitches in the delivery.

4132.Author: Anonymous
4132.Review: Incredibly smooth, fruity, hint of peat...slips down far far too easily...

4132.Author: Anonymous
4132.Review: My go to whisky if I want non-peated

4132.Author: paul maddox
4132.Review: This is one wiskey you will love!! Smooth.

4132.Author: Thomas
4132.Review: lovely undertones of honeycomb..excellent drinkability and one of the most underrated...simply exquisite.

4132.Author: Ted
4132.Review: Mellow and tasty

4132.Author: Jason
4132.Review:
So far I am about a quarter of a bottle through. This is an extremely smooth Scotch  with a full and satisfying flavor. The smokiness is there but it doesn't overpower the flavor. Same with the fruit, you can tell it is there but the flavors compliment each other. 

The price point isn't bad either.  At about $50 USD this will be a bottle I keep on my self regularly.

4132.Author: Troy
4132.Review: Enjoyed this in NYC.  Delicious, well-balanced, smooth as satin.

4132.Author: Stephen Montgomery
4132.Review: OBAN 14 -- Featured in episode 7 (season 3) of the television show "Billions"... for a good reason -- one of my favorites

4132.Author: Shaun douglass
4132.Review: beautiful drink would recommend as a must

4132.Author: Ken
4132.Review: Smooth easy drink. Drink well on the rock. No bitter after taste. A true pleasure to sit down and relax with.

4132.Author: Dream Whisky
4132.Review: Delightful, honest and unpretentious. This dram won’t let you down.

4132.Author: Hanimo
4132.Review: This is an outstanding scotch, it's almost more like a nice brandy. Very smooth, and deliciously sweet without being overpoweringly so. The predominant flavor and nose is of fruit and honey.
