I found it tougher to pick out the peaty smoke scents, but I can hardly even call that a disappointment as this is such a perfectly balanced and rich scotch. An excellent single malt for any collection.

4132.Author: DEB
4132.Review: Tried in San Diego, very smooth.

4132.Author: Lou
4132.Review:
I now understand why people have a hard time with Oban 14...it doesn't have an over-the-top "thing", so it's never going to have a fanatic following. 
It isn't over-the-top peaty. So Islay-masochist won't stand on their peat-boxes to shout about it. 
It isn't over-the-top rich. So Speyside sweet-tooths won't fall in love with it. 
And it isn't cheap, so Price-to-Quality bargain hunters won't swear by it. 
Instead...it pulls a little bit of character from almost every style of Scotch. It has a whiff of salt and smoke from Islay, Highland's creamy malts, the Lowland florals, and Speyside's mouth filling flavor. 
Such a fantastic Scotch

4132.Author: Bob
4132.Review: Had it last year in DC area. Now my favorite scotch. Uniquely smooth.

4132.Author: Red
4132.Review: Nice and warm surprise for an Islay fanatic. Gimme another and another and another... oops.

4132.Author: Kris
4132.Review: For those such as I who prefer the sweeter whiskey with a smooth finish.  Those who prefer a peat or a stronger finish may be disappointed.

4132.Author: Marius C.
4132.Review: Fell in love with it after visiting Oban and the distillery. Brings memories back whenever I drink it. Love it, especially the light peaty flavour and sweet finish.

4132.Author: Anonymous
4132.Review: My favourite single malt..  perfect!

4132.Author: Anonymous
4132.Review:
Very fine whisky. Slightly on the sweet side. 
One  of my favourite Friday night drinks!

4132.Author: MS. Davidson
4132.Review: I gave this bottle of Malt Whiskey as a present.  The man I gave it to prefers Oban Whiskey over others. We both came from Oban and know it's worth..

4132.Author: Paul of Holland
4132.Review: Smooth, fruity perfect for after dinner

4132.Author: Bart
4132.Review: My absolute favorite. Smooth yet complex. Highly recommended.

4132.Author: Ken joyce
4132.Review: A very good drink my first taste at the distillery last year

4132.Author: A.S Pettersen
4132.Review: Having a sip as I write this. A brilliant whiskey.

4132.Author: ThanasisX
4132.Review: Nothing special!

4132.Author: Eric Johnson
4132.Review:
I will digress from describing this malt by its flavour profile, and focus on the overall experience. I've been tasting and collected scotch whiskies now for about five years, and haven't tried this malt until tonight. I am so regretful that I haven't sooner.

*Poured 1.5 oz with a couple drops of iced water, and rested for 15 minutes.
-The flavours jump onto the tongue immediately, with a wonderful marriage of all of its components; none too overwhelming.
-I am blown away at the minimal alcohol fumes, which makes it easier to taste through olfactory. In other words, for being at 43%, It's MUCH smoother than many I've had at 40%. 
-The smokiness is certainly noticeable, but it doesn't dominate the aftertaste like many malts are. 
-It is certainly sweet, but not syrupy

OVERAL: After the first sip, I knew right away that I would always have a bottle of this in stock until the day I die. I can't say that for many. Additionally, I will likely use this to introduce people to scotch whiskey.

4132.Author: Gioele
4132.Review: Been "actively" drinking whisky for a few years and this is by far one of the best I tried. Sweet and fruity (I really liked the dried figs note) but with that light smoky feeling that really strikes me when I drink scotch. The oak wood finish is strong, but not too much, and it leaves you with a feeling of satisfaction and warmness. I would give it 4.5 stars, just because I fancy  a stronger taste more.

4132.Author: Anonymous
4132.Review: Hemingway would say " it was good."

4132.Author: Anonymous
4132.Review: Mmm delicious pencil shavings.

4132.Author: Vu
4132.Review: Excellent, I have been drinking whisky for over 10 years and this is definitely my top 3 favorites. I give it a 4.75

4132.Author: Christa
4132.Review: We had the pleasure of tasting 20 different Scotch whiskys while staying at Glengorm Castle on the Isle of Mull (western Scotland). My husband loved many, but for me, this was the only one. Most others were too dry and peaty for me. I loved the sweet, smokey flavor of Oban. The autumnal spices were complex and delicious! Definitely a smooth, easy to drink whisky.

4132.Author: Charles
4132.Review: Awesome Scotch, smooth sweet to spicy finish.

4132.Author: TheRareMalt.co.uk
4132.Review: Salty and smoky nose. Fruity and salt on the palate, with hints of cereal. Good length. One of my favourite everyday drams.

4132.Author: Peter Ramsay Smart
4132.Review: A fantastic, smooth to taste whisky

4132.Author: Whiskey Nut
4132.Review:
Oh dear.
This is a soft, smooth, sweet & slighty smoky single malt.
Only one thing disappointed me.
The added caramel. 
From the very first nosing I detected it.
It put me off what could be a very fine malt.

4132.Author: Ryan Wilder
4132.Review: Really good. Smooth. Some citrus notes. Give it a try

4132.Author: Gagandeep
4132.Review: Excellent n really smooth drink for any occasions and makes one feels really nice with its tingling taste

4132.Author: Gregory
4132.Review: Only been drinking whiskey for a few years. This is by far the best single malt I've ever tasted (so far)... Honey on the tongue before the spice hits. Sweet and smokey after. This whiskey is incredible. Only giving four stars because I haven't tred a ton of single malts. However this whiskey is superb!!!

4132.Author: FUBAR
4132.Review: Sweet honey nose, oily mouth feel with some fruit and spice, finish is mostly spicy with a dominate mineral note on the finish. 85/100

4132.Author: Troy
4132.Review: Fantastic; especially for the price range. Warm honey dominating the nose is amazing.

4132.Author: Ricky Jones
4132.Review: Wow! So so impressed with this whisky! I was recommended to try it and sceptically brought it on offer, and I have to say I think it is a beautiful scotch! Such depth in every mouthful, lovely sweetness of figs, honey and some stewed fruit, and a touch of smoke too. Anyone wondering weather to buy a bottle or not don't think just buy! You won't regret it! Brilliant stuff!

4132.Author: Albert Kidd
4132.Review: An incredible find , subtle tones with personality . Really enjoyed this wee dram . A must try

4132.Author: Dibs
4132.Review: This bottle had been in the cuboard for the 15 years since my father died, this Saturday I thought it was about time I tried it. I usually drink Laphroaig or Mortlach but found this very palatable and will now have to finish it off.

4132.Author: aGuyFromNorway
4132.Review: It's the first whisky I ever tasted/bought.  I've tried many other brands after that. But I always return to Oban 14 year. It's the one I drink now. It's the one I have to buy in between whenever I have been brave to try another brand. It's the only one that I until now can say is really wonderful. It's the one I always look forward to drink a glass or two of on Friday night after a  busy week in the office.

4132.Author: TC
4132.Review: my daughter bought a bottle of this for me, when she couldn't find my favorite, Tobermory 10, but boy what a malt, will definately buy myself one when it has gone! 10 out of ten.

4132.Author: Stanley Stanner
4132.Review: Smooth single malt. Probably the best that is out there today in this price range. Highly recommend!

4132.Author: Stanley Stanner
4132.Review: Smooth single malt. Probably the best that is out there today in this price range. Highly recommend!

4132.Author: Anonymous
4132.Review: If you think this is pricey for and entry level whisky, there's a reason for it. Perfect balance of honeyed heather, malt and fruit. As far as the fruit goes figs are very prominent which I find very unique. The is a slight hint of peaty smoke on the finish which I guess is because of this distilleries location. The perfect balance of a classic highland malt and the islands. I highly recommend it

4132.Author: Seydel
4132.Review: Smooth like chivas regal. 18 years

4132.Author: Robert Jackson
4132.Review: Elegant heather honey, citrus and spice, smoke and peat not overpowering.  A fine sipping dram with a bit of good  water.

4132.Author: Ed Allan
4132.Review: Delicate, not heavy or peaty although I like those attributes, a fine mild scotch.

4132.Author: Anonymous
4132.Review: This dram is delicious.  Enjoy it neat.  Not a bit harsh.  It''s just the right amount of complex without being cloying.  The smell of honey, oak and citrus is mouth-watering.

4132.Author: John G
4132.Review: A bit to fruity for my palette . Pleasant aroma and start. Finish is tangy. Although it has many flavor hints. Prefer a more smoky drink

4132.Author: Jason
4132.Review: I was, to be honest, rather disappointed with this admittedly fine Scotch. For the price, I think I was expecting something a little more over the top...yet Oban tasted really not much different than most lighter scotches I''ve tried. Lots of dried fruit, wood, but nothing that made me say "Wow!!". Don''t misunderstand - it is by no means bad in any way...just was expecting something a little more I think. For Highland scotches, I''ll take Dalmore or Glenmorangie any day over this, and for much less $.

4132.Author: Anonymous
4132.Review: The finish to a perfect day.

4132.Author: ERR
4132.Review: My first real Scotch. Its smoothness makes it easy to drink, especially for those who aren''t used to Scotch (and expect it to be harsh), and its fruits, vanilla, and sweetness make it enjoyable. I find women really take to Oban for these reasons.

4132.Author: Barry
4132.Review: I might be unsophisticated, but Oban is the best Scotch I''ve ever tasted.

4132.Author: Anonymous
4132.Review: Damn I never felt the smoky finish but it was a bit flavorful at the finish since I am used to blends. My fave being black label. As a single malt I enjoyed it. But it will take me some time to really figure out its ambiance.  But I like it so far so 4*

4132.Author: Justin Bieber
4132.Review: We all have fond memories of our first true love. I tried others, but Oban 14 is my go to for enjoyable sipping for the price. I''m ashamed to say I''ve spent 4x the money and was let down. Money isn''t everything.

4132.Author: JJ
4132.Review: Pleasant smoky aroma. You can taste the salinity of the sea and a burst of spice.  A simple dram that I enjoyed but definitely feel there are other options to consider when dealing within this price range and age bracket.  Don''t feel I''ll explore this again but am happy I did try it since other I know have enjoyed this bottle.

4132.Author: JJ
4132.Review: A decent run for your money.  Subtle and gentle with the peaty smoke which is balanced well with the overall notes of fruit and salinity.  I actually enjoy the smoke in more peaty bottles like the Lagavulin 16, but if that does not suit your palate, than this is a good choice.

4132.Author: Phil
4132.Review:
Perfect balance of sweetness maritime influence andlight peat smoke. A good long finish I do not notice as much smokiness as other reviews which suites me 
as not a lover of heavy smoked whiskys. Just bought DE
of Oban looking foreward to trying it

4132.Author: Tim E.  Kilbride
4132.Review: a nice complex whisky ..  for the money probably the best deal going.

4132.Author: Anonymous
4132.Review: underrated and delicious.

4132.Author: Pat 14/12/2014
4132.Review: An instant rush to the taste buds, with a low level finish which is soon over. A very individual whisky of medium body, quite pleasant, perhaps a little overpriced.

4132.Author: Peter
4132.Review: The first sip changes every second--very, very complex.  An almost perfect combination of smoothness, brine, citrus, vanilla, peat and smoke.  To my mind, a quintessential Highland malt.  Superb.

4132.Author: Anonymous
4132.Review:
Took a tour around this distillery, and a very fine tour it was, even found out that the distillery came before the town and picked up a wonderful Oban whiskey glass to boot. However, the highlight of this tour is certainly the tasting at the end where you get to sample this whiskey in its various incarnations.
Wonderful drink.

4132.Author: Scotch Fan
4132.Review: Hands down the best 14 YO Single Malt Scotch regarding quality-price ratio in the market, not to mention it is bottled at 43%. Superb!

4132.Author: Anonymous
4132.Review: Very easy drinking with a hint of smoke. So far, one of my favorites.

4132.Author: Graham McLeod
4132.Review:
I gave my wife a glass of Oban 14 year old her response was
that was nice.

4132.Author: Anonymous
4132.Review: Amongst the most prestigious Highlanders and possibly the best single malt scotch for the price!

4132.Author: Anonymous
4132.Review: Had my first taste last evening, nice really nice!

4132.Author: Andersen
4132.Review: I got my father a bottle for Father's Day which, of course led to a sample! Nose: Sweet honey heather with a whiff of smoke followed by salty sea air.Palate: Sweeter than I expected- lots of honey, heather and more honey leading on to a salty sea breeze.All in all it reminded me a lot of my own bottle of Dalwhinnie, but a very decent malt that transports you to the nearest habour!

4132.Author: TWE Admin
4132.Review: I'd say more OH-bun.

4132.Author: Anonymous
4132.Review: It is not OH-BAN but instead it is actually pronounced OH-BIN

4132.Author: Jimbo in Queenstown
4132.Review: Amazing! Im in love with this whisky. The girlfriend bought me a bottle here in New Zealand, problem is the price down here

4132.Author: Sebastian
4132.Review: If Tim is a young malt drinker, then I am probably an infant at 32 years. I don't possess all the necessaryterminology, but can say that Oban is one the most finest drops I have ever enjoyed!Glenmorangie is great (esp. matured in Cognac or Port casks) and so is Glenfiddich. Laproaigh is great, too, but too smoky to be enjoyed in larger amounts.It's true, Oban is very smooth, great pleasure to drink!

4132.Author: Tim
4132.Review: Being a young Malt drinker (50) this is the best of all. I don,t like the TCP taste of other malts and I find this perfect. whaat a dram. Thank You Oban

4132.Author: BadCaesar
4132.Review: I'm sorry, but i just cannot find much fruit. And it tastes kind of stale..  just don't undenstand all the praising here. I enjoyed Glenmorangie and Dalwhinnie quite alot and i like fruity and smoky whiskies, especially islay, which this reminds me of somewhat.. but i can't just get my head aroud it. I usually agree with most of the comments on this site, but this one; I just didn't like I guess.

4132.Author: Macky
4132.Review: There are others that capture the attention with more gimmicks but in terms of allround beauty this is as much as anyone could ask for - particularly at the price. One to have on permanent supply...

4132.Author: Anonymous
4132.Review: I always enjoyed Oban, but never as much as this latest bottle I got. It's truly divine, perhaps the best scotch that I ever had. Variety is the spice of life, but if I had to choose one bottle, it would be this one.

4132.Author: Bart A.
4132.Review: I've been an American made whiskey drinker for years with the occasional scotch. I tried this wonderful drink and now i'm hooked. I would encourage any one to try this.

4132.Author: Anonymous
4132.Review: Pronounce it  with the emphasis on the first syllable as in OH-ban. Gorgeous malt! Honey and citrus tones and a hint of smoke with spice...gorgeous!

4132.Author: Anonymous
4132.Review: Sorry if this is a stupid question, but how do you pronounce it?

4132.Author: rico
4132.Review: This is a fabulous dram, smokey oranges in the nose and a very thick, creamy palate!Finish is awsome with kinda citrussy mamalade finish. My mark is 9/10.

4132.Author: Steve
4132.Review: Oban tastes good. Goes down easy. Not as much smoke as I had expected. Tastes expensive. I only tasted it once, in a bar. The one little gripe I have is that it tasted flat or pre-aerated. But I liked its rich flavor.

4132.Author: Holley, South Carolina
4132.Review: I have been an Oban drinker for years. It only gets better. My only problem is that I go through 2 bottles a week and sometimes I can't get it in my area. Hopefully there will be no problems in the future buying it.

4132.Author: Jason's Scotch Whisky Reviews
4132.Review: Palate (undiluted)Initial warming of the mouth as orange, lemon zest and spiced honey waltz across the palate in a sensuous fashion. Smooth whisky but with spiced honey that keeps it interesting. Pleasing like the warmth of the sun upon your face in a Florida orange grove.Finish (undiluted)Glazed brown sugar chaperoned by soft, slight wafts of peat and turning to smoke. The lingering smoke and peat couple to produce a semi-sweet tang offspring.

4132.Author: Knut NO
4132.Review: My god this is fruity! very nice dram indeed.

4132.Author: OG
4132.Review: I am reasonably new to Whiskey but this is one of the best I've tried. I would also say it is a lot better than some of the more expensive bottles on the market.  Great value and worth a try!

4132.Author: Anonymous
4132.Review: A drink that speaks for itself - You will not tatse a better single malt at this price!

4132.Author: Connie Sir
4132.Review: Yes this is a lovely drop of gear, smooth without being bland,as good as it gets at this price.

4132.Author: c sabin
4132.Review: one of the best single malts i have had the pleasure of drinking. smokey,peaty and very smooth nectar

4132.Author: DG
4132.Review: Very well balanced and smooth.Has hints of brine and smoke with some peat but is subtle and strong at the same time.Marvellous.

39915.Author: Macphisto
39915.Review: What can I say??  Ardbeg's and in my opinion, Islay's greatest offering!  First whisky I've become stingy with!

39915.Author: AlecSW
39915.Review: Class in a glass!  Another splendid release from Ardbeg.

39915.Author: wogsters
39915.Review: love  it will buy another bottle well recomended

39915.Author: Larry
39915.Review:
Off the scale, 98. And this is from the normal range!
Different  but as good as Uigeadail. More treacle . My third bottle soon to be brought home.

39915.Author: Steven Cooke
39915.Review:
My goodness!!!!! I have only just sampled this (and purchased a bottle) at the midlands whisky festival in Birmingham....Ardbeg have created an absolute gem here. 
The creamy, chocolatey, citrus, tobacco and menthol and cereal  (to name a few) notes beautifully hugged with peat smoke  is so moorish!!! A must have to any whisky lovers collection.

19988.Author: Rachy D
19988.Review: I really like Talisker, I've been to the distillery a couple of times and I think the balanced smokiness of their whisky really works, so I thought I would give the Port Ruighe a go. To me the port cask has diminished the smoke so if you like a gentle sweetish smokey whisky but with a bit of "grunt" then you will like the Port Ruighe, I've given it a 4 star as I prefer the smokiness of the more traditional Taliskers  but I can still appreciate that this is a nicely balanced whisky at a decent price.

19988.Author: Galen
19988.Review: A friend brought it back. Great warmth with a variety of sensory treats. Can't find it here in Hawaii

19988.Author: Kristian
19988.Review: Love this addition to their range! For my taste it is spot on. Slight sweetness compliments the smokiness and will keep this on my go to list for sure

19988.Author: Mifune
19988.Review: This is a very nice smoky whisky with the delicious sweet notes of port but it needs more refinement. Good but not great.

19988.Author: Robin N. Bishop
19988.Review: I'd concur with the majority view on this one: it's a perfect balance of the Talisker maritime taste with the fruitiness of the port finish. Just a touch too potable, it didn't last as long as I should have made it last . . . .

19988.Author: Tracy Robertson
19988.Review: Fantastic sweet start and then smoky finish

19988.Author: robkul
19988.Review: Loves smoked mackerel finish. Shocked, with awe the first time round, would most definitely recommend every time.

19988.Author: John Hudson
19988.Review: What a beautiful whisky from Talisker. rich and fruity with great lingering taste on the pallate and with that hint of smoke, this is a real winner for me.

19988.Author: N Samuels
19988.Review: Peat Whiskeys are always my preference and Talisker one of my favourite distilleries but Port finished Whiskey after numerous tries with different distilleries does not live up to the hype.

19988.Author: James Gibbs
19988.Review: I wasn't sure that a wine finished malt would be at the top of my list. Recently, I tried this with a rack of lamb dinner and was just exceptional. As an after dinner malt with lamb or fish, this Talisker stands out.  I highly recommend this and I just purchased my second bottle of it. I like the balance of the smoke and the sweetness.

19988.Author: Jeff
19988.Review: Love it.  Subtle mix of peat and port with the Talisker pepper we love.  Big finish.

19988.Author: Steve.H
19988.Review: I'm not usually a peaty/smoke lover, but the Port Ruighe has the perfect balance, definitely the best dram I've had of 2014!

19988.Author: Martin C. Duffy
19988.Review: Everything Talisker is delicious, and the Port Ruighe is no exception.

19988.Author: Anonymous
19988.Review: I am new to Talisker single malts having tried just the Talisker DE version and now this one. I think I prefer the DE version but this Port Ruighe is great. Many reviews of it are mixed but I am totally satisfied with my purchase. The smoke lingers but doesn't overwhelm.

19988.Author: james henderson
19988.Review: I was given this for my birthday and love its nose ,its smoothness and lingering taste, hope I get one next birthday.

19988.Author: Alasdair Fyfe
19988.Review: I love Talisker Port Ruighe. I tasted this amazing malt at Hogmanay and would recommend this as one of the top single malts I have tasted.

12984.Author: Anonymous
12984.Review: Tobermory has come a long way since previous years. Though it's still a bit rough around the edges, Tobermory has a full body powerful taste of salty toffee, smokey vanilla with a hint of orange peel. The finish is long and slightly rough. It's still a nice drop but not for the beginners.

12984.Author: Anonymous
12984.Review: Tobermory has come on leaps from previous times. It's a fully bodied, slightly harsh scotch with powerful flavours of salty toffee, tangerine, vanilla & oak. slightly lacks definition in the finish but still a very enjoyable scotch.

12984.Author: Ian Murray
12984.Review: Came across this Malt by accident. But I was amazed by the dynamics of flavour and pungency this whisky gave. This has to go to the top of my favourites. How do I get to Tobermory?

12984.Author: Stephanie-Cheshire
12984.Review: Buying for my husband''s birthday. We last bought a bottle from the distillery on a visit to Mull. I am not a whiskey drinker but I must admit this has turned my soul! I found it pale in colour, not too peaty and a delight to drink! Gone are the Gin days.

12984.Author: Tony c
12984.Review: The more I drink of this the more I love it,this is moving to the top of my list  very quickly.Every glass is revealing more flavours to savour.This is quality scotch whisky. Recommended.

12984.Author: Tony c
12984.Review: Not an immediate malt but persevere and you will love it. Very nice, very different, one for  myself !

12984.Author: Dave
12984.Review: Love this spicy dram.   Initial sip is explosive before the flavours begin to develop on the palate.  Would recommend.

12984.Author: Mark Lee
12984.Review: A lovely drop. Superb balance of spice and sea. Fantastic value.

12984.Author: Johnny b
12984.Review:
Me and my father in-law sipped this whisky while camping next to a open fire this is a fantastic single malt for your money slightly salty and with a warm dry finish and plenty of floral notes but yet not to peaty .
Very enjoyable

12984.Author: En robot
12984.Review: I've read about this whisky being a joke years ago. Let me tell you THIS is no joke. This is interesting, I don't think this is a wise choice for a novice. Not to mislead anyone as it's in no way similar in my opinion but this is different t like Talisker is "different ". It shares the "explosion" factor but that's where the similarities stop. This is fruity and spicy, a long finish that is probably the most dry that I can recall. It develops nicely after 10-15 and mellows a little. This is good value for money, a worthy addition

12984.Author: Frances
12984.Review: Very nice - very easy to drink - afraid I am not a whisky afficionado I buy them for my husband - but he tells me he absolutely loves it - a surprising newcomer to his list of favourites.

12984.Author: Barrie Ward
12984.Review: Excellent single malt. Fantastic for that nightcap and great to give friends as a present!

12984.Author: The Rabid Wolverine
12984.Review: Fantastic whisky for the price,would recommend.

12984.Author: Beardy
12984.Review: Recently bought a bottle of this and it's a different but a very nice scotch. I'm no expert but it's bright and fresh with loads of character and a dry but refreshing finish. I don't think it would ever be a go to malt but it's a great bottle to have on the shelf when you fancy something a bit lighter. Definitely a coastal scotch and i much prefer it to Old Pulteney 12. Perfect for the summer. Recommended

12984.Author: Holger D.
12984.Review: What a update in quality compared to the old version with 40%! Deserves extra points for it's unique and complex style. A must try!

12984.Author: Mikael
12984.Review: A fantastic whisky! Has the saltness as a coastal whisky but without the smoke, which is very rare. You can really taste the sea in this one. It's really complex, but still very young a crisp. It has unripe apples/pear balanced with some canesugery sweetness. My new favourite for being so original. I am exited to try the 15 year old, but I hope it hasn't softened too much, so it will loose it's coastal flavours.

12984.Author: Anonymous
12984.Review: Very nice. Charming and sweet. Loads of life and personality.

12984.Author: Allan
12984.Review: Very complex whisky my new go to dram.

12984.Author: Anonymous
12984.Review:
46.3% no chill filtration no added caramel so its a natural colour more distilleries should be doing this.           
Fantastic whisky great flavours great price,do not hesitate buy a bottle today you will not be disapointed.
          
 Bottletop,07.06.13

12984.Author: Matteo
12984.Review:
Tried it tonight for the first time.
Really neat flavour, great bottle.

12984.Author: Stewie Ramone.
12984.Review: I like the flowers an herbs on the nose. With pear an ginger on the tongue. All in all not the best or most complex whisky. But very drinkable all the same. Next stop the 15 year old?

12984.Author: Robski
12984.Review: Have to agree with Sean, this new Tobermory is fantastic. Very complex and enjoyable. So much going on!!! Not the hardest whisky to drink, it's just really pleasant. Non chill filtered and no caramel, bottled at 46.3%, for around £30 it's a peach and easily one of the best whiskys I've tried in this price range. Recommended!

12984.Author: Sean Sankey
12984.Review: This is an outstanding whisky for the money. Pale gold colour, beautiful complexity on the nose with loads of grassiness, herbs and floral things going on. On the palate it’s beautifully mysterious with a bit of heat from being bottled at 46.3%, pears, ginger and even bitter chocolate coming through, which is completely unexpected given the colour. Used to be a joke in the whisky world (see ralfy’s review on youtube). Not any more!

12984.Author: Anonymous
12984.Review: Best whisky ever.

2078.Author: Christiano
2078.Review: Drinking neat: Nose is full on Fino Sherry bomb, spice, hint of sulphur, curry, tannins, rough oak, & maybe some burnt caramel. Taste is very rich and decadent (if it's to hot for you, I challenge you to take smaller sips. Like, just enough to touch your tongue small), sweet, winey, floral, syrupy. The nose is really not that enjoyable, but once it touches your tongue the whisky coats it with a warming syrupy sweet elixir and seems to evaporate and warm the entire inside of your mouth. The 60% worried me a bit and I was expecting to have to add water; so I only pored half the sampler. Once I took a sip or two I was shocked at how easy drinking this mammoth was and eventually pored the entire 50ml sampler in my glass and am happily sipping it. Would I buy it? Probably not. But it is definitely worth a try.

2078.Author: steve
2078.Review: 2004 was a very good year because this came into my world

2078.Author: John Dunlop
2078.Review: You would think that this Whisky would be a bit harsh with the strength but it isn't. Just a few drops of water and it has a lovely smooth flavour. A good dram for a cold night with a good book and a warm fire.

2078.Author: Two words
2078.Review:
If i have to describe it in two words they would be HONEST and FRANK. Though it actually deserves four stars i grant it five with clear conscience just because honesty is what lacks nowadays. In these fake and deceptive times this whisky brings me back the faith that things could be done in "old school" manner. Thank you Glenfarclas, great job, this single malt is to whiskies what AK47 is to weapons - rough, tough and unrefined, but yet uncompromising.
P.S. I like it neat - to my opinion even a few drops of water or single ice cube muddle it.

2078.Author: neily peaty
2078.Review: What a great dram for those long winter nights, sweet nose, sherry influence is quite dramatic, when freshly poured there is a strong apple note developing into freshly made toffee. needs time to open up fully. A few drops of water help to bring the sherry more foreward. there is almost a slight sulpur tinge to it for a short spell while it opens up bit more.left for a longer time 15 -20 mins or more it really shows a creamy caramel nose.The body, as many have noted a spicy, full on mouthful definitely not for the faint-hearted. strong  berry notes after a min or so. personally i find the finish similar to a good South Australian  shiraz. it''s got a good strong spicy berry note. Fantastic whisky for the price.

2078.Author: Trailing The Malt
2078.Review:
Nose: The beginning is like your nose was run over by a Sherry Train.. wow so much of it!! Along with it comes notes of dark chocolate.. bold spices...pears...possibly some wood and vanilla in there too..

Palate: The palate's like a continuation of the sherry dominance.. although not as dry as you'd expect it to be.. there's the characteristic sweetness .. with a lot of black pepper and cinnamon spices.. there was also some nutty notes in the mix

Finish: This was a Sherry story so every aspect of this expression had profound influence from the cask.. the finish too was drying .. fairly long.. and spicy too.. some where in there were also hints of mild smoke in the background

To be honest.. its a decent dram but.. definitely didn't get me going wow about it. However given all the awards that this has won.. I'm very tempted to have to give it another shot.. and this time with some watering down to probably get some of that magic that I missed this time around..

2078.Author: Colm
2078.Review: Huge tasting whisky! Incredible value for money, especially since it can be diluted quite a bit. Even with half water it's still full of flavour. But can also be drunk neat! Highly recommended...

2078.Author: S Hill
2078.Review: A great whisky. I've tried the 15 and the 21 but 105 is a brilliant addition. A very strong dram and the taste really opens up with water (actually found I had to put a little more in than I normally would due to the alcohol %). My only disappointment is the cork. This is the 2nd bottle I've had and both corks snapped. I am very careful when opening and haven't had it happen on any other whiskies. Googled it and seems to be a very common problem with the 105. A real shame!

2078.Author: Toronto Tim
2078.Review: no water, please ! Perfect as is.

2078.Author: peatapal
2078.Review: i agree with matt.its an amazing dram but need to breath for a while around 15 minutes and with some water its open up one of my favourites cheers

2078.Author: macky
2078.Review: just been tasting it alongside the Glen elgin 16 yr old which I love and trying to find a winner. Certainly a much more rounded and warmer dram than the A'bunadh that it's compared to above. my 1970 family casks glenfarclas is unfortunately only opened for very special evenings!

2078.Author: Matt
2078.Review: If you like a big unique flavor, this is the one. It has a large Sherry influence, but is very different from Aberlour A'bunadh. This is a malt that needs to breath for a while, to be at its best. This is one of my staple malts.

2078.Author: Anonymous
2078.Review: Wow this is powerfull stuff.I drink  a lot of scotch, but i had to mix a little cola with it so i could drink this drop.It has smoke and toasty notes and a heavy alcohol taste.Drink this one sparingly with good friends and a good cigar.

2078.Author: Anonymous
2078.Review: Are you mad. While I love the deep rich textures of a glenfarclas 12 and beyond the 105 is a strong brew that only the truely aquired pallet can appreciate. Love it or hate it, it has everything and a little bit more

2078.Author: Dylan Williams
2078.Review: This was the first whiskey I ever drank  and still love it. Although it's 60%  it doesn't taste of alcohol- you simply get a lovely deep

2078.Author: Anonymous
2078.Review: 105 does not have a declared age or vintage as it is a blend of casks of different ages - they use young casks to supply the power and older ones to fill in the richness and complexity.  Try it, it's terrific.

17985.Author: Dave H.
17985.Review: With its strong whiskey taste, it is a smooth full flavour 5 star drink one to drink after everyone has gone home and you've  locked the door and sit by an open fire  perfect .

17985.Author: John HUdson
17985.Review:
an absolute Beaut. bought one in Inverarary but havent opened it yet, have sampled it though, at the Balvenie distillery tour in September this year.
rich and creamy, with toffee and fresh fruit, plum anf vanilla, along wit sweet oak 10/10 on this one for me.
opening the bottle at Christmas

17985.Author: Alan
17985.Review: This Balvenie is just stunning, far better than the 12 year old

17985.Author: Mifune
17985.Review: I’m wondering whether it’s being rushed through the rum seasoning.  Not as smooth as flavours soon as I remember to be. May just be this bottle

17985.Author: Anonymous
17985.Review: Very nice taste

17985.Author: Man C
17985.Review:
Not that good. Overpriced. Not as smooth as I'd hope. Quite flavourless. 
Truth be told I expected more considering the 30 years was very very good.

17985.Author: Alan f
17985.Review: Simply heaven. For the price you cant knock this. My new favourite! Fruity warm and easy drinking

17985.Author: Tony Carroll
17985.Review: The Balvenie Caribbean Cask has jumped to my favourite malt sweet and spicy with a hint of rum in the background delicious

17985.Author: Titus
17985.Review: Fabulous.....

17985.Author: Irish_is_simply_the_best
17985.Review:
Being an Irish whiskey lover (Redbreast, GreenPoint, Bushmills etc), finally I found a Scotch that I can rate a 5 star! It is The Balvenie Caribbean Cask 14 years.
Sold in The Netherlands as a 'summer whisky', but too much body for being so. No , instead you can drink this in both summer and wintertime, so much taste of the rum, butter, caramel, toffee and apple. And no smoke! Simply awesome, this is the good stuff! Wake me up for sipping this golden liquid at any time if you ask me! Adding just a few drops of fresh water enhances the taste even more, a must do.
One downside, The Balvenie found it needed to color this whiskey, my question is: why on earth... Simply nobody cares about the dark brown color if non smoked barrels are used...(!)

17985.Author: Melfort
17985.Review: Top class.  This is the best whisky I have ever sampled.

17985.Author: Iain
17985.Review: Possibly my favourite whisky

17985.Author: Sean Allan
17985.Review: Outstanding!  I'd label this the finest Balvenie ever made. !!!!!

17985.Author: Anonymous
17985.Review: Lovely sweet whisky, I get coconut with the spice (but that may be the Caribbean influence. For an everyday drinking whisky I don't think I have had better.

17985.Author: Anonymous
17985.Review: Rich, elegant  and  sublime.  The perfect  accoutrement  to a fine cigar.

17985.Author: AdamLong24
17985.Review:
Colour caramel orange not to dark or pale
Nose Strong mellow hard to identify flavours but has a nice tingle smell.
Palate nice strong taste of citrus orange very smooth 
Finish long nice continue of the orange hint of spice very sweet.
For the price of this this is an amazing whisky to have in. I did not think it would top the triple cask but now I think I will be buying this one more often. It is rich elegant no smoke. Has a very nice finish this is a very good whisky not the best but I would recommend this for new whisky tasters for the fact the after taste is long a mellow. 
The bottom line very impressed with this and well done Balvenie. 
if this was more expensive then would of given 4 stars but due to the low price I'm giving it 5

17985.Author: Anonymous
17985.Review: This is the best everyday drinking scotch! Guests, visitors and clients prefer this to ANYTHING else!

17985.Author: Mainer
17985.Review: My first scotch whisky.  It's exceptionally smooth and mild. I would recommend it to anyone looking to break into good scotch.

17985.Author: Anonymous
17985.Review: So good, so smooth.

17985.Author: Palle
17985.Review: Just perfect.

17985.Author: Russ
17985.Review: Clean, smooth finish

17985.Author: MikeInMiami
17985.Review: Absolutely hands down my favorite. Let me paint the picture.. Sitting alone with it in a Chilled glass and stone cubes , an nice cigar and a nice IPA or Stout watching the sunset between Palm Trees. "Who's better than me..."

17985.Author: Rick.
17985.Review:
One of my favorites, which looks to be getting in short supply.
An excellent Speyside single malt from an excellent Distillery.
The tasting notes sum it up perfectly!

17985.Author: The Drunk Halligan
17985.Review: Best whisky buy far just perfect

17985.Author: Tom in St Paul MN
17985.Review: Great chunky caramel palate overtones with a barnyardy blueberry finish

17985.Author: Paul
17985.Review: The hint of Rum makes a great addition to the taste of what was always a fine Whisky

17985.Author: Anonymous
17985.Review: One of my favourite new malts from the geniuses at Balvenie. Balvenie consistently produce great whisky and this 14yr old  Caribbean cask is no difference. A well balanced spicy full-bodied flavour with rum, toffee, vanilla is complimented by one of the most  luxurious finishes I've ever experienced from Balvenie. Absolutely delightful and a true bargain for the money.

17985.Author: Victor
17985.Review: Beautiful all round taste. Smooth with a sweet lingering taste. Very nice, not harsh or overpowering.

17985.Author: Anonymous
17985.Review: VACATION MOOD

17985.Author: Mike
17985.Review: Lovely tasting whisky that I could nose all night long, caramel type qualities with a warm finish wish I bought two bottles now as this is fast becoming a favourite

17985.Author: Julia
17985.Review: Warm, rich, sweet. Like a prolonged hug. Very recommendable.

17985.Author: Anonymous
17985.Review: Had a bottle of this at the weekend.  Found it very enjoyable.  Quite light but has a fair bit more flavour than the slightly plain 12 year old.

17985.Author: Charlie Harland .
17985.Review: Bought this whisky for a Whitby Whisky Appreciation Society night (WASS). What a find. This whisky swept the floor over it's competitor's. You have to like vanilla & toffee taste, but if you do this is for you. It is smooth &  delicious,  then the rum takes you to another level.  "WOW"

17985.Author: AMH, Espoo, Finland
17985.Review: My experience when comparing the two is that the Cuban selection is slightly smoother, ie. more gentle. A matter of taste, I enjoy both.

17985.Author: Anonymous
17985.Review: Super smooth. Love it

17985.Author: Anonymous
17985.Review: This stuff is very nice;  I think it's worth the extra over the 12 year Doublewood and probably a better value than the 15 year Single Barrel.  To me, it comes in second next to the 21 year Portwood in the standard lineup.

17985.Author: Danny Goossens
17985.Review: I have both bottles at home. To me there are the same. Bought the Caribbean cask in the States. Cuban selection in France

17985.Author: TWE Admin
17985.Review: It's a similar idea, but this is a new whisky.

17985.Author: Anonymous
17985.Review: Is this the same as the Balvenie 14 Year Old / Cuban Selection?

30748.Author: Douglas Reid
30748.Review: A most unusual dram. It certainaly did not disappoint. Peaty, smokey and rich which left a lovely aftertaste on the palate.

30748.Author: Selwyn
30748.Review: I got given this bottle from a supplier and it is a truly amazing whisky. I love smokey whisky like Ardbeg, this doesn't hit you with the smoke so much but has the right amount combined with its sweetness. Well worth getting a bottle or two!

30748.Author: Andy
30748.Review: I'm new to whisky but having tried a wide range of single malts I have discovered that I'm a huge Islay fan. As stated this is nothing like any other lowland whisky, and I would liken it to an Islay. My absolute favourite so far, bottle is nearly gone after 3 weeks. Smoky, peaty medicine balanced perfectly with a superb sweetness! Love it!

30748.Author: Anonymous
30748.Review: Ordered this a few weeks ago. Remarkably similar to Kilchoman range, heavy earth and bonfire combined with some sweet notes. Taste gives away not yet matured spirit, but longer maturation in good-quality casks could transform it into a nice peated dram.

30748.Author: Alun
30748.Review: As a fan of anything from Islay I was attracted by the description "peaty and phenolic". Could anything from the mainland possibly stand comparison I wondered . Well yes now it can . Already good enough as it is, after ten years in the cask I'll happily part with three figures for the more mellow expression when that day comes.

30748.Author: Richard
30748.Review: You can tell it is a young whiskey as the 'sweet peat' batter your taste buds like an over excited pup, without much substance in between. However, it grows, and it's easy-ish to drink. I'd bet that if you left this in the cask for 20 years you'd have a really good dram.

30748.Author: Simo
30748.Review: I fell in love with this whisky. It felt like drinking smoked candy. Rich in flavor but still smooth as silk. It seemed so balanced - I really couldn't find anything in it that I wouldn't like.

30748.Author: Thomas
30748.Review: Sweet, peaty & meaty. Yummie. I very much like this one.

30748.Author: Davidos
30748.Review: I'm no expert but I must say that this tastes very similar to the Kilchoman Loch Gorm. Nice and sweet with bitter peat.

2400.Author: Anonymous
2400.Review: Gorgeous stuff!

2400.Author: Anonymous
2400.Review:
Oh-so-creamy. It doesn't have the delicacy of the Founder's. Its got way more depth. Sits on the tongue very very nicely.

Get on it

2400.Author: Anonymous
2400.Review: Very good. Smooth and rich. Deeper than the Glenfiddich 15 solera which I prefer.

2400.Author: Thompson
2400.Review: Bit of taste in the aftertaste but that's about it. Realy weak and not worth the money. For those who do not know whisky well.

2400.Author: Kris
2400.Review: This is good but not if you have tried the 18. Go for the 18 instead, you deserve it!

2400.Author: Bogdan
2400.Review: so good.  Recommend...

2400.Author: Pete Rawlins
2400.Review: Glenlivit, I love it and fifteen's the best, smooth with lingering flavours.

2400.Author: Rikki
2400.Review:
My wife bought me this for our anniversary. I'm certainly no connoisseur but I do love a nice whiskey and this stuff is among the best I've tasted - I like to pour it into a warmed glass, no water, just the whiskey itself... instant buttery smoothness, crisp notes of vanilla and spice, long delicious finish.  Will certainly impress guests.
I'm buying another bottle when this one is done.

2400.Author: chris harman
2400.Review: really very good for the money, long finish and a feeling of something above the ordinary

2400.Author: Ben
2400.Review: First whisky, very nice flavour. Leaves a taste which is pleasurable.

2400.Author: Jeffrey
2400.Review: Smooth, creamy, vanilla.  My favorite.

2400.Author: Lesley
2400.Review:
Hate whiskey but studied review after review and wanted to buy my baby brother a gift as he was an amazing support when mum died 
Your reviews helped me choose this as my price range was ?50 
So I'm giving you reviewers a strong 4* x

2400.Author: Steve O
2400.Review: Lovely jubbly. Goes down like the Titanic.

2400.Author: Andrew
2400.Review: Tasted like a Good Cognac. Great jump in comparison to 12yo. Lovely smooth taste.

2400.Author: Ell
2400.Review:
Excellent - recently purchased and has to be a favourite.  To put in context the whiskies among my favourites are Yamazaki 12 and 18 (though 18 getting a little expensive!), macallan 10,  penderyn madeira cask, bowmore doublewood, ardmore traditional cask, bowmore darkest. 

Amazing flavour and very moreish.

2400.Author: Pete Rawlins 69
2400.Review: The first whisky I have ever been able to drink, opening up a new world of Spey whisky

2400.Author: Jason Debly
2400.Review:
"Nose"
Very fruity and floral.  Roses, cherries and dark berries.  Not the most incredible of aromas to rise out of my glass, but that's ok because the price was not the most incredible either.

"Palate"
Cherry, rich dark plums and of course oak.  Creamy.  An exotic oak, but not too exotic such that it is weird.  All pleasing flavors here.  Soft, enjoyable, very drinkable texture.  Nice firm mouthfeel to this one.

"Finish"
Vanilla, more oak and drying a bit.  Not super long, but not bad either.

2400.Author: Description says "a step above 12 year", its several steps abpve the 12 year Glenlivet. Excellent scotch
2400.Review: Excellent flavor, very smooth

2400.Author: Capt. Bruce Bacon
2400.Review:
This scotch is miles from the 12 year-old.
If one wants a very smooth, fruity taste, it makes one hesitate to swallow. I have to wonder why I waited so long. That Limousin French Oak finish, that je ne sais quoi...!

2400.Author: Adam Rolston
2400.Review: It gives a smokey nose. As you sip you get the usual tingle at the top of the mouth. On the exhale of breath after you can note a berry and vanilla. A slight dash of water will null the sting and bring out more of the flavours. A good all round single for the money, however others in its range can be more interesting and more available in local shops. 4*

2400.Author: Tony
2400.Review: Good product, I personally find the 12 a bit lacking on delivery and slightly unrefined in terms of the raw alchohol taste. The 15 solves all this, it tastes like the 12 but just more oomph! Its more flavourful, pronouced, and is more complex than the 12, not to mention it is super smooth. I would have rated it higher because I think it''s downfall is that it should of been bottled at 43% .

2400.Author: AJ Jarrtt
2400.Review:
There is complexity to this whisky. I won''t repeat what has been said regarding nosing and tasting notes. 
The only observation k have is that the nose, for me, is almost like a strong perfume. I added a little water to calm it down. Addi a little water also allowed the fruit notes, typical found in the Glenlivet 12yo to come out.  I must say that I enjoy the 12yo a bit more than the 15yo. However, if I were to recommend any Glenlivet, it would be the Nadurra 16yo. The one I referring is not the Oloroso batch.

I would like to see what the Glenlivet ''expressions, would taste like if they didn''t chill filtered.

2400.Author: Erik Fine
2400.Review: A wonderfully, smooth drinking scotch.  Always a pleasant experience

2400.Author: Justin J
2400.Review: Excellent single malt for the price. Very smooth and light on the palate.

2400.Author: Steve tibo
2400.Review: Great drink. Every man worth his manhood should get a case today.  I had a grand satisfying you know what after my 2nd glass. Fantastic!

2400.Author: Alexander Fernandez
2400.Review: excellent - very smooth and a fantastic afterglow flowing up -

2400.Author: Beardy
2400.Review: I shop in the £25-£50 range and this is great. Not overly complex or fascinating but bloomin' lovely all the same. A gorgeous floral and vanilla nose and early in the bottle a hint of banana which i loved. Unfortunately this seemed to disappear after a week or so of opening but still didn't stop me finishing it a bit too quickly. I like a sweet scotch with a long oaky finish and this doesn't disappoint. Not my favourite but it's not far behind.

2400.Author: Anonymous
2400.Review: I found this Whisky to be very dull.  I've not got the experienced pallet of some reviewers, but I fail to see why anyone would rate this. There are much more interesting 15 year old Whisky's than this and Glenfiddich 15 is one of them.  Yes its a much more mainstream choice, but there's a very good reason called Solera.

2400.Author: Kenneyh B. Marshall
2400.Review: I really enjoy this Single Malt Scotch Whiskey,smooth to the palate.A bit of smokiness,and goes down just rigth!I have compared this to JWB (Johnnie Walker Black) ,but Glenlivet 15 is better!Enjoy my friend.

2400.Author: Anonymous
2400.Review: Glenlivet French Reserve is comparable to Johnnie Walker Black Lable. The French Reserve is a bit smokery,but can,t go wrong with either one.

2400.Author: Smedster
2400.Review: Quality stuff - can't go wrong with this one.

2400.Author: Kenneth B. marshall
2400.Review: I really enjoy this whiskey,it is a bit smokey in taste. It is smooth to the palate, I drink it straigth,and you cannot go wrong with this after a long day at work.

2400.Author: CM
2400.Review: Fantastic whisky, i may even prefer it to the 18yr.

2400.Author: Anonymous
2400.Review: fantastic scotch for the $

2400.Author: Anonymous
2400.Review: Being from Australia, a few cubes of ice is essential in the warmer months. The rest of the year, I drink mine neat. A matter of personal preference although I do add some water to higher alcohol whisky.

2400.Author: Anonymous
2400.Review: So smooth. Responds well to water.

2400.Author: Anonymous
2400.Review:
I love this. The vanilla from the oak is evident on the nose, as are the dark brown flavours in the mouth, the toffees, caramels, the dried Christmas fruits, but not in a heavy duty sherry cask way (nothing wrong with that, mind).
I had a Glenlivet 18 last Hogmanay, but I think, sacrilege, I prefer this, there is less honey and it has a bit more bite, or punch, but it's down to personal taste.

2400.Author: Jason's Scotch Whisky Reviews
2400.Review: "Nose": Very fruity and floral.  Roses, cherries and dark berries. "Palate": Cherry, rich dark plums and of course oak.  Creamy.  An exotic oak, but not too exotic such that it is weird.  All pleasing flavors here.  Soft, enjoyable, very drinkable texture. "Finish":Vanilla, more oak and drying a bit.  Not super long, but not bad either.

2400.Author: Jason's Scotch Whisky Reviews
2400.Review: "Nose": Very fruity and floral.  Roses, cherries and dark berries.  "Palate": Cherry, rich dark plums and of course oak.  Creamy.  An exotic oak, but not too exotic such that it is weird.  All pleasing flavors here.  Soft, enjoyable, very drinkable texture.  Nice firm mouthfeel to this one.  "Finish":  Vanilla, more oak and drying a bit.  Not super long, but not bad either.

2400.Author: Anonymous
2400.Review: I really enjoy the 15 year old French Oak Reserve,smooth,smokey,and can drink it without a overwheming after-taste.A excellent choice to relax,and to chill-out.

2400.Author: Anonymous
2400.Review: Go for the 12 year-old, which is better in my opinion. Or spend a little bit more and go for the superb 18 year-old.

2400.Author: AndyC
2400.Review: This is a lovely drop, as others have said it is smooth with nice, complex flavours. Very easy to drink. Bought it on a whim, and very glad I did! Will definitely go back for more, an absolutely beautiful whisky.

2400.Author: Malty Magoo
2400.Review: I usually prefer the islay malts but had a wee dram of this stuff tonight.  Smooth as silk and a lingering cherry aftertaste.  Delightful whisky.  I might treat myself to a bottle of the 18yr gear when i get paid.

2400.Author: Anonymous
2400.Review: A little bit of water goes a long way.

2400.Author: Gary J. Catignani
2400.Review: Lets get it right......ice for blends to cut their tendency to be course, slightly chilled water for malts up to 15 years (Glen Grant etc), but nowt for malts over this......just sip and enjoy(really good with a black Italian coffee) I know, being doing this for well over 40 years and the liver is still functioning, albeit not as well as with a good Italian red wine, preferably from Tuscany!!!!!!!!

2400.Author: Tudval
2400.Review: Some whiskies go better with ice. It may highlight salty and smoky flavors and subdue the sweet malty character. I wouldn't add ice or water to a 30 year old malt, as I would only spend the money if I enjoy it straight, but for a cheapish 12-15 year old, anything goes, depending on the mood.

2400.Author: Smithery-Baggins
2400.Review: @ steve of cheshireI personally agree that ice cubes spoils whisky, it sort of numbs the flavour and smell, the best thing to do is to add a small drop of cold water this obviously cools the whisky but also takes away the alcoholic burn allowing more of the flavour to come through, however there is no right or wrong way to drink whisky, you should just drink it the way you like it.

2400.Author: steve  of cheshire uk
2400.Review: on my second bottle of this and find it very smooth .. i usually drink my whisky over a cpl of ice cubes but have been told i am spoiling it by doing so .. am i right or wrong as i really enjoy it this way

2400.Author: Smithery-Baggins
2400.Review: Fantastic whisky, one of the best if not THE best considering its price, its very smooth, has a wonderful aroma and a truley excellent balance of flavors.

2400.Author: trebor
2400.Review: A very elegant, fruity and rich single malt. It is subtle and very refreshing - looks classy and tastes classy. Never overpowering at 40% vol it is very drinkable. At this price it is a real steal!

2400.Author: PR
2400.Review: Very nice whiskey, smooth and spicy with complex blend of flavours. More than a hint of sherry IMO. A special occasion tipple of the first order.

32433.Author: Rex
32433.Review: Great dram forget the 12 or 14 and go blended

32433.Author: Dave
32433.Review: Excellent!!  Lives up to the reviews I’ve read!

32433.Author: Stewart
32433.Review: great taste very smooth with good fruit nose.Easy one of the best I have ever tasted just got it here in the states.

32433.Author: Alex
32433.Review: I honestly was disappointed with this one, too peppery for my tastes. I get some fruit on the backend, but all in all I would not buy again

32433.Author: Joe
32433.Review: Has unseated Lagavulin as my go to brew.

32433.Author: Jacob
32433.Review:
smooth and rich! 
Comes with a reasonable price. 
One of my favourites.

32433.Author: Bill S
32433.Review: Oban nailed this NAS whisky. Fruity Nutty and Spicy yet mellow without the young whisky varnish flavor that haunts many NAS Scotches.  My local store has it on sale for $35! Going to buy 10 more at that price!

32433.Author: Jacob Rivera
32433.Review: Worth every penny a deliciously sweet & peppery single malt very pleased with this purchase:-)

32433.Author: Tony
32433.Review: Fuller flavour than Oban 14. Fruit flavour at the start giving way to an earthy finish

32433.Author: Adwrighter
32433.Review: A full, rich, complex character that still manages to reflect the the simplicity of it'a bay side home. First experienced at the distillery, beneath the cliffs, a block from the bay - it perfectly captures the spirit of the town: independent and uncompromising, yet mellow. As warm as the people and as satisfying.

32433.Author: Anonymous
32433.Review: Pleasing aromatic and taste. Very smooth.

2038.Author: Chris Williams
2038.Review: Wonderfully smooth with obvious notes of sherry and cinnamon, a must for the whisky drinker

2038.Author: Mifune
2038.Review: This is whisky at its best. A supreme whisky that has everything I love in it -- I can detect a hint of smoke, certainly not wafts --- mix of bourbon   sherry barrels works for me.

2038.Author: Yoba
2038.Review: The 12 year tastes better

2038.Author: Hemant
2038.Review: Great malt , smooth fruity balanced , medium body...

2038.Author: FieldMarshal J-Han
2038.Review: Nose; butterscotch pudding, marmalade waterfall, crisp, green hay on a rainy day. one of the best nose ever!   Taste; pumpkin pie, cold medicine, cucumber spice. Finnish; mouth watering lingering with sherry scent and berry bush. A true masterpiece of expression in a 15 year old dram. I would not be surprised to learn of significant age of and quality of the buts that this hails from. Like finding a needle in a haystack. Truly Epic!

2038.Author: Jason Debly
2038.Review:
"Nose" (undiluted)
Spicy, mildly medicinal with big sherry notes.

"Palate" (undiluted)
Rounded rich sherry notes.  This is a big sherried scotch.  A wee bit of charcoal interspersed with the sherry.  Raspberries and peppermint.  Lots of oak (maybe too much).  A little bit of a strong drink that makes it slightly off-balance.

"Finish" (undiluted)
Candied ginger, smoke, and oak again.

2038.Author: Mikko
2038.Review: Badly sulfured, unfortunately (190315). This used to be a great malt back in 2013, but not anymore. I can't understand why people and professional reviewers just won't address this ever worsening sulfur issue.

2038.Author: Ballinhassig
2038.Review: I'm drinking it now... oh, it's good... rich fruit cakey mouth filler that leaves a citrus tang on the back of the tongue. One of the best, if not the best sherried Scotch of its kind...

2038.Author: Anonymous
2038.Review: Great smell and taste, I only just started experiencing sherry whisky. This is a great one, good value for money and an amazing taste, so rich and smooth, ticks all the boxes for me!

2038.Author: Chris
2038.Review: Absolutely loved this! Normally not a big whisky drinker, but after doing a load of research I settled on a bottle of this. My history with whisky is minimal, but clouded with cheaper bottles that gave the drink a bad rap in my eyes. Really wanted to change that opinion I chose this after careful consideration to really appreciate what is reviewed as a great single malt. Novice in my knowledge of whisky, I opted for this as it was described as fruity/sweet and I have to say it''s spot on! Lovely drink to have and to own. Here''s to many more whiskies for me!

2038.Author: The Oxford Whiskey Doctor.
2038.Review: stunning smell and taste, I look forward to this whiskey very much. smooth great tasting and an absolute bargain for the money!

2038.Author: Missouri, Merica
2038.Review:
Nose.    Dr. Pepper,  orange cake, spices

palate    complex, more orange cake and spice, vanilla,  dried fruit, raisins

just a magnificent whisky. I'm in love.

2038.Author: Anonymous
2038.Review: In my view this excellent 15 year old is one of the best on the market and represents value for money..

2038.Author: Scotch Fan
2038.Review: Huge development compared to the 10 YO expression, Glenfarclas 15 represents great value without a doubt. It is distinct and sublime. Bottled at 46% AVB, not for the novice drinker.  Hard to believe its price tag, it blows pretty much every other 15 YO single malt out of the water in terms of quality-price ratio. I liked it more than the much-praised 21 YO expression, this dram easily compares to Macallan on multiple levels and is a gem without a doubt.

2038.Author: Johnny Norfolk
2038.Review: This is a great whisky if its to your taste. Glenfarclas is a beacon of excelence.

2038.Author: Jason's Scotch Whisky Reviews
2038.Review:
"Nose" (undiluted): Spicy, mildly medicinal with big sherry notes.
"Palate" (undiluted): Rounded rich sherry notes.  This is a big sherried scotch.  A wee bit of charcoal interspersed with the sherry.  Raspberries and peppermint.  Lots of oak (maybe too much).  A little bit of a strong drink that makes it slightly off-balance.
"Finish" (undiluted): Candied ginger, smoke, and oak again.

2038.Author: Mikko
2038.Review: This is a really dense sherried malt, but a very good one. The complexity and the quality of sherry casks are... astonishing. This whisky is for real whisky enthusiasts. Not for easy going saturday drinkers.

2038.Author: BDK
2038.Review: A sublime dram and great value for money. Have yet to be disappointed by any offerings from this distillery. The wonderful thing about whisky is that there's a style to suit everyone.

2038.Author: Anonymous
2038.Review: @Denmark whisky lover - Lol yes I noticed that the bottle was brown after I typed my question! I wish the UK was like Germany or Denmark where the bottle has to say whether it has artificial colouring.I love peated whisky, but I also like a good sherried whisky, so will definitely give this one a go.

2038.Author: Denmark, Whisky lover
2038.Review: the color of the bottle is brown, so in that way it looks darker - but... it taste as an "dark" whisky. I bought my bottle in Germany and it is by law, that if it has been colored, it must say so on the bottle, and it doesn't!! I don't think that you would be dissapointed with the dram - unless you like peated whisky.

2038.Author: Anonymous
2038.Review: Looks extremely dark - does anyone know (admin maybe?) if it has added colouring?

2038.Author: Propaganja
2038.Review: I honestly don?t care what it should or shouldn't taste like as long as it?s good. This one is a pleasant surprise to me and I think it amazingly enough tastes exactly what it looks like (!) Fresh honey, dark chocolate, rich cream, vanilla, milkchoco. Not very complex or demanding, doesn't need time or focus to be enjoyed. I'm getting some more of this spiked liquid christmas candy...

2038.Author: USA Whisky Lover
2038.Review: I enjoy the sherry tones of this offering and the smoothness compared to their 12 year old; much better value than the 17 year old. Not available in USA so enjoyed a rare bottle brought back by friends visiting the UK.

2038.Author: Anonymous
2038.Review: This is one of the truly outstanding whisky's available at a working man's price. I haven't tasted as many as jim Murray but have sampled several dozen over the years and am happy to agree with him that at worst it is superb and my bottle seems to suffer from rapid angel sharing whenever I have one.

2038.Author: KG
2038.Review: Considering that some malts are so heavily peated it's like sipping a bog,  some of the negative comments here are just plain daft. If, like me, you tend to put turf on the fire, rather than in a glass, then this is a very agreeable whisky. Yes, it's heavily sherried and definitely not for the afternoon or early evening, but serve it up after dinner, and there'll be no murmurs of dissent from your guests. As they say...."horses for courses".

2038.Author: James
2038.Review: There is sherry and it is overt (so far so good), spices, vanilla, orange on the nose.  The palate has a full rich mouthfeel and exotic spices dance around malt with sherry, vanilla and orange marmalade.  It's a big boy and big is beautiful. A little less oaky finish could be ok but some nights, that oak transforms the whisky into something more than a savoured sipper, it becomes a party animal draped in colourful robes dancing on the rooftops. Lighten up, sherry up, give it up.

2038.Author: robert johns blackburn
2038.Review: I tried this bottle on the strength of Mr Murray's 'Bible'. From now on I will decide for myself. I found this far too sherried and of no distillery character at all.

2038.Author: Peter Benkoczki
2038.Review: Absolute superb single malt. Robust, sweet, matured fruits, dark honey...

2038.Author: Stephen Wainwright
2038.Review: This is a good dram for anyone who wants a drop of whisky with their sherry!

2038.Author: TWE Admin
2038.Review: Can you all stop bickering please, it's getting very tiresome.  Comments section is for product reviews only, any more of this and I will go back and delete all your posts.

2038.Author: James Saxon
2038.Review: I agree with you, Robert!

2038.Author: Robert Stirling
2038.Review: I thought this area was for comments on whiskies not a check on spelling! Mr Saxon needs to get the message. I also find the 15 yo to be spoilt by sherry influence.

2038.Author: James Saxon
2038.Review: I think Mr Lathwaite needs to root his dictionary out. Just check 'Disappointment'. ;) I'm really quite shocked at how divisively this one splits folk. To return to Mr Lathwaite, I tried this very early on in my malt experience and it was only coming back to it 50 plus malts (Ardbegs, Balvenies, Dalmores, Caol Ilas, Bowmores, Highland Parks included) later that I truly appreciated its unique quality. At least all this disagreement keeps the distillers on their toes.

2038.Author: Matt
2038.Review: I'm no expert and only just got into whiskey, but it's worth noting that Jim Murray's whisky bible 2010 rates this 95 out of 100 so I guess he would disagree with almost everyone here?

2038.Author: J Lathwaite
2038.Review: What a dissapointment this one was! Mr Saxon needs to leave the dictionary and sample some good malts.

2038.Author: Harry Keith
2038.Review: I did not like this one at all far to sweet! Not good at all.

2038.Author: Jack Taylor
2038.Review: This really ia a good whisky spoilt by too much sherry. I'm afraid H. Dross needs to taste a few other products.

2038.Author: Robin Seymour
2038.Review: I agree with trebor the sherry is overpowering. Surely you should be able to sample the signature of the distillery and not just the wood? If you rate this highly then you really need to look around at some of the much better malts!

2038.Author: James Saxon
2038.Review: You tell 'em, Holger! I must admit that it took me a little while to get acquainted with this malt but with the effort I grew to absolutely adore it. I always think of the Glenfarclas as a meeting with an opinionated, perhaps even out-spoken, but in the main avuncular old gent and such is the case with this one.

2038.Author: Holger Dross
2038.Review: "A very poor offering... It has far too much sherry influence..." - this statement isn't comprehensible at all! Glenfarclas is well known for big sherried whiskies - this is one of the best you can buy for that few money! An outstanding whisky in my opinion and always a drinking pleasure!

2038.Author: trebor
2038.Review: A very poor offering from a usually classy distillery. It has far too much sherry influence and masks the whisky almost entirely. If you want sherry buy a bottle of sherry - it is much cheaper!

2038.Author: yas
2038.Review: 46% yummy cant wait to try it,

13992.Author: gill
13992.Review: divine. nectar of the gods.  delicious.

13992.Author: Anonymous
13992.Review: Glenmorangie has done it again this is a great tasting whisky.

13992.Author: Jay
13992.Review: Awesome vanilla spice bomb. Great lingering finish.

13992.Author: Jay
13992.Review: I'm not proud of finishing the bottle in two days, but that's something that glenmorangie should be proud of.  Don't get me wrong, it's not a fast dram.  It's delightful  in every way

13992.Author: Tommy Molnar
13992.Review: Not normally a single malt fan (I prefer blends), but my son brought me a bottle of this 'goodness' and I was surprised by how much I liked it. It's definitely smooth, and has many different tastes as you let it sit in your mouth before swallowing.  Yup, good stuff.

13992.Author: Rich F
13992.Review:
Had a tebsency towards the Glen 10 year old which has always been a favorite.

Nose is lite and sweet..first hot is Dpicy Honey with Orange and Vanilla tones..
Short finish but very clean finish...

Absolutely worth keeping a bottle available at all.time as its lighter than the Other Casks..which I do Immensly Enjoy

Ive yet to be dissapointed.    Miss the Blue Bottle 12 years Maple early 2004?? Cant find it anywhere..Enjoy????????????

13992.Author: Christiano
13992.Review: Vanilla custard dominates, caramel sweetness, lemon meringue, white cake, roasted walnuts, very rich, decadent. The more I sit with it, the better it becomes, and more layers emerge. The vanilla custard is beautiful and that initial sweetness when it hits your tongue is pure Glenmorangie magnificence.

13992.Author: Bryan
13992.Review:
Disappointing. Not as good as Glenmorangie other options. 
Nose: Nothing much. Light sweet. Orange, Citris, Honey. 
Palate: Alot of citrus, oily
Finish: Nothing much. Short finish. Some lemon & sweet. 
Conclusion: Not that complex. Very light. Good for beginners.  Very forgettable.

13992.Author: Jason Debly
13992.Review:
"Nose" (undiluted)
Honey, peaches, lightly peated, navel oranges and a little scent of dulse.

"Palate" (undiluted)
Creamy, honeyed, pancakes and maple syrup, crushed pistachio, phyllo dough, baklava.

"Finish" (undiluted)
Drying, salted white chocolate, tangerine, malty notes, brazil nuts and somehow lemony with tart citrus, herbal flavors.  You are left with a delightful effervescence too.

13992.Author: Dan C
13992.Review: Truly a wonderful whisky. Sets well as an after dinner drink.

13992.Author: Anonymous
13992.Review: Hands down, my favorite whisky.  If you''re a fan of highland single malts, or any whisky that has a rich, sweet, citrus fruit flavor then this is the whisky for you. Well worth the price tag and then some.

13992.Author: Rui Malta
13992.Review: Excelent

13992.Author: Anonymous
13992.Review: Simply the best single malt

13992.Author: Konrad S
13992.Review: Very sweet. Tastes like sauternes. Still light and nice as a desert.

13992.Author: John Clawed
13992.Review: Just delicious.  No qualifications. The best single malt I have ever tasted and I''ve tasted them all.

13992.Author: Anonymous
13992.Review: I didn't think much of this to start with - a little sweet for my taste. It has since grown on me and might invest in another bottle

13992.Author: Roger
13992.Review: I have drank all these Glenmorangie scotch boys. Let me tell you that the 12 year Glenmorangie  Nectar D'Or  is by far the best smoothest taste you will ever experience for the price. I like it as well as the 18 year. I am presently drinking the 10 year because I am retitred but will be getting the Nectar D'Or in 2 days. Really why do I drink the original when the 12 is superb.

13992.Author: Ewan Cameron
13992.Review: An awesome malt very mellow and citrussy.One definitely to be savoured cold and slow, not enough of a dram-snob to come out with all the usual accompanying pretentiousness,but suffice it to say,if you haven't tasted it,you should,if you have,I need say no more. The finish is subtly christmassy and it nudges your taste buds into wanting to savour the next sip again and again,SUPERB DRAM,congratulations to the sixteen men of Tain (I'm from Nairn originally) STAND PROUD

13992.Author: Sarah dickson
13992.Review: A beautiful tasting whisky goes well wi a bag a cheese n onion

13992.Author: Anonymous
13992.Review: What can I say, this truely is akin to God's Nectar! Add a bit of ice-cold water, and a few large ice cubes, and sit back and enjoy this lavishishly, almost ostentatiously vanillery, honey, and lemony sweet delight. It's richness can be likened to the richest french pastries. Drinking it extremely chilled brings it alive, probably the best of the extra-matured range, closely followed by quinta ruban, and lasanta.It's made a tad spicy by subtle lashings of ginger, and nutmeg. Brilliant!!

13992.Author: Anonymous
13992.Review: Prominent flavours that roll over the palate with this one are vanilla and subtle lemony flavours as with the aroma. Also hints of ginger and nutmeg especially towards the finish. Not as rich or spicy as the other two glenmorangies in the "expressions" range (i.e. lasanta, quinta ruban), slightly less smooth, but still enticing.Overall, more similar to the original than the other two, while still holding onto its own distinct characteristics. Well worth a try in my humble opinion.

32558.Author: Mattia
32558.Review: I prefer it to the 16yr Lagavulin! It's rich and peated to the right amount, but still preserves some freshness that the 16yr does not. I will certainly buy more of this one.

32558.Author: Tom
32558.Review: VERY GOOD Islay whisky. Has a very similar taste to Ardbeg 10. Already one of my favorites.

32558.Author: The Swiss Fox
32558.Review: Punchier than the 16 year old, youthful and lovely level of smokiness. I am stocking up!

32558.Author: Jwazzz
32558.Review: Finally, Lagavulin character returns!  After a recent band aid tasting 16yo which doesn't even remotely compare to the classic 16yo of yesteryear, I bought this in desperation to salvage the 16yo.  By mixing the two in roughly equal proportion, the combination of 8yo and 16yo starts tasting complex, much like the old 16yo from the 1990s.

32558.Author: Anonymous
32558.Review: New favourite

32558.Author: jbx
32558.Review: Don't let the relative youth of this fool you into thinking it is not good. This release is just amazing, it managed to oust the 16yo from being my all time favourite. Slightly sharper on the smoke than the 16yo. Slightly sweeter too, with a hint of citrus. A pleasantly long finish too. Good thing I bought a couple of extra bottles of this limited edition release.

32558.Author: Jk
32558.Review: First try on any Lagavulin , wasn’t crazy for it, too much wood smoke very barbecue like flavor but with that said maybe the 16 yo  is better .

32558.Author: Chungstick
32558.Review: Wonderful. I could drink this every day. All that peat, smoke, and fruit. A beautiful blend of flavors.

32558.Author: Grumpybaldprof
32558.Review: At first I was uncertain, such a young Lagavulin did not inspire confidence. BUT its lightly sweet, well balanced and still has all the good stuff of a proper Lagavulin. I love it it.

32558.Author: James
32558.Review: Great stuff. Much better than expected. Tastes more mature than just 8yo. I would love to see this as a permanent part of the core range. Smoke and spice and vanilla in perfect harmony.

32558.Author: Liam
32558.Review: Fantastic whisky.  I actually like it better than the 16 (48% helps.)  Not as good as the 12 year, but at half the price it's a must try for any islay scotch lover. Ardbeg take notice; how about an affordable special release with an age statement? Probs lagavulin.

32558.Author: Todd Stevens
32558.Review: If only Diageo would make all their releases craft offerings, no color or blasted chill-filtration, then I would buy them by the bottle and not just a single dram to see what they're about, and buying a signatory release.

32558.Author: Notnick
32558.Review: a lot smoother than I thought it might be- I expected smoke, fire, and green grass- but its much rounder and smoother.

32558.Author: Noicecubes Dammit
32558.Review: Sweet, citrus /acidic pear fruits, an increasing briney seaweed sensation, followed up with a great, deep smokey finish.  Wonderfully balanced composure, with full throttle flavors the whole way. Wow!

32558.Author: Your_average_drammer
32558.Review: Sweet citrusy smoky peated perfection. Almost gave up on Lagavulin after very disappointing bottles of the 16 and 2015 distillers edition, which I found to be flat tasting and a little rough around the edges. Just not what they used to be. But boy oh boy this is a mighty fine dram. It might not be as complex as some want but it sure does pack a punch This rowdy 8 year old brings all the classic lagavulin tastes to the plate. Sweet, citrus,smoky, peat.  Hope to see more releases like this in the future Diageo.

32558.Author: Mikko
32558.Review: I'm glad Lagavulin is back with full throttle. After unbelievable and  devastating downhill of 16 yo I was almost ready to give up with Lagavulin. Only 12 yo CS was left.  Well, this one is one of the great peaty and smoky Islay whiskies. Obviously, Lagulin team has realized their situation and decided to invest in quality. Sweet and sour in harmony , smoky, sea weedy, youngish but perfectly balanced. No color added, fantastic!

32558.Author: Anonymous
32558.Review: The 8 year old is a winner.  This is a wonderful whisky with a real peaty character, peppery taste and sweetness.  I wish the 16 y0 was realeased at 48%. Talisker should also take note and release a reasonably priced 8 yo.

32558.Author: Ridge
32558.Review: Simply superb, yes it's a little more "raw" than the 16 year old but it is half the age. I do hope that this remains available for a long time. I keep buying a bottle with the intention of keeping it but I'm afraid it s simply to good for that.

32558.Author: Thomstrom
32558.Review: Great peaty Laga. I enjoyed it. A lot.

32558.Author: PSagnier
32558.Review: Amazing combination of citrus and peaty aromas. Great dram!

32558.Author: M.Ryan
32558.Review: I hope this turnes into a general release. It's nice to have a alternative to the 16 and the Sl 12 wonderful dram

32558.Author: A'Shaw Dram
32558.Review: What a lovely whisky not as peaty as I was expecting .but still good all the same.

32558.Author: that_whisky_dude
32558.Review: What an excellent spirit driven Lagavulin this is, zesty, briny, oily, citrus fruits and pineapple with a dirty smoky finish. An instant classic!

32558.Author: Skyboy
32558.Review: This is (obviously) a totally different animal in comparison to the classic 16.I'm a big fan of young Islay whiskies but this is a little raw,almost new make in profile but softer,would be better at cask strength.Had high expectations of this bottling,disappointed.

32558.Author: M,RYAN
32558.Review: just cracked my bottle A  lagavulin  maybe half the age of the 16 but its not lacking any flavor or depth lots of fruit and the traditional laga burn   will be ordering a few more

32558.Author: Anonymous
32558.Review: Had a chance to taste this a few weeks ago at a Diageo tasting and it was fantastic and great value for money

1863.Author: Anonymous
1863.Review: I like it! It was as twe described it, so i got what I was looking for.

1863.Author: Anonymous
1863.Review: Simple and very, very good whiskey

1863.Author: Jock Watt
1863.Review: Was given a bottle at my wedding 15 yrs ago by my dad who worked there at the time, along with two others. I opened this one with friends earlier this year and it was well received. Emptied the last of the bottle myself last night. A nice whisky to be enjoyed occasionally as you can''t have a cracker like this all the time. Now looking for another one

1863.Author: BA
1863.Review: Francois must have been slipped a Pedro Ximenez don''t pay attention to the description of syrup etc. this single malt is fantastic. Unlike the earlier comment of trying 115 single malts who''s counting?

1863.Author: BIll Ewing
1863.Review: This is an exceptional whisky, outstanding value for money, smooth and delicious, one of my favourites.

1863.Author: Harry Burrows
