3121.Review: if i could only ever buy one bottle of single malt again lagavulin would be it. nothing i have sampled before or since can compare to it! believe the hype.

3121.Author: Single Malt Fanatic From California
3121.Review: Delicious!  I used to drink Lagavulin back in the 90s when it was properly priced.  I loved it then, but I stopped buying when the price went up to staggering levels.  Now it is back on my cabinet shelf thanks to the aggressive pricing of late and it is as great tasting as ever!!!  Oh how I missed thee, delicious and expertly peated, light delicate smoke, sexy velvet pallet, and warming mouthwatering finish.  Maybe my favorite Islay malt.

3121.Author: paulo
3121.Review: Excellent stuff. Smoky but not too peaty, undertones of charcoal, brine and a lovely sweetness. Dry finish. I am converted.

3121.Author: Bert
3121.Review: Wow, I think I may have found a new best friend!

3121.Author: Anonymous
3121.Review: This is the true 'indoors' Islay whisky - the raw elements have been cultivated and brought into the manor house. The 16 year old has depth, is very aromatic, subtle very sherried and herbed. It can't compete with Ardbeg and Laphroaig on peat and smoke but wins through with sheer refinement.

3121.Author: Anonymous
3121.Review: This is simply the stuff of champions.

3121.Author: Single Malt Nut - California
3121.Review: I found a bottle of Lagavulin 16 YO in the 80s and my Scotch whisky world has not been the same since. This is the one that opened my eyes to the wonderful variety and depth of Scotch single malts. In the mid to late ninties quality was lost. I am happy to report the Lagavulin 16 yo I remember and love is back. This sweet, peaty, malty, briney single malt is magnificently balanced -it may well be the Islay with the best overall balance. I love this stuff.

3121.Author: Anonymous
3121.Review: Introduced to me by my Scottish father in law over a very long evening last Christmas, this really is something to savour. Tremendous and surprisingly good value considering the range of malts we put it up against.

3121.Author: Ash
3121.Review: Tip:This improves in the bottle after opening. Savour it over a few months... it gets sweeter

3121.Author: Anonymous
3121.Review: i hated peaty whiskies and therefore had written off Islay whiskies in general.....BUT i was a fool!  this tastes too good to share - the taste couldnt be more different from the nose.

3121.Author: James D.
3121.Review: Quite easy drinking this one. Smokey spicy nose, some bite and very reminiscent of a speyside in its core taste. Not a long finish but gives a pleasant hint of smoke. A dry edge lingers on palate. This is very different to say a Laphroaig 10 which is sweeter more rounded and fills the airways with smoke. Both are very good!

3121.Author: Ben, Singapore
3121.Review: I've been fortunate enough to try whiskies from all the current Islay distilleries, even Kilchoman and Port Ellen, but there is just something about Lagavulin 16 that makes it a real classic. PE, Ardbeg, Laphroaig and co. are all fantastic, but the Lagavulin 16 is my choice for introducing others to the Islay whiskies. Brilliantly clean notes of smoke, spice and fruit.

3121.Author: Wyatt
3121.Review: I'd keep a bottle of this to drink, and one for if the world end, and store it right next to the other emergency bottle of Ardbeg Uigeadail.

3121.Author: Yeungster
3121.Review: This got me into Whisky.

3121.Author: Tom
3121.Review: Holy guacamole! This is a very serious dram; an awesome display of whisky power! Seasalt, dried fruits, loads of oak, spice, smoke and of course: peat, peat, peat! It seems to linger forever... Its smell still emanated from my glass long after it was empty and even now (morning after) I still taste its woodiness/smokiness on my palate. Wife kids out of the house, my recliner, my bottle of Lagavulin and a stack of Cheech

3121.Author: TJ
3121.Review: I was first introduced to whisky with a gentle Aberlour but soon made my way towards the peaty ones and thought I'd found my favourite with Laphroaig. Nothing else I tried – Talisker, Bowmore, Jura, you name it – came close until I was told to give this a try. It has the smokiness of Laphroaig but the flavours are deeper and more complex – all sorts of things linger and reveal themselves. It's just a classier dram when all's said and done.

3121.Author: Anonymous
3121.Review: First tried Lagavulin after picking up a bottle from duty free on my way to India in 1999 for a business trip. Tried it against many other single malts on a cocanut farm in the Indian tropical rain forest on that visit. It blew my mind away - what an aftertaste compared to the rest. The taste stayed with me and I finally made it to the distillery on Islay one wet Tuesday in 2010 and have a coveted bottle at home - still haven't tasted one quite as good.

3121.Author: Anonymous
3121.Review: A great dram with everything an islay fan would wish for but i think it would be even better at 46% or 50%;it just lacks a little punch.

3121.Author: cam newton
3121.Review: when i want something deep and rich with great amount of peat flavor, i go for lagavulin. everytime.....

3121.Author: Tom Wood
3121.Review: Discoverd at a pub speacialising in fine whiskeys - not looked back since...

3121.Author: MSR
3121.Review: A remarkable drink with a huge peaty flavour that demands to be enjoyed neat.

3121.Author: Anonymous
3121.Review: lovin every drop of it

3121.Author: Anonymous
3121.Review: My absolute favourite. And cheap considering how good it is. I got a bottle of the more expensive Distillers Edition for Christmas and it's not as lovely as the standard 16 year. A perfect way to end a day!

3121.Author: Malty Magoo
3121.Review: I received this as a chritmas gift and it's an absolute treat of a dram.  Intense, smoky, Islay character but a bit more oily and rich than Laphroaig.  I also detected a hint of toffee in the aftertaste probably due to the age (it's six years older than the signature Laphroaig stuff).  An altogether terrific dram for a cold winter's evening - my trusty hillwalking hipflask will appreciate this.

3121.Author: mr d rabbage ,devon
3121.Review: whilst at the langstone cliff dawlish ,i had this single malt whisky,this was a first class malt ,great with a cigar for a christmas treat ,as it states takes out the fire but leaves in the warmth :)

3121.Author: mark brailsford
3121.Review: If you have ever wondered what a real malt tastes like, then look no further. this is THE malt of malts...well, that's if you like them peaty!!this is the real deal!

3121.Author: Anonymous
3121.Review: Great review Tom - I like to think it's true......

3121.Author: tomsledge
3121.Review: i was able to savor this fine whisky while on  layover with 2 lufthansa stewardess.need i say more!!

3121.Author: Kman
3121.Review: I like to describe my malts by the memories they conger up. Remember those fantastic days in your life book as you snifter away. This malt? Cold damp morning on the grouse moors. Guns in the mist. The smell of fresh gun smoke, wet feathers, wet leather, my wet tweed jacket, the Labrador at my feet, the old Land Rover.

3121.Author: Anonymous
3121.Review: I_know_now: You can certainly try the other strong Islay whiskies like Laphroaig and Ardbeg. Or Bowmore for a slightly less aggressive peaty character. And of course there's always Talisker...

3121.Author: I_know_now
3121.Review: Until I tasted Lagavulin 16 I thought I did not like whisky......it has opened a whole new world for me. My only question now is what single malt should I try next and indeed will any even compare!

3121.Author: MrClaw
3121.Review: Should've posted this a while ago! I didn't 'get' Lagavulin at first. Now I don't understand why that was ever the case! Top notch stuff. ...And the standard 16YO is still the best Lagavulin I've tried.

3121.Author: Peter W.... A New Yorker
3121.Review: And I thought JW Green Label was great scotch... but my "eyes" opened with Lagavulin 16... Just ordered Laphroaig 10 and Ardbeg 10 to try... I know I'll love them too

3121.Author: Adeeb H.
3121.Review: A true sweet 16, no doubt. Tantalizingly seductive as it touches the lips, and totally engulfing as it playfully embraces the tongue. The smoky aroma wanders through your mouth cavity dancing with teeth, before it dives into the darkness. Unforgettable encounter of the 16th kind. Love it, absolutely.

3121.Author: Mikko P
3121.Review: The color, the odor, the taste, there is no other like this. They say that teetotal Johnny Depp sometimes orders a dram of Lagavulin and just sniffs it...

3121.Author: peatapal
3121.Review: this  is a master whisky from islay.peat bomb.salty.you really tast the sea in it.a heavy whisky great for the autumn evenings.and this is one of few whiskys i really like with some water added.

3121.Author: Anonymous
3121.Review: This whisky was my first "visit" to Islay. On this evidence, I see no reason to leave any time soon!

3121.Author: Drums
3121.Review: Yes a peaty classic. Great nose, robust in the mouth with a stong warming finish that lingers nicely. Very nice indeed.I still rate Laphroaig as my fave Islay, with it's tobacco and snuff box characteristics.

3121.Author: Snige
3121.Review: So I got this ( my first ) Islay not knowing if it'd be to my tastes. I like rich Highland or LowlandAll I can say is WOW! Its complex with a taste of everything other posters have said. It's smokey with a great seaside flavour with peat and salt. Strangely there is a menthol/mintiness to it, but the smoothness stops it from coming through too strong. So far, my fave whisky for me can be described as a very grown-up whisky

3121.Author: Andy I
3121.Review: Had this for the first time last night... Amazing!!!! This is the malt for me!

3121.Author: HenryCFA
3121.Review: Every bit as deep, complex, and wonderful as a'bunadh!!

3121.Author: Keith MacGowan
3121.Review: For myself, the taste of Laphroaig doesnt come near to that of Lagavulin,although i have read somewhere that Homecoming Single Islay Malt does have a similar flavour.

3121.Author: roger turner
3121.Review: Come on Martin K wake up and get real. Almost everything in life is dearer than it was! Where have you been?

3121.Author: Martin K
3121.Review: Its a lovely whisky, but used to be able to buy cheap a few years ago when it was still unknown and underrated, has doubled its price in recent years.

3121.Author: Jason's Scotch Whisky Reviews
3121.Review: On the palate, a silken liquid of considerable viscosity bathes my palate in a gently sweet wood smoke, moving to mint, peppermint and cool menthol. The liquid is warming. There is no heat, burn or roughness of any kind. Have no fear, you can drink this "neat" (no water or ice need apply to this job!). I also detect some green olive with the red pimento in the centre coming through. Oh, this is glorious stuff. The stuff that dreams are made of.

3121.Author: Povilas Safranauskas
3121.Review: Definitely still my best whisky. Always comparing others to him. Still none better. I'm waiting my 1993 distillers edition for this Christmas!

3121.Author: Anonymous
3121.Review: I have tried for years to find a whisky I like better than Lagavulin, I have stopped trying.

3121.Author: trebor
3121.Review: What can you say new about Lagavulin 16 yo? It is quite simply in a class of which there are very few members. One of life's great joys is sitting by an open wood fire drinking Laga on a cold winters night. A King amongst Single Malts.

3121.Author: Audrius
3121.Review: Sorry. Tastes like a visit to a dentist to me.

3121.Author: Anonymous
3121.Review: good choice

3121.Author: BomBaMn
3121.Review: This is the King i wonder how much good is then the LAGAVULIN 1991 Distillers Edition

3121.Author: aussie shaun
3121.Review: By far the best islay malt i have tasted,lots of smokey peat with a whiff of sea air to finish it off.A truly magnificent dram from the isle that all scotch drinkers should try to have in their collection,for the price(aus.$102.00)it is the best and was well matched with a maduro cigar.

3121.Author: davey boy
3121.Review: With the same shape bottle and same colour stopper as Caol Ila a strange coincidence ? A pricey dram and I wonder why? The quality is there in the rich nose but doesn't quite follow through onto the palate. Even so a viable alternative to Laphroaig quarter cask and Caol Ila 12 year old. Smokey and rich with sea shore and lapsang overtones.

3121.Author: AWL, Sevenoaks.
3121.Review: Wow.  Just wow.  Ardbeg 10YO and Laphroiag Quarter Cask deliver peat in spades, but the overall richness of this is really something else.  Worth every penny.

3121.Author: RW
3121.Review: Was a big fan of Laphroaig, but this whisky has got to be the best I have ever tasted!  Rich, peaty (love that) and more of the sea, seems to me, than Laphroaig.

3121.Author: Bobby Davis, Mobile, AL.
3121.Review: Outstanding, the best whiskey I've ever tasted or smelled, I'm hooked. Had been drinking Chivas but will never go back. It's like I had been drinking Jose Cuervo and tasted my first agave tequila. Thank you Lagavulin for opening my eyes and nostrils.

3121.Author: Peter
3121.Review: Great whisky, complex and rich. But I am a Laphroaig fan.

3121.Author: Colin
3121.Review: high five lagavulin. Second favourite whisky in the world.

3121.Author: Chris Mills
3121.Review: Hands down the BEST whisky I've ever tasted! I'm addicted!I've put a challenge out there: Can anyone give me a better, richer single malt?In the last 20 years none has been able to accomplish this!

3121.Author: Rickard Brinck
3121.Review: Simply the best of the best of the best. A wonderful, characteristic taste - you can actually feel the atmosphere of the Scottish seaside in your mouth.

3121.Author: AW
3121.Review: A world-beating classic and a whisky I can't live without.  Peaty in a totally different way to Ardbeg and Laphroaig; more of a lapsang souchong nose and taste.  Although wonderful, there's room for improvement: the mouth doesn't quite deliver on what's promised on the nose.  Can't wait to try the Distillers Edition variation on the 16 y-o; it's not that much dearer.

3121.Author: Douglas Muir
3121.Review: After drinking this I had a Rabbie Burns moment and wrote a poem. This is everything you could want a whisky to be. It's just such a shame mine was a miniature!

3121.Author: Anonymous
3121.Review: A triumph of a whisky!

3121.Author: J.W.  Devon
3121.Review: I have been enjoying all types of whisky for the past 40 odd years as an ex service man. Lagavulin has got to be, with out a doubt, the most enjoyable of the lot. Thank you

40025.Author: Horatio
40025.Review: very good whisky for a fair price.

40025.Author: CCL
40025.Review: Worth commenting on a couple of points for those considering: this is not aggressively peated and certainly not "briny" or other such fear-inducing (for some) adjectives. It also has a surprisingly viscous mouth feel -- very classic, not unlike what Benromach is doing these days. Most un-Balvenie in that regard. All in all very nice, and for the Balvenie fan a considerable change of pace.

40025.Author: Greg
40025.Review: Great offering from Balvenie.  Love the fact that they use Highland peat vs traditional peat from say Islay.  Great integration of classic Balvenie style layered with peat and smoke that's not overwhelming.  After opening my first bottle, I quickly purchased two more.

40025.Author: Wolfgang (Kollo)
40025.Review: A very special Balvenie, butt a Balvenie.  A litle smoke, notas much as you eypect and also the typical Balvenie notes: Honey, fruits and vanilla. As a Balvenie fan you must try it. With kind regarts from GERMANY!

40025.Author: Tony
40025.Review: Have always liked Balvenie extra matured, but my favourite whisky is peated and smokey. This combines both very well and will look out for it next year.

40025.Author: Bruce
40025.Review: If you like peated whisky, then this is for you. It has that classic Balvenie taste and balance with a nice prominent but not overwhelming peatiness. Even my wife, who doesn't like peated whisky, likes this one.  And for the price? I should have bought two bottles.

40025.Author: Anonymous
40025.Review: Great value for money, rather enjoyed it.

40025.Author: cato
40025.Review: 3.5 stars. Decent whisky but better named Peat Weak

40025.Author: Anthony Fischer
40025.Review:
Unequivocally 100% as described and great value
If smoked peat does it for you, this one knocks it out of the ballpark

40025.Author: Peter G - Australia
40025.Review: Marvelous! The next level up from The Balvenie Peated Cask. Deliciously smooth peat with that amazing Balvenie style whisky.

40025.Author: Instagram - @malt.teaser
40025.Review: Nothing compared to Islay in terms of peat which is more than welcome as it balances a subtle speyside peat smoke with the quintessentially fruity and honeyed notes of Balvenie. Magical!

40025.Author: Anonymous
40025.Review: Not overly peaty but just enough of a hint to add to the allure. Lots of various tastes that blended well.

40025.Author: David
40025.Review: For collectors and drinkers alike this is the Best Buy you will find this year at under ?60.

40025.Author: Manuel
40025.Review: I think is time for buy it, is good quality  and collectable...

7218.Author: Mr Michael
7218.Review: Wonderous, flavourful, rich and beautiful whisky. I gave this to my dad for Fathers Day using your great engraving service and it made a v special gift!

7218.Author: Susie
7218.Review: Warms the cockles quite nicely

7218.Author: Selena
7218.Review: I bought it. Like it.. but I was surprised that the cork broke!! It was our 3 rd round to drink this and more than 2 third full.. what shall I do now with a broken cork and 2 third full of whiskey?? Found a hibiki bottle with cork still in tact, filter the Dalmore into Hinbiki bottle... don't feel good about it :-(

7218.Author: Laverne
7218.Review: I bought this for my boyfriend as a Christmas present.  I previously hated whisky.  I tried this and would thoroughly recommend this fine malt.  It is amazingly smooth with a nice bite:)

7218.Author: Anonymous
7218.Review: Amazingly smooth.

7218.Author: Boswinkel
7218.Review: Wow!

7218.Author: Zoe Carey
7218.Review: Fabulous

7218.Author: Chris
7218.Review: The best whiskey I tried so far. Amazing flavor. Would get it again

7218.Author: Peter
7218.Review: Got this for Christmas.. having been a Macallan whisky drinker didn't tbink I would find better .. .but this is an amazing drink .  Smooth yet to him taste . each drop lingers in the mouth .. Sorry Macallan  but this is now my new tipple.

7218.Author: Juki
7218.Review: Excellent whisky with mouth watering taste. Try this one with Celebrator beer and you will be astonished!

7218.Author: Andrew Shearer
7218.Review: Excellent Malt one of the best I've drank

7218.Author: Will
7218.Review:
An absolutely perfect Christmas dram.
Feet up in front of the fire, with a chunk of Christmas cake. Chocolate covered caramel, figs and jams. 1 glass in and have already ordered 2nd bottle. Top 3 whiskys for me.

7218.Author: Jon Boy
7218.Review: A whisky made for a cold winter night in front of the fire, with a good chunk of Christmas cake!

7218.Author: joly
7218.Review: mild taste

7218.Author: Anonymous
7218.Review: Definite vanilla at first with a nice low burn finish thoroughly enjoyed

7218.Author: Matt
7218.Review: An excellent whiskey for someone new to the game such as myself. Exceptionally easy to drink. Very intriguing, sweet aroma; I pick up wonderful caramel and dark cherry notes. To the palate it tastes well balanced and a finish of creaminess and mild spiciness.

7218.Author: Ricky Jones
7218.Review: Now here's a Christmas cake whisky if there ever was one! Tried the Valour recently.. Great flavours! Love it

7218.Author: Karl D'Souza
7218.Review: This Dalmore 15 is rich and full of Christmas Spirit, a truely fantastic winter malt. It's smooth and well rounded and extremely easy to drink on its own in the evening. Enjoy.

7218.Author: Ed Borrowman
7218.Review: I love this Dalmore. I stopped in at the distillery after surfing at Gills Bay. Around the time an oil rig ended up on Dalmore beach. The whisky is very good. A tiny drop in the mouth for 20 seconds allows the flavours to refract like a rainbow as light passes through a drip. Stunning

7218.Author: pascal
7218.Review: wonderful whisky feels like christmas but its feb. great investment

7218.Author: Anonymous
7218.Review: A beautifully well balanced scotch with sherry tones, large hints of black cherry, dry fruits and sweet spices. Lovely body and mellow crisp finish. Definitely a festive drop.

7218.Author: Anonymous
7218.Review: This is a lovely well balanced scotch with tones of cherry, sweet spice and mince pies. It's not the most complex scotch out there buts it's a nice easy to drop to drink. Very enjoyable.

7218.Author: R4pt0r
7218.Review: A very nice complex sherried dram of which had several bottles (like the driedfruit, spicy aroma). IMHO the best still affordable Malt in the Dalmore range, although the 12 is also good.

7218.Author: Jose
7218.Review: It is mouth watering taste.

7218.Author: ERR
7218.Review: My first Dalmore. Great Sherry taste; fruit, berries, distinctly nutty. Goes great with food, (think chocolate, meat), which brings out interesting flavors in the scotch you might not otherwise notice. Very smooth.

7218.Author: JJ
7218.Review: Definitely a poperi smell, sherry presence, malted barley, X-Mas Fruit Cake, Orange body, lemon cough drops. Smooth finish. Light dryness. Enjoyed more than the King Alexander III but still favor Dalmore 18yr.

7218.Author: Bill Runham
7218.Review: An excellent drop and good value for money at this price bracket. I love the finish of freshly ground coffee beans and rich marmalade

7218.Author: Anonymous
7218.Review: Full bodied richness

7218.Author: Mike Collins
7218.Review: Hmm, as smooth as a Highland loch on a still summer's evening, with a golden sunset hue to boot. Sherry-like, smooth, honeyed, but witj more than enough oomph for this palate. I'll be at the distillery soon to undertake in-depth research and analysis. Cheers!

7218.Author: Jonathan W
7218.Review: This is excellent.  I purchased this, due to owning a Macallan 18 year Old and not wanting to finish it too quickly due to its price!  The Dalmore is an excellent sherry oaked Whisky and has not disappointed me after the quite amazing Macallan 18..  Be warned that it would not suit those who like their Whisky to pack a punch and the finish is quite short.  However for me personally this is a delicious dram.  Very very good and very smooth!

7218.Author: James Westley
7218.Review: Just getting into Whisky as would have to say that is this the best whisky's that I've ever tried. It's beautiful .. Dalmore, you have a customer for life !!

7218.Author: Pat Bateman
7218.Review: If you are into sherry-flavored scotch, this one is for your. Not as refined and subtle as the 18yo, but very rewarding.

7218.Author: Jason
7218.Review: Beautiful, deep, dark, fruity, lasting flavours. Sit in front of the log fire in winter and enjoy!!!

7218.Author: bifter
7218.Review: Lovely whisky, smooth, sweet, oily, reminds me of crème brûlée. Noses beyond its years for me but not without some minor imperfections and the finish is shorter than I anticipated. Comes at a bit of a premium when compared to Lagavulin 16 or Glenlivet Nadurra for example.

7218.Author: Pete
7218.Review: A very tasty and complex 15yr old. Great value for money

7218.Author: Gordon Reeves
7218.Review: Yes there's depth and character but it's swamped by the sherry wood.  Interesting whisky right enough but not one I'd go back to.  I do like their 12 year old though.

7218.Author: Anonymous
7218.Review: Truely a work of art, the nicest whisky I have ever tried at 15 years and great value for money.

7218.Author: Anonymous
7218.Review: This one is very complex for its young age, a must try for all sherry cask lovers

7218.Author: Anonymous
7218.Review: The 12 y old is one of my favourite drams, but found this just a little to sweet and with less kick for my liking.

7218.Author: Anonymous
7218.Review: Sent a bottle Australia for my brother and sister in law for christmas 2010 Superb whisky hard to find in NSW went down a treat at new year very morish Trisha Dodd Sydney NSW Australia

7218.Author: Steve R
7218.Review: It's good to see that reviewers here clearly know what they're talking about. I did a VIP Dalmore distillery tour, thanks to my wife as a wedding present, and some of the staff there think this is slightly nicer than the 18. Obviously that accounts for personal preference, but evidence suggests that the 15 must be up there with the very best. I want one - please Santa!

7218.Author: Sawyer Jigsaw
7218.Review: Awwh! This was sensationally boosted!

7218.Author: Jim Gibbs
7218.Review: This is an exceptional scotch and is much better than the Glenfarclas 15 yr old. Both are heavily sherried but the Dalmore has more body and is smoother. I think Dalmore is really making a big move up in my book.

7218.Author: Nick Hannam
7218.Review: Smooth, very easy drinking. Perhaps more orange than sherry. No sharpness or acidity. As someone else said - seductive. Too easy to drink, it'll take you by surprise.

7218.Author: Mr Claw
7218.Review: First of all, I'm a huge Dalmore fan. This was very polite - almost too polite. Thankfully it's charming and elegant enough to get away with it. The sherry is big and winey but not overpowering like in some Speys (I love that too!). Excellent and complex. Dalmore should bump it up to 46% for those who want a bit more bite though.

7218.Author: SAW
7218.Review: Totally blown away by the 15yo. The 12yo was wonderful, but this is so fragrant and gentle. Compared it to some other siingle malts very nice 15yo I've had in for 10  years, and this was so mellow and rich in flavour. Especially popular with my wife, who described it as a cross between brandy and whisky.

7218.Author: trebor
7218.Review: This newish 15 yo is quite simply superb. Dalmore just seems to produce better and better malts! More sherry than the 12 yo but beautifully balanced with an incredible smooth finish. I am working my way through the Dalmore offerings and look forward to the new 18yo.

7218.Author: James Saxon
7218.Review: Everything I hoped it would be having been unable to stretch to the 1263. For me, nothing else so completely delivers the Highland character as I would want it. Extremely seductive.

7218.Author: karl
7218.Review: a whisky that i compare all others to it. never fails to delight and is always a bottle i have to hand. exquisite.

7218.Author: Anonymous
7218.Review: The most fantastic whisky that I have tasted. So smooth and full of flavour.

7218.Author: Christopher Hanson-Abbott
7218.Review: The smoothest most exotically flavoured whisky that has ever passed my lips

2093.Author: Ravinder Singh
2093.Review: It is marvelous.

2093.Author: Anonymous
2093.Review: Excellent

2093.Author: Anonymous
2093.Review: Excellent malt whishey very mature flavor. Lasting aroma and a great taste.

2093.Author: Angie
2093.Review: I bought this product for my husbands birthday. We have not opened the bottle. But, we were pleased with the service. Thank you

2093.Author: Anonymous
2093.Review: Absolutely delicious. Sweet and fruity, aromatic and smooth.

2093.Author: Jussi
2093.Review: I find vanilla on the nose. Smooth and sweet taste. I like it.

2093.Author: MountainMan
2093.Review: Amazing after 18 mins waiting in the glass neat or with a splash of water, love the 15 year Solera but this is a tad better and way more complex and subtle. Let it open up and you will have a single malt experience of a lifetime.

2093.Author: Anonymous
2093.Review: You can taste all the years inside the oak barrel

2093.Author: Kris
2093.Review: Thin mouth feel and bitter after taste. Gutted I spent so much on this.

2093.Author: Kenny
2093.Review: I’m a peat lover, so never on solid ground with malts like this, but I have to say I like it (small batch). I get a wee bit of toffee on the nose but it’s quite a blast up the nostrils yet very smooth on the palate. I get toasted coconut on the finish, probably just the wood finish but very satisfying nonetheless. Would still take an Ardbeg over it any day but that’s another thing. A very nice drop.

2093.Author: Mike
2093.Review: Lively on the palate but short lived. Not thin, just a clean finish. Big citrus notes. Also I always thought Glenfiddich was a Highland not a Speyside...

2093.Author: Livio
2093.Review: Easy, smooth soft and sociable. Doesn't leavep

2093.Author: Olly Fatterson
2093.Review: Smooth, tastes of caramel and vanilla. Sweet but not over powering, with subtle malty notes

2093.Author: Ken  Dawson
2093.Review: Soft, rounded, sweet malty taste, lovely texture. Completely lovely. Nothing at all to complain about. probably not as complex as 18 year old Highland Park, but what is? Absolutely no complaints. happy for anyone to send me a bottle, any time.

2093.Author: Whitney
2093.Review: Loved it. Went down so smooth.

2093.Author: Mifune
2093.Review: Don't mistake fine and elegant with thin and short-lived. There is a subtle difference for the inexperienced palate.  There is some whiskey much older than 18 years in this giving it a delicate mouth feel and aftertaste

2093.Author: Rolly
2093.Review: Perfect finish!  Best single malt for me!!

2093.Author: Anonymous
2093.Review: Awesome drink..

2093.Author: BC
2093.Review: I read some of the reviews.  Some didn't like the smell-taste-finish. But, fyi, this is not the regular 18yo glenfiddich, this one is the small batch reserve one which is much better than the regular one.

2093.Author: Charlie
2093.Review: Agree with Anonymous.  The 18 year-old has an initial sharpness, not much body and no pleasant or lasting  finish

2093.Author: Erchie Beaver
2093.Review: This is a bonzer whisky, much smoother than Glenlivet and my favourite Speyside.

2093.Author: Anonymous
2093.Review: The Glenfiddich 18 is like a normal 12 year old single malt. It's all relative but Glenfid is lighter than mosy. Not really worth the money and doesn't really taste like 18 year old spirit.

2093.Author: Truthspoon
2093.Review: It's not bad but a 12 year old Highland Park would be a better option. Personally I find this 18 year old Glenfiddich too dry on the finish, in that respect it lacks the thick candy sweetness of the Glenfiddich 12.  It's just not all that. Limited complexity, because the dryness dominates and anything else fades away. They seem to have trouble at 18 these Glenfiddichs. This wayward malt should go to boot camp and learn some finesse.

2093.Author: Igy
2093.Review: Very rich aromas of fruits and smooth taste. One of my favourite!

2093.Author: The Musician
2093.Review: By far the best whiskey I've tasted to date.I really like the 15 year old Solera but this is a step above.It's a tad expensive...so I won't be having 3 drams a night...one a week as a treat !

2093.Author: DK
2093.Review: Superb new release in the completely new bottle. Do NOT make a mistake and buy the old traditional green triangle bottle of this Whiskey . Old version is sweet with no layers or finish. This new version is fantastic.

2093.Author: Jeff
2093.Review: By far my favourite in the Glenfiddich line.  Smooth and rich, excellent with a drop or two of water.

2093.Author: MrSerious
2093.Review:
Re-review: After emptiing most of the bottle and acquiring new tumblers i'm even more fascinated by this whiskey. 
Nose: After letting it breath for a few minutes a lovely floral aroma (pears  and apples) overlaced with dense honey sweetnes and some raisins accompanied by gentle barrique type smoke.
Palate: Taste is the reflection of the nose; thick sweet honey and warm tender smoke.
Finish: The finish is rather short and oaky. It rounds up this perfect whiskey.
I would give it 9,3/10 an exellent value for money, especially.

2093.Author: Marko
2093.Review: Just amazing. I always have a bottle at home. Hope they don't raise the price!

2093.Author: Franko80
2093.Review:
I made the biggest mistake of all times... Comparing this to Glenmorangie 18!
Such a sweet & smooth expression as Glenmo 18 neat, got me really confused ''cause I pretended to drink Fiddich 18 neat which was a major mistake... There''s no room for ice in the first one, however Fiddich 18 opens up wonderfully when wattered down a bit, having it straight from the bottle could be some sort of a bad decision, it brings a huge alcohol kick that wont let you take advantage of its complexity, so 
add two ice cubes for experiencing one of the best single malts out there!

2093.Author: CaptainFlapJack
2093.Review: One of the best Whiskies on the market to date everything about it pure luxury and pure class. It amazes me that people say the 15 is better. there seriously must be something wrong with all you peoples taste buds because this tastes far more luxurious than the 15 year old.

2093.Author: MrSerious
2093.Review:
Nose: Very floral and exeptionally strong, I smell william''s pear, vanilla, oak and some aromas I can''t identify
Taste: Very oaky and refreshing, some of the fresh floral notes from the nose turn up. It''s not at all sweet and it has a magnificient warming oaky finish, that lingers on the tounge for queit some time. 
Overall it''s a very wonderful whiskey for the price.

2093.Author: Craig Bryant
2093.Review:
Nose - banana, vanilla, fresh green apples and oak with a hint of furniture polish. Palate - Fresh fruit with apple and pear and hints of xmas cake.
Finish - Long and dry with spice, a little rum and raisin.

Lovely whisky, one  of my favourites.

2093.Author: Anonymous
2093.Review: Bananas and vanilla fudge...does anyone else get that? Very sweet finish, perhaps not as complex as the Solera but still it''s a hard drink to put down, so delicious.

2093.Author: hotspur harry
2093.Review: just had a wee dram and oh boy it is delightful. pure class.

2093.Author: Anonymous
2093.Review: price quality ratio is one of the best in the world

2093.Author: Bernard Uttley, Switzerland
2093.Review: I have tasted nearly every whisky on the market and have kept an extensive collection of mainly 25-year-old whiskies in my cellar for over 20 years now. This 18-year-old is magnificent! Extremely good value for money and a competitor for my other favourites Macallan 18-year-old and Glenmorangie 30-year-old! Buy it and enjoy it. It is smooth, fruity and mellow.

2093.Author: Anonymous
2093.Review: This whisky is an absolute bargain for it's age, and it doesn't taste too bad either! Lovely sherry notes, and soooo smooth you'll find it hard to put down.

2093.Author: Jamie H
2093.Review:
This is good, really good, but I just simply prefer the 15yo. 

This is often on demonstration stalls in UK duty free and I always have a nip just to see if my tastes have changed but as yet they haven't. Until they do I can't justify shelling out for a bottle.

2093.Author: Lars Nilsson
2093.Review: Save your money and buy the 15 yo solera.The 15 is much better and really one of the best whiskys in the world.

2093.Author: John
2093.Review: I thought the Glenfiddch 15 year old was good, but this is even better. It is also a lot better than some  of the other 18 year old single malts out there. At first I didn't rate it, but its warm, understated elegance grows on you.

2093.Author: mark brailsford
2093.Review: Why do some so called malt drinkers think that because certain malts are sold on a large commercial basis they are not worth bothering with?let me tell you this 18yo is one of the best out there...go on all you snobs, give this a try.

2093.Author: Anonymous
2093.Review: Best drink ever!

2093.Author: zeus
2093.Review: Man, this is a whisky dream come true.. a real treat to the senses. Unbelievable balance, lovely apple and orange undertones, coupled with a hint of smoke that is merely there to enhance the experience. Briefly, the best single malt under 40 quid. My ALL TIME FAVORITE. Must keep at least two bottles handy and replenish when you can. Enjoy folks.

2093.Author: stewie ramone
2093.Review: the 12 year old is nice. this 18 year old is even better. very nice fruit flavour at the finnish.

2093.Author: Mavrickxxx.
2093.Review: Ive just bought a bottle of this stuff and im leaving it for christmas day.

2093.Author: Anonymous
2093.Review: This is a very dangerous whisky! - it is so good, that once you have tasted it, you cannot drink anything less.This is what happened to me.  So here I am ordering more bottles.So, if you can't afford it, don't even try it!

2093.Author: trebor
2093.Review: Don't let the fact that because Glenfiddich is the top selling single malt put you off. It sells a lot of malt because the product is superb! This 18 yo is magnificent. Slight smoke on the nose but a first taste of date - orange peel and plum. A truly superb single malt for all seasons!

2093.Author: davey boy
2093.Review: I am reviewing the 18 year old ancient reserve seeing as it is the bottle featured ?!As described the dram is oak apple with honey and some maltyness on the nose. This drifts in with real subtlety and is more to my taste than the 12 year old. A more characterful dram with a long finish worth the 6 year wait...

2093.Author: Anonymous
2093.Review: good whisky better than the more expensive ancient reserve this i had with just an ice cube  ancient reserve with alot of water. this is smooth with no bad after taste .

2093.Author: taster
2093.Review: best whisky i have ever tasted and i have tasted alot-just add a wee bit water

3512.Author: BrownMan
3512.Review: Some good scotch, taste similar to woodford double oak.

3512.Author: 2Cubes1Malt
3512.Review: Oh this be a wonderful scotch.  When the bottle is empty, your eyes will tear up.  The smoky sweetness lingers very pleasantly (especially if you have a moustache) ;)

3512.Author: Anonymous
3512.Review: The nose on Macallan 12 smells like a band aid with hints of sulfure. However, the palate is viscous, deep, and rich just like a fine red wine with a steak.

3512.Author: Anonymous
3512.Review: An excellent 12 year. My preference for a libation.

3512.Author: Vijay Macwan
3512.Review: Wonderful aroma and taste

3512.Author: Rob
3512.Review: Simply the best 12 year old scotch you can buy. I love trying all different scotchs and I keep coming back to this one as the gold standard. The less people drink sherry, the more rare this will become. I forget how good it is, then I get a bottle for Christmas and fall in love all over again. I also got the double cask strength one and the 12 year old regular one is miles better. Absolutely brilliant!

3512.Author: Matt
3512.Review: I included this one in a lineup of scotches to sample as a newbie. It has emerged as one that will have a place in my cabinet representing the sherried end of the spectrum. I also like that just about any decent restaurant or bar will have it.

3512.Author: Mark
3512.Review: Probably the best Whiskey of this age you can buy. Absolute quality.

3512.Author: Javier Nade
3512.Review: Magnifico whisky,

3512.Author: Thadeus
3512.Review: A little sweet, but amazing whiskey.

3512.Author: PW-swedeb
3512.Review: GREAT wiskey...wow..!!

3512.Author: Good
3512.Review: For me, the eternal beginner, because I feel what I feel without knowing or distinguishing the flavours. But one thing I know, what is good for me. I feel this is a quality malt whisky, sophisticated and refined. reminds me somehow glengoyne 21 as happened with the Macallan 12 Fine Oak that reminds me the glengoyne 12. This Macallan 12 Sherry Cask is sweet, complex, medium to long finish with reminiscence of bourbon, good malt flavour. And also is too expensive for me. I still prefer Glengoyne, for my taste has open flavours while refined and sophisticated too and less expensive.

3512.Author: Sid
3512.Review: Limited as compared to 12 year with double casks.

3512.Author: Slaists
3512.Review: Had a mini ... wish it was full size bottle! Liked it very much.

3512.Author: ark
3512.Review: I tried the Macallan 12 last night for the first time and it was too sweet for my liking

3512.Author: frank
3512.Review: excellent dram, buy it you won't regret it.

3512.Author: Slaists
3512.Review: Got mini to try. So good, will get a full size!

3512.Author: Anonymous
3512.Review: The smoothest 12yr old scotch with I've tried with dept

3512.Author: Scott
3512.Review: Simply one of the finest Single Malts @ this price point.  Drinks like one that's much pricier.  The Sherry takes a backseat to a subtle sweetness and dark fruits.  Slight spice and oak round out the experience.  Top notch!

3512.Author: Andrew
3512.Review: Very smooth, vanilla & sherry sweetness with a bit of wood smoke. Good one.

3512.Author: Lou Bones
3512.Review: A little pricy, but worth it. Very smooth.  The sherry influence is wonderful.  Nice medium length finish.

3512.Author: Ribas
3512.Review: Excellent!  One of my favorite whiskys.

3512.Author: Andrew
3512.Review: This is the best non peated scotch I've had. A very nice thick syrupy scotch. Spice sherry and fruit. Perfect.

3512.Author: Anonymous
3512.Review: Good vanilla smell. Sweet and strong

3512.Author: Anonymous
3512.Review: Honestly, this scotch is only okay at first taste.  It's sweet and has an orange citrus taste.  But after the initial, there is a tobacco taste that hangs in your mouth.  I don't smoke so it surprised me that I enjoyed this taste.  The finish has a spicy burn that is actually very enjoyable as long as you don't take too big of a drink.  Too pricey for me for this scotch.

3512.Author: ron hall
3512.Review: the best scotch I have ever tasted

3512.Author: Anonymous
3512.Review: This is an excellent whisky although not the be all-end all many claim it to be. Thoroughly enjoyable. The heavy sherried quality gives it a syrupy kind of sweetness that, much like a heavily peated whisky I have to be in the mood for. Great after dinner dram especially after a big steak. Highly recommended but try others in the same price range and you will be pleasantly surprised about how many great whiskies there are in this price range. This applies especially to us Americans who seem to this this is "it".

3512.Author: Whiskey Kid
3512.Review: On the nose I can smell vanilla, dried fruit, and the sherry sweetness on the spot! On the palate it's wonderful; it's spicy but also sweet like honey. You can definitely taste the sherry and the dried fruit instantly. It's the smoothest whiskey I've had so far. It's much better than the Macallan 15yo old. 5 Stars!!

3512.Author: Margaret Gibson
3512.Review: Gorgeous and smooth x

3512.Author: Anonymous
3512.Review: Smooth and well balanced

3512.Author: Anonymous
3512.Review: On the rocks, its just amazing!

3512.Author: Denise
3512.Review:
My first purchase was the 10, which I found very good. 
The 12 is beyond amazing. The subtle sweetness, coupled with the smooth finish has won me over. 
YUM...LOL

3512.Author: ronald g hall
3512.Review: its great

3512.Author: Sippers Social Club
3512.Review: One of my favorite sherry''d whiskys. Well balanced, easy drinking. You can still find it, but the prices are going up. For that price I think this is one of the best whisky's in the world.

3512.Author: JD
3512.Review: Fantastic product the whiskey you open have one glass then another, really could drink it all, very smooth full and full of flavour a real beauty

3512.Author: Anonymous
3512.Review: I''m more of a bourbon guy, but after trying this I''m definitely considering switching to it as my go to drink. Smooth, good aroma, overall a pleasant experience.  Picked up a bottle right after my first time having it.

3512.Author: David A
3512.Review: My favourite. Unfortunately now a victim of Macallan''s lunatic marketing strategy, and consequently the price just keeps rocketing. That said, by pulling this Macallan have forced me to broaden my horizons and I''m finding some real gems elsewhere in Speyside and even beyond. D''you think that''s why they did it?

3512.Author: Spirited
3512.Review: Working for the company I understand how precious this fine dram is, unrivalled at this moment, get some before it disappears!

3512.Author: Tim
3512.Review: An absolute delight.  Smokey and smooth, rich and refined.  This is the scotch your grandfather would be proud to see you drinking during/after a long day at the office.

3512.Author: Toronto Tim (Canada)
3512.Review: I always LOVE the Macallan-12, but we only have the GOLD/etc... series in Canada now. I have to go to the USA to smuggle a few bottles back at 62$US/bot. Alas, I have to supplement it with Glendronach-12 (or Aberlour-12) from time to time, to avoid depleting my bottles to quickly !

3512.Author: John PE
3512.Review: Tasted this one by chance and could not get it out of my mind - an incredible contrast to the peats I was familiar with (e.g. Laphroaig). Lucky for me The Whisky Exchange delivers to the antipodes! Unluckily I have one stashed away for the boy as a coming of age gift ...

3512.Author: John
3512.Review: You just want to finish the bottle and go to get another one! That how good it is. For me at least..

3512.Author: Kenneth B.Marshall
3512.Review: This is definitely a mature man,s Scotch! Enjoy my friend>

3512.Author: KBM
3512.Review: This a definitely a mature man's Scotch. Enjoy my friend!!

3512.Author: Mikko
3512.Review: Plain Jane to me, not much complexity. Overpriced, but decent quality Macallan.

3512.Author: Chef grey
3512.Review: Being someone who is just developing a collection of whiskey/scotch, I just purchased a bottle of Macallan 12.  Delightfully smooth start, with a hint of the sherry.  A warm finish, with no fire.  Of the half dozen bottles in my cache, it is IMO the most pleasant.

3512.Author: Anonymous
3512.Review:
The first Macallan i ever tasted,,,& it won't be the last.
A lovely dram, & a unique "Macallan" taste.

3512.Author: Kenneth B.Marshall
3512.Review: I have tasted the Glenlivet 15 year (French Reserve),the Glenffidch 12 year, Johnnine Walker Black, and now Macallan 12 year old! All are vastly distinct in taste,aroma,personality if I may. If i had to choose my personal favorite,I perfer Glenlivet 15 year (French Reserve).... A mature man of taste> Enjoy my friend.

3512.Author: Anonymous
3512.Review: Very nice and easy to drink, lovely sherry sweetness but can't help thinking that it would be better at 46%-48% alc. needs a bit more ooomph on the finish.

3512.Author: Fred
3512.Review: I love this, even over the 18, for it's sweet nose

3512.Author: Kevin H
3512.Review: Great sherry nose with plenty of fruitcake and dates.  Tastes delicious, rich sherry, dried fruits and subtle malt.  The finish is good with a little spice but comes up a bit short. Perhaps not the best sherry cask malt out there these days but still the benchmark against which others should be judged.

3512.Author: Anonymous
3512.Review: I wish they would bring back the sherry oaks on a regular basis.

3512.Author: Derek
3512.Review: Managed to pick up a bottle in Thailand and very happy with this whisky nice and smooth.

3512.Author: Dr John
3512.Review: This whiskey is my second ultimate experience, exceeded only by the 18 year old version

3512.Author: Manu
3512.Review: I'm tempted, would you say this is worth the extra money over the Macallan Fine Oak and Sherry Oak expressions?

3512.Author: Anonymous
3512.Review: I love this one, the sherry makes it smooth and sweet, a hint of smoke and floure, this is by far my favorite 12 yo I've tasted, I will always keep a bottle of this at the house, and the price is good

3512.Author: Aaron McNaught
3512.Review: A wonderful whisky, but drink it before heading into the peaty and smoky Islay or the powerful Skye. Otherwise its subtlties will go underappreciated. I love The Macallans fullness of flavor.

3512.Author: Anonymous
3512.Review: Neat or the rocks, nothing compares to Macallan! Simply the best. Period!

3512.Author: TK
3512.Review: Save your pennies and beg ,borrow to get your hands on this fine malt. A delicate balance, it will leave you grinning long after your first sip. Just a beautiful experience !

3512.Author: Jason
3512.Review: Hmm, what should i add....THE BEST THERE IS! I drink my whiskey on the rocks and this is the best tasting so far.

3506.Author: Boss Lady
3506.Review: I think it is smooth going down with a light taste of smoked oak

3506.Author: Anonymous
3506.Review: Very nice! Smooth taste with hints of vanilla.

3506.Author: Smedlet
3506.Review: Macallan - the Rolls Royce of whiskies. Just not this one. Oak Oaky McOak seeks  vanilla partner for good times and fun - gsoh essential, looks not important. Wagwan??Macallan = Sherry, so buy some of that & drink it FFS.

3506.Author: David
3506.Review: Have kept this 10 year Macallan Fine Oak for about three years, as a whisky drinker for 50 years, I think it is probably the best one I have ever tasted.

3506.Author: Mike
3506.Review: I''m fairly new when it comes to single malts I''ve only been drinking them for about a year and I''ve just picked up a bottle of this tonight cheap and when I opened it, poured a glass and had a whiff I wasn''t that impressed and I thought it smelt and looked like my glenmorangie 10 year...i put a drop of water in, then left it a few mins and the smell changed to something different, almost like a bourbon but partially floral. This whiskey goes down smooth and sweet with a slight warmth that I really like. I don''t know if it''s just me but with the finish I''m getting a strong granny smith apple skin taste that is very morish, very nice whiskey I shall defiantly get this again

3506.Author: George
3506.Review: Something Special For Under £50 This Is Amazing, I Got This In A Wooden Box... The Smell.... I Appreciate This Well & Truly!

3506.Author: Aldwyn
3506.Review: Macallan 10 Year Old / Fine Oak: Unadventurous. Brittle. You'll need your clearest nose and clean palate to pull out any fleeing flavors and a finish that runs away before you can switch on ujjayi breathing. I've tried on many different occasions. Most neglected bottle. For same money, I get a better experience elsewhere.

3506.Author: Cosmin Marginean
3506.Review:
Nose: Heavy wood and sherry, toffee
Palate: A lot of walnut, a bit of fruit and plenty of oak
Finish: Smooth and lingering. Good balance

A great balance and the first time I’ve experienced this combination of fruit and walnut. But maybe it’s just me.

3506.Author: Rick.
3506.Review: As smooth as they come. One of my favorite malts.

3506.Author: Joe Mc
3506.Review: A lovely, mild, warming Scotch. Fantastic price, this will not disappoint. I completely agree with Big Als' comment about sweet dough on the palette! Lovely stuff...

3506.Author: Joe from Germany
3506.Review:
a nice smooth whisky for "newbies" (like me) for a great price!
loved every drop of it last year and just ordered more of it,
also more from Macallan

3506.Author: Allan
3506.Review: I am no expert and don't do tasting notes but for me it wasn't bad, just a bit boring

3506.Author: Steve
3506.Review: New bottle, new review. Its got the woody flavor I like, it even seems a little darker than before! Not as 'silky' smooth as I remember, but expressive. Has a nice kick with a reasonable aftertaste. Tastes to me of cocoa powder, and pineapple, some sherry. I like pairing this with a rich home-cooked meal more than by itself though. I'd drink it straight and warm. Not bad.

3506.Author: matt
3506.Review: stunning whisky for the price. the sherry oak will blow u away. macallan is the best by a mile for me

3506.Author: big Al
3506.Review: This is nice. undilluted It has a delicacy that is backed with an underlying power that somehow reasures its quality. wonderfull deep butterscotch, burnt caramel nose repeats itself on the pallet joined by hints of lemon curd and sweet dough. Topped off with a pleasant mouth burn that just starts to show chilli then falls back to butterscotch. I love it.

3506.Author: Anonymous
3506.Review: I'm torn on this.  It's very pleasent and drinkable, but it's not the spectacular experience I expected.  Maybe i'm just being too picky.  I'd buy it again certainly.

3506.Author: Paul
3506.Review: I have 10  whiskeys in my cupboard at any one time, and prefer this to many more expensive whiskeys I may have open. Cracking whisky for a cracking price.

3506.Author: O.H.Draw
3506.Review: Yep I completely recognize what Steve experienced.I would have to agree with his comment.

3506.Author: Ian
3506.Review: I don't like this Whisky.  It tastes more like a White Wine to me than Scotch.  Tastes bitter and heavy of oak.

3506.Author: Steve
3506.Review: This whisky is decent, I made back-to-back purchases but then there were others. What I like about this malt is the fresh yeast or dough taste and it seems buttery. What I don't like is that there is this pine taste which disagrees, and its a bit on the dry side.

3506.Author: Smithery-Baggins
3506.Review: I wasn't that impressed by this, it's not in any way a bad whisky but to me it just seemed a bit bland and lacks character.

3506.Author: Mv.
3506.Review: Nice one Camilla.  though his tastes in whisky are perfect unlike your horse face.

3506.Author: Camilla - windsor
3506.Review: Given Prince Charles's taste in Women Mr Coles then that is hardly a recommendation!

3506.Author: Anonymous
3506.Review: Just tried the Fine Oak 10 years and its delicious. Cant wait to try some of the sherry oak varieties. Macallan has to be one of the best makers

3506.Author: D.Scott.
3506.Review: The Macallan is one of the most easy malts to drink. The 15yr old is simply stunning. If you havnt tried it yet then go now and buy a bottle. I promise you will fall in love with it.

3506.Author: davey boy
3506.Review: Full flavour with thick and creamy honeyed mouth feel. Warming and long finish benefits for the oaky smokiness rather than the sherried appraoch of the conventional 10 year old. Gorgeous dram...

3506.Author: Eric Coles
3506.Review: Definitely my favourite malt ... no wonder Prince Charles likes Macallan! It's on my retirement gift list ...

3506.Author: Mike
3506.Review: The nose reminds me of orange pekoe tea.  Very sweet, thick and tasty.

9210.Author: Ulf Grad?n
9210.Review: Certainly one of the very best no age whiskies from the islands. Less peaty than e.g dark storm but with a more direct and very palatable approach. Not particularly smooth and clearly not shy but a good candidate for a best in class award.

9210.Author: Anonymous
9210.Review: Enjoyed over x'ms good dram

9210.Author: Shawn
9210.Review: This whisky is very good. I'm not inclined to wax poetic about it, but I enjoy it. The palate is a little watery, but with an intact core of flavor. The nose is the best part of this whisky, very nice, but slightly too distant, like an old soul trying to be heard over the din and noise of youth. Woops, I guess I did wax poetic...

9210.Author: Alasdair F
9210.Review: This has to be the best Single Malt produced by Talisker.

9210.Author: Govert from Groningen
9210.Review: Best whisky I''ve ever tasted, and I''ve tasted quite a few. Hits you smack in the face with the first sip, but immediately goes on to soothe you with a special smoky, peaty and spicy treatment that will target all your tastebuds and linger in your mouth for what seems like an eternity, after which it politely takes its leave to nestle itself into your heart forever. Perfection.

9210.Author: Stosh
9210.Review: A powerful (57% ABV) and bold but, deceptively smooth and very enjoyable whiskey.  The tasting notes  says it starts out sweet and explodes on the palate with smoke and pepper. And yes it does explode with a long finish. A very good no age statement expression of Talisker, I''m going to need another bottle to take home!

9210.Author: Toronto Tim
9210.Review: Finally, in Canada - for triple the quids...

9210.Author: Kevin H
9210.Review: Big and powerful but classic Talisker.  The smoke on this is superb.  Clearly a step up from the very good 10yo version.

9210.Author: Anonymous
9210.Review: Delicious with Diet Irn Bru. Don't knock it till you've tried it. Sensational.

9210.Author: Finnegan
9210.Review:
Possibly the most complex Talisker I've encountered. Classic nose- tar, seaweed, a creosoted fence on a hot July day, lemon juice squeezed over fresh oysters, an old plastic fish crate washed up on a Hebridean beach. On the palate- more smoke mingles with honey, vanilla and pepper before the big spicy explosion leads to a long finish. The delicious fumes drift back up your throat to your nose.
Stupendous, world class whisky. You won't regret buying this one.

9210.Author: Howard Matthews
9210.Review: I'm ready to go back and pick up a few more bottles.

9210.Author: Big Al
9210.Review: Just having a dram of this after having first had a(Talisker) 10yro, an 18yro, and an 07 release 25yro.This one can hold its head high in that lofty company. Highly recomended and will always have a place in my collection.A perfect finish to a little trip to the Isle of Skye! Enjoy!

9210.Author: Brian J
9210.Review: The only thing this whisky needs is a glass to put it in!

9210.Author: Oliver
9210.Review: I agree with some of the other reviewers - this is a great whisky. It bears the unmistakable distillery hallmarks and is very smooth for a 57% peated whisky (in a good way). Perhaps a bit sweeter and not as peppery as the 10 YO but equally good in a slightly different hue. Mood alone determines whether I prefer the 10 YO or 57 North. I prefer both to the 18 YO and Distiller's Edition but still rank those versions as some of my favourite whiskies.

9210.Author: Super Single Malts
9210.Review: Have just reviewed this and thoroughly enjoyed. Different to the 10 year old, unmistakably Talisker and a power house at cask strength. I will definately return to this bottling again, but I have to move on to others to try!

9210.Author: Anonymous
9210.Review: Just visited the distillery and bought a bottle of this home. For me this beats the 10yo and 18yo, which are also fantastic...

9210.Author: Whisk(e)y Lover
9210.Review: Truly a phenomenal whisky! For something in this price range it is an absolute bargain, such a myriad of flavors and a great proof. Probably will go down as one of the all time greats.

9210.Author: Anonymous
9210.Review: Just finished a bottle of the 57 N. If one isn't a purist mainly concerned with age, this is a great buy and a must for having guests over on occasion.

9210.Author: Anonymous
9210.Review: Typically more of a bourbon guy, but starting to get more into SMS and this is an incredibly wonderful whisky. Can't put all the flavors into words, but just incredibly flavorful with a long satisfying finish.

9210.Author: Anonymous
9210.Review: perhaps not meaning coca cola?

9210.Author: Travis Kingdon
9210.Review: Yeh, one of the best whiskies ever from one of the best distilleries ever. At 57% it has the raw power to go with the great Islay's...and then some.

9210.Author: Tom
9210.Review: Even though it's 57? it's very smooth. Typical Talisker flavours are found here, but turned upside-down: less chilli-pepper and more smoke. I like it, but I still prefer the fieriness of the 10Y.

9210.Author: Anonymous
9210.Review: Well, this is indeed one my favorites whiskies at the moment. But, I prefer it straight despite it being bottled at almost cask strength. I honestly prefer it without any water added. It is indeed smoother than the regular 10 yo Talisker, with the very characteristic flavors of Talisker and thus an unmistakable and unforgettable flavor. I find it difficult after having a dram, not having a second one... :-)

9210.Author: packrat
9210.Review: Had a distillery tour at Talisker last month and came away with a bottle of this stuff.  Its a fantastic whisky, but the "standard" Talisker is so good, I'm not sure 57 North is better.  They said at the distillery that its not given an age because it is a blend of some very young and some quite old Taliskers.

9210.Author: Jimbo
9210.Review: probably the age is technically below ten years old as there will be some quite young whisky in there.  Flavour is great, though.

9210.Author: peatapal
9210.Review: would like to know the age about this whisky

9210.Author: witness
9210.Review: Nice joke about coke))

9210.Author: David.
9210.Review: The "coke poster" is either a completely clueless novice or a practical joker.Talisker is a great drop,with a lovely peppered spice finish

9210.Author: Anonymous
9210.Review: Coke!??? this whiskey don't need ice, nothing!

9210.Author: l'urots
9210.Review: coke you don't deserve to drink any scotch!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!Anyway this is a great dram, heavy on nose and palate a real robust drink. Best enjoyed with a splash of water

9210.Author: Anonymous
9210.Review: Coke? Sacrilege!

9210.Author: Anonymous
9210.Review: good

9210.Author: stuey
9210.Review: lovely with coke...

9210.Author: Jan Nielsen, Copenhagen
9210.Review: This whisky is the crown of my home collection. Tried it in a duty-free shop and i simply had to buy it. This whisky is dangerous! So much character and flavour in spite of the high alcohol percentage. Goes well as it is, but it's still recommendable to ad a bit of water.

10767.Author: Steve
10767.Review: A life changing experience. Like being punched in the face, then gently laid down on a bed of burning cinders. What an fantastic explosion of briny peat, with tendrils of dragon smoke curling around you like a coastal fog bank. Lovers of honey and sugar icing can look elsewhere, as the Corry is a million miles from the oak forests of Jerez, and what a pure, savouring and hugely satisfying experience it is too.

10767.Author: Louie
10767.Review: This tastes like an exploding sun made of peat. I pretty much exclusively avoid NAS but this is an exception that absolutely must be had. The most powerful and fun finish to a scotch I've experienced.

10767.Author: Leon
10767.Review:
very  good and 
excellent 5 star

10767.Author: Anonymous
10767.Review: Very good.

10767.Author: Arron Morgan
10767.Review: A wonderful dram - smoky, smooth and peaty all at the same time. Everything an expression like this should be - it is unmistakably an Ardbeg yet with extra aroma and flavours throughout. Outstanding!

10767.Author: Ricky Jones
10767.Review: Tried a sample of this in an airport recently and WOW! Punch in the mouth of peat and smoke.. great depth and character.. not sure it's  worth the ?70  price range but definitely a great whiksy if ever on offer ???? Just a tip ** add a drop of water to really open up the flavours! The 57% alcohol will really Zap your taste buds!

10767.Author: Stanley
10767.Review: Tasted it during a whisky tasting at my wines and spirits store inMalta.  Everybody was stunned with the aromas, taste and finish.  From the feedback, its a man's whisky.  www.ilbettija.com.mt

10767.Author: Dermott
10767.Review: A belter of a whisky

10767.Author: Shaun Wilson
10767.Review: Wow. I'm reeling from the sip.  Almost confused,  but thrilled with what's happening - what an amazing experience.

10767.Author: John Jones
10767.Review: Wow - phenomenal!  This is the best wee dram I've ever had.  Perfect in every way.  A must try!

10767.Author: Senzo Mpanza
10767.Review: Best Whiskey Ever.It's the Finest.

10767.Author: Dan whitaker
10767.Review: Marvellous

10767.Author: John B
10767.Review: What a whisky! Thought 10yo & Uigeadail were stunning but Corryvreckan is even better.

10767.Author: Jay
10767.Review: Different than the other ardbed's, sweet with and almost burnt ginger bread finish. Quite nice!

10767.Author: Anonymous
10767.Review: A smoke bomb, yet so complex and satisfying. Completely addicted

10767.Author: Mifune
10767.Review: Divine, magic

10767.Author: Lippy
10767.Review: So unique and addicting.

10767.Author: Anonymous
10767.Review: 6 stars

10767.Author: Keith Flint
10767.Review: Absolutely divine.... pure perfection

10767.Author: April
10767.Review: Was looking for something similar to the Laphroag 18 yr and the Ardbeg Corryvreckan far exceeds the Laphroag. I think I'm in love!

10767.Author: Kevin
10767.Review:
Further down the bottle now. Each glass changes if it is left to settle. Nose Starts off dark chocolate, but with 20 minutes with cover over, sticking plaster comes through strongly. Antiseptic, o-cresol phenolic compound suggesting high initial combustion temperature of the peat. Pepper also appears if left a little longer. 
These flavours alternate and fade with each visit.
Palate is oily, chocolate, antiseptic and briney. A little French wine at the end.
Finish is cigar smoke, very oily, peat smoke.
Got a feeling that each glass of AC will seem different from the previous one.
A phenomenon of a peated malt. Very multilayered.
Peat and Rich. Full bodied.

10767.Author: Anonymous
10767.Review: Smooth,with a !ight smoke and strong wet leathered chocolate. An astonishing maelstrom of tastes,but neither confusing nor contradictory. I tasted this at a hotel in Skye, as a 'barman's choice'......I've since bought a bottle and I'm at the "preaching" stage.   Best malt I've ever tried,without exception.  This is the Penfolds Grange 1982 of whisky- damn good,damn expensive and worth every penny.

10767.Author: Doug calvert
10767.Review: A wonderful whisky, a must for all peat loving drinkers. One of the best whiskys I have tasted

10767.Author: Kevin
10767.Review:
Appearance - tawny

Coatline - very thin, almost not there.
Legs - take a long time to run, when they do very slow and very thin. Indicates presence of oils and a heavy whisky because the legs take so long to run and run slowly - high ABV.

Nose - oily, chocolate, buttery, peat, infusion of pine, aromas seem to alter at each visit.

Palate - salty, oily, winey, cream, butter, chocolate, reflecting finish in a wine cask, Tarmac right at the end.

Finish - medium length, oily, chilli, some Peating, orange peel after a while

Conclusion - a great variation on the 10 year old.  Not as peaty IMO as the 10.

10767.Author: Anonymous
10767.Review: 1, at a push 2 a night. Strong.

10767.Author: John (Glasgow)
10767.Review: Just sampled a selection of single malt whiskies and by far the best was the Ardbeg Corryvreckan. If you like a peaty, powerful Islay whisky then this one is for you!

10767.Author: Anonymous
10767.Review: Oh my .. what a taste. I am not a connoisseur of whiskeys but this resonates with my buds. Thanks to my friend who gave this to me as a present. I would give six stars.

10767.Author: Mikalai
10767.Review: This one is even better than Uigeadail. Uigeadail was a top notch for me until I bought Corryvreckan

10767.Author: Anonymous
10767.Review: Sweetness, flavor, and character!

10767.Author: Jas
10767.Review: This one hits your taste buds with an explosion of flavour. My first taste was a shock, second sip was divine. Pleased I brought this one!

10767.Author: steelman
10767.Review: I have tried Uigeadail and ordinary 10yr old Ardbeg and then I tried Corryvreckan I have to say they are all great in different ways. The 10yr old is more punchy but doesn't have the same sweetness or smoothness as the other two. I still think Uigeadail is my favourite smoothest and incredible taste but I  found myself incredibly impressed with Corryvreckan its richer I would treat myself to both of these both excellent .The 10 year  old I buy the miniatures when I fancy a wee Islay punch of phenol in my throat to warm me in winter.

10767.Author: Andy
10767.Review: Without a doubt my favorite whiskey. Full bodied, almost creamy. A generous amount of peat without being harsh. There''s notes of brine on the finish, if I had to describe this scotch, I''d even go so far as saying it has notes of bacon thanks to this combination. A permanent feature in my collection!

10767.Author: Anonymous
10767.Review: This is by far the best scotch I have ever tasted. It is so intense an full of flavor that I can longer drink my old favorite, Laphoaig because it tastes too bland now. Powerful, mouthwatering and so full of flavor. Fantastic

10767.Author: Anonymous
10767.Review: This was my dad''s bottle. Tough to take as a shot but really great with dr pepper

10767.Author: Nick A
10767.Review: I don''t car what the whisky bible says about Japanese and Taiwanese Malts.  THIS is the best whisky in the world (for under ?100 anyway).  No messing with softening sweet sherry casks; pure Islay, smoke, peak and a tad of seaweed.  Dryer and darker than uigeadail.

10767.Author: Gavin Francis
10767.Review: Corryvreckan was all that it claimed to be and more.

10767.Author: Geraldo S.
10767.Review: Very, very nice. As a lover of Logavulin and Laphroig, I appreciate the peaty smoke nose, taste, and finish.  All Ardbegs are excellent and each bring a subtle satisfying uniqueness.  Always smiling with pleasure after Ardbeg, and this one may have brought a broader smile.

10767.Author: Sam McArthur
10767.Review: Got a bottle of this from the girlfried for my birthday absolutley loved it made me buy more islay whisky and will be getting another bottle of this to see in the new years with

10767.Author: M. Helminen
10767.Review: I was surprised to find that a sample I'd saved of a 2011 bottling was considerably tastier than a 2012 bottle opened several weeks ago. There was a tasty, Alligatorishly charred meat - gunpowder note present that I couldn't get out of the fresh one, making the sample richer in taste than the new bottle. Otherwise they smelled very much the same. There seemed to be a small difference in colour as well, the 2011 being a shade darker.

10767.Author: Szarik
10767.Review: I've tried it after Uigeadail and I must say I was really disappointed..is a quite a young whisky you can tell that by the smell and is a bit harsh on taste..very unbalanced.

10767.Author: The Colonel
10767.Review: Another belter from Ardbeg. Distinctly different from the others in the range and equally brilliant. If you have tried anything else from Ardbeg, Laphroaig or Lagavulin and loved the heavily peated style then this has to be on your wishlist. Very fair price for such an immensely great whisky.

10767.Author: Mach
10767.Review: Looking forward to April 28th release for 2012

10767.Author: Anonymous
10767.Review: This is a very delicious version of Ardbeg.  Color: straw. Nose: Briney, slightly smokey, ozone. Taste: Blast of smoke and peat.  Very briney, reminds me of Bunnahabhain 12 but in a peaty and intense way. Finish: Long and dry. Superb whisky but young.

10767.Author: Calvin
10767.Review:
I love Ardbeg, but this one is in a class of it's own. More balanced, more complex, more lenght. 1 word: WOW!
Highly recommended.

10767.Author: Peat Gangsta
10767.Review: Color: Gold amber   1Legs: Beautiful, thick, oily streaks.  Nose: Medicinal, smoke, peat, mango fruit.Palate: Medicinal, smoke, peat, citrus, mango, brine, petrol, intense alcohol, and reminiscent of Lap 10 y.o. cask strength.Finish: Stays with you for hours.  My goodness, this is wonderful stuff.Comment: Amazing, amazing, amazing.  Oh, and uh, WOW.  Outstanding.  Grade A  or 92/100.  Which ever you fancy.  Ardbeg delivers.

10767.Author: Anonymous
10767.Review: Compared to the Uigeadail expression this one is to expensive... but as it looks some prefer this one. I go for Uigeadail any day! Way better value for the money!

10767.Author: Ian
10767.Review: Explosive assault on the taste buds! Incredible depth, rock salt, smokey sea weed and chocolate orange.  Finish leaves your mouth confused and puckering for more.  Excellent Ardbeg expression.

10767.Author: Anonymous
10767.Review: Another masterpiece from the lords of peat, a 5 star dram!

10767.Author: Alexandros G.
10767.Review: A brilliant dram.Not for every day use,but when you want something really,and I totally mean it,outstanding rare deep mystic mind-blowing,there is nothing else to drink...

10767.Author: Vinny Marsden
10767.Review: Lovely deep flavours and coal/smoke to the fore...it releases subtle blends of orange..spices/pepper..and as per others..a drop of water releases a beautiful "nose"...

10767.Author: Jeff Khan
10767.Review: If you dare to put snobbishness aside, and rate a whisky purely on tase then Ardbeg is trouncing much, much more expensive vintages from the big names in single malt. Been there, done that. Ardbeg. No need to look further.

10767.Author: Mike, the Netherlands
10767.Review: Wonderful Whisky, one of my favorites.

10767.Author: Mr Claw
10767.Review: A work of art. Utterly brilliant. However, I think I speak for whisky drinkers everywhere when I say: Let's hope that Arbeg don't get too big for their boots...

10767.Author: Mikko
10767.Review: This is weighty, coal like, smoky and there is lot of peat, of course. I can taste some citrus and burnt orange too. I did add some water (max 5-% in my opinion) and it opened even more flavours: dark chocolate, blackcurrant and some bitter fruit... Very rich, deep and complex malt indeed. Another Ardbeg masterpiece.

10767.Author: Anonymous
10767.Review: Peatapal, this Ardbeg is a mix of different ages of malt, so there is no age statement, probably because there is some fairly young malt included.  The taste is more important than the age, imho

10767.Author: peatapal
10767.Review: how old is this ardbeg?

10767.Author: Infidel
10767.Review: The strongest Whisky I´ve tasted so far. I bought it to widen my wealth of experience and I don´t regret it at all. I never thought that a 57.1% Whiskey could offer such a rich palate. Wonderful - and nothing for every day!

10767.Author: Peter Benkoczki
10767.Review: Nice, strong dram, but is excepted more depth, more hard flavours. But there is nothin wrong with him:

10767.Author: Holger Dross
10767.Review: Rather fruity and elegant for an Ardbeg - smoke and peat are (of course) present, but not overwhelming. In my opinion the best Ardbeg of the last few years.

10767.Author: Anonymous
10767.Review: Very very good.  Reminds me of a mixture of the 10 Year and the Airigh Nam Beist.

4155.Author: Rossy
4155.Review: My favourite Old Pulteney.  My bottle is running low.  This is one whisky I always aim to have available in my collection so another purchase is on the horizon.  Recommended to all.

4155.Author: Tony
4155.Review: Meh its okay, I mean if you love "softer" whiskies then this is for you. Tastes like a 15yr old highland ex-bourbon malt. Didn't taste briney to me at all, and maybe the slightest hint of peat/smoke? same level or less then in the johnnie walker black

4155.Author: Craig Bryant
4155.Review: Lots of fruit on the nose. Pear with brown sugar. Palate is quite dry with hints of oak. No real saltiness which sets the 12 year apart from similar aged malts. Lots of spice on the finish.  I find this a little disappointing and actually prefer the lighter 12 year old.

4155.Author: John Barrow
4155.Review: I was given a bottle of the 17yr old as a birthday present on my 70th . I was amazed at the taste and smoothness , it is a magnificent whisky . I will have to keep this away at the back of the cupboard .

4155.Author: mark saunders
4155.Review: just bought this at duty free and was so pleased after just the first taste. Cant believe what a difference a further 5 yrs in the barrel makes over the 12 yr old. This whisky is superb and one of my new favourites. In-laws are off abroad soon, better put an order in!!!

4155.Author: David F
4155.Review: Really good!  I was tempted to get the 21yo but went for this instead, even more tempted now as the 17yo is very nice...

4155.Author: Anonymous
4155.Review:
I was given a bottle of this for a Christmas present,needless to say it didn't last long.
very very smooth.very well balanced.

4155.Author: Dan Niescierowicz
4155.Review: After years of trying single malt after single malt i now drink only this one. Best whiskey ive ever had in the sub £50 category. simply divine.

4155.Author: MOZ
4155.Review: In my view the star of the range, even better than the 21yo. It is a complex whisky with delicious sweet and salty notes. Can't go wrong with this one.

4155.Author: Anonymous
4155.Review: My favourite on the OP range. Beautiful, balanced, complex on the nose and smooth and soothing on the palate. Great whisky.

4155.Author: Benny Nordebrink
4155.Review: This is a fantastic dram, perfect balance!

4155.Author: Matt
4155.Review: Very interesting and relaxing, with pleasant notes of coconut and pineapple. Very unusual and a must try! In my top 15 for sure. Nice value for a 17 year old, as well.

4155.Author: Anonymous
4155.Review: My girlfriend has just bought me a bottle.............true love and the girl is ok too.

4155.Author: Anonymous
4155.Review: absolutly amazing, a real sipper just cracked a bottle of this open and more than satisfied with the results

16650.Author: Mikie
16650.Review: Simply devine one of my favorite drams

16650.Author: JJ
16650.Review: Caramel, biscuits, toffee, orange zest, slight clove. Dry smell. Can see how this can be ideal with a cigar but I''m sure you can also enjoy a cigar with another spirit one tends to enjoy. Would make a great gift. Still lean more toward Dalmore 18.  Enjoyable nonetheless.

16650.Author: Keith @ Donny
16650.Review: It is a very nice malt butI think overpriced.  I have always been a Dalmore fan and I and been through most of their bottlings up to the King Alex price.  HOWEVER.......   there is far too much caramel used in the colouring and this starts to impact the taste.  I have started to move to the Signatory bottlings, unadulterated and non-chill filtered the colour is much much lighter very pale wheat and the taste is wonderful, much cheaper too.

16650.Author: Oliver
16650.Review: Was a big fan of the 'Tay Dram' part of the River collections when released. Thought would give this a try as can't get the 'Tay Dram' anymore. Did not disappoint and a new personal favourite!

16650.Author: stogieman
16650.Review: Simply divine, you can taste the tobacco notes in it which is great when paired with a good cigar, the wife does not like it so I guess it's all mine( evil laugh ).

16650.Author: Anonymous
16650.Review: An excellent  aroma with  a brilliant finish

16650.Author: dom
16650.Review: Wow.  I tried a glass of this tonight - I've been meaning to buy a bottle for a while now.  Thick, rich and sweet.  Really, really  nice.

16650.Author: Anonymous
16650.Review: I've been waiting for this for a while and it didn't disappoint.  I enjoyed the Grand Reserva when it was around and I believe that this replaces it.  Great dram in a nicely presented box

16650.Author: James Maccanly
16650.Review: Sit down, enjoy and try to understand what this whisky is all about. This isn't a first shot whisky. It is the stuff of whisky genius. I even get tempted to start smoking a cigar... 2nd bottle is on his way.

16650.Author: Nicholas Blair
16650.Review: Second bottle now - this is one of best whiskies ever!

16650.Author: John Waddington
16650.Review: Was bought a bottle of the previous Cigar Malt a year or two ago. One of the best I've tasted (rich, dark, full of flavour) and absolutely perfect with a good cigar.

31421.Author: Anonymous
31421.Review: Not what I expected. Being in the PX cask sort of ruins it for me. When bottle is first opened you get that signature Lagavulin smoke and peat. It is still there once poured, but goes away quickly. My first tadte was of a band-aid and stayed there for a couple of sips. It does go away  and the sweetness comes out. It starts peaty and smokey and does not really come back, when it does it is faint.

31421.Author: Peter Owen
