31421.Review: Love this it suits my tastebuds perfectly. Smooth with the right amount of smoke and peat. Very, very drinkable glad I bought more than one.

31421.Author: Paul Herbert
31421.Review: Didn't have the same impact as the 16 year old. Toning down the peat without the other flavours coming through strongly enough was a disappointment. I wouldn't have bought this had I have had a taster.

31421.Author: Anonymous
31421.Review: Got some character but unfortunately the sherry cask aspect is hidden behind the peat and therefore not really noticeable.

31421.Author: Anonymous
31421.Review: A disappointment for me. Inferior to the 16 year old at a much higher price. Lacks punch, bite call it what you will - like Lagavulin lite. It's pleasant obviously, but not 80 quid pleasant.

31421.Author: Steve Chee
31421.Review: Initial distinctive Lagavulin flavour which smooths off as it reaches the back of the throat. Sweetness seems to come stronger after the second dram. Overall very pleasing.

31421.Author: Anonymous
31421.Review: Not that bad but still prefere the original one. Its does miss some flavor. Like smoke and peat

31421.Author: Anonymous
31421.Review: This is a great variation on the standard 16 year. It's smooth but has a bit of kick. Glad I was able to get a bottle.

31421.Author: Gu?mundur
31421.Review: As Ron Swanson said, it's good. Very good as a matter of fact!

31421.Author: Loyal _ Lagavulin_ Drinker
31421.Review: All the pieces are there I guess, just not put together. Was excited to try this years bottling especially after reading all the rave reviews online but find this to be quite fiery and dull tasting. Where's the smoke? It's been tough watching such a classic scotch take a nose dive in quality since Diageo deicided quantity was more important than quality

31421.Author: Dangerously Dan
31421.Review: A really nice finish.. mellow mouth feel.  Prime drinking liquor.

31421.Author: jimmy durham.
31421.Review: the best whisky ive had, buy a bottle you wont be disappointed.

41322.Author: Anonymous
41322.Review: In my humble opinion, the best. From the first time it touches your lips to 5 minutes afterwards, every second exceptional.

41322.Author: Patrik
41322.Review: A different kind of whiskey, the best!

41322.Author: Bob & Barbara
41322.Review: Long draw...with subtle evolution from peat to sherry...makes Barbara hiccup...which is a good thing!

41322.Author: New Mexico USA
41322.Review: Great whisky. Easy to drink neat.

41322.Author: Scott
41322.Review: Batch 61 is one of the finest drams I’ve ever sampled

41322.Author: Zenith
41322.Review: Very good single malt. Highly recommended

41322.Author: Anonymous
41322.Review: I have tried four other batches of abunadh...batch 61 is my favorite...first sip is warming with taste hints of chocolate, cinnamon, and honey...the finish is long and smooth...batch 61 is a true fine single malt worth every penny.

41322.Author: Will
41322.Review: This one really does it for me! I highly recommend it!

41322.Author: Akis
41322.Review: My absolute favourite single malt. The cask strength gives it quite the kick, but strangely, it doesn’t overwhelm you. I find it rich and warm, a little bit of what tastes like Carmel to me. The individual small batches and slightly varrying levels of alcohol content also gives Scotch heads lots of opportunities to compare and contrast

41322.Author: Anonymous
41322.Review: A very smoth oustanding example of what Speyside has to offer.

41322.Author: Rob
41322.Review: My son bought this for me for a birthday present. It blew me away.  I absolutely loved it. It is strong, but has a lovely finish. I have tried over 100 different scotchs and this is in my top five. It easily is as good as those that cost three times as much. Loved it!

41322.Author: Kas
41322.Review: At almost 61% alcohol it's very strong and numbs my tongue a bit too much to taste all nuances, so I prefer it with some water. It's not just smooth, (many cheaper whiskies are) it's got a very long and satisfying aftertaste, almost like a rich buttery desert. Definitely worth a try and great value at this price.

41322.Author: Anonymous
41322.Review: I thought it was a bit more spicy than previous batches.  I thought it was very good though. Smoother than what most high ABV whiskies.  Worth the money.

41322.Author: Todd Brown
41322.Review: My absolute favourite single malt. The cask strength gives it quite the kick, but strangely, it doesn’t overwhelm you. I find it rich and warm,  a little bit of what tastes like Carmel to me. The individual small batches and slightly varrying levels of alcohol content also gives Scotch heads lots of opportunities to compare and contrast. A

7401.Author: Anonymous
7401.Review: Fantastic !! A Golden Moment

7401.Author: VT214
7401.Review: Amazing taste from France

7401.Author: Anonymous
7401.Review: Amazing! Bought as an 80th Birthday present, beautifully presented and engraved to perfection!

7401.Author: A.Shaw Dram
7401.Review: What a Dram. A must have .

7401.Author: Chris
7401.Review: Exceptional taste.

7401.Author: JJ
7401.Review: A rare treat at this price!

7401.Author: Jacob M Rivera
7401.Review: Love the cream & citrus with smoky vanilla finish

7401.Author: R?n?, Finland
7401.Review: Extremely smooth, a whole lot more complex than the original Glenmorangie. I love the notes of honey in this whisky. My favorite drink so far (and it's affordable!)

7401.Author: R.C.G   Toronto
7401.Review: A splendid early autumn whiskey. A worthwhile alternative to others in this range but this one may be the smoothest. I cherish it all the more since it was a gift from my son on his wedding day.  Give it a try.

7401.Author: Gmac
7401.Review: Wonderful, this is my summer whisky.

7401.Author: Adam, San Diego
7401.Review: Fantastic.  Not a connoisseur per se but have tried a lot in my time.  This one is absolutely terrific.

7401.Author: Rahul Padukone
7401.Review: Tasted this yesterday for the very first time . This  is probably the best single malt I have ever had.  Nothing gets better

7401.Author: Lester Mc
7401.Review: Simply wonderful.

7401.Author: Steve, Alberta CAN
7401.Review: If someone were to tell me this was the only whisky I could drink for the rest of my life, I would be okay with hearing that.

7401.Author: Anonymous
7401.Review: Great taste. great price

7401.Author: Dallas
7401.Review: One of the best whiskies in my price range, and the best Scotch.  I usually spend around $100 a bottle, and Glenmorangie 18 has a smoothness I've rarely encountered in that range.  The taste is superior, and I experienced a creamy toffee finish that was quite satisfying.  A premium sipping Scotch in this range that blows out its comparators.  Far worth the extra few dollars from Macallan 12 Sherry Oak and Glenlivet 15 (both fine choices in their own right).  You won't be disappointed in this one.

7401.Author: Anonymous
7401.Review: Very smooth  reminds you of the homemade candy balls made in the 50,s let it rest in your mouth before  letting it drift down the throat, a whisky to enjoy.

7401.Author: Abe, US of A!
7401.Review: So smooth you''ll take a quick 2nd sip because you''ll think the 1st sip couldn''t have been right. This is it, no doubt about it. I don''t play the "my top shelf" game, I have one shelf and I''m open to giving everything a try, if I don''t like it I don''t buy it.  This 18 year will always have a place on my shelf, it''s worth every penny. If you''re new to scotches I suggest drinking other scotches for a while at first, that way you''ll truly appreciate this one when you get there.

7401.Author: JJ
7401.Review: The packaging of this bottle is riveting and eye catching and draws you into the quality of the bottle. When experiencing the subtle sweet flavors and it bold vanilla presence, you appreciate its floral notes in comparison with its fruits. Still debating if it is a "signature staple" bottle on my shelf since it is battling with other great 18yr olds and possibly might become one, but nonetheless, is a good Highland Whisky to explore.

7401.Author: Anonymous
7401.Review: Managed to have a glass of this whilst travelling this month. It's quite possibly the best whisky I've had. Incredibly smooth, similar to the Original 10 but something extra. You won't be disapointed.

7401.Author: Ben, Australia
7401.Review: Wow, my cousin just brought me a bottle home. WOW, the sweetness and the flavours which come through. The citrus, mandarin, toffee, oak, i cant help but thinking back to the days of eating my mums custard, with the malts creamy texture really coming through along with Vanilla and grapes! lucky i have a whole bottle to enjoy! 92/100

7401.Author: Peter berg
7401.Review:
One of my top 5 selections. I ordered 1 a few months back. My next order will include 3 of this bottle. 

Very smooth, along the lines of an ardbeg 10yo or talisker 25yo.

7401.Author: Toronto Tim
7401.Review: Good Scotch, just enough of  ... everything: smoke, honey, malt, and the ever-so-lovely grassines. - Toronto Tim (Canada).

7401.Author: Barker
7401.Review: One of the best around !!

7401.Author: Ran
7401.Review: Like this much better than those Glenmorangie tasted earlier. Very good choice

7401.Author: Just enjoying a fine glass now and the aeromatics are quite superb the honey is well defined and the smoke finish takes you over the edge.
Travis Kingdon
7401.Review: The most amazing nose and delivery you will ever experience. With a slightly stronger finish this could be up there with the greats of the whisky world. Easily worth the extra $ for nose alone, take your time with it...

7401.Author: A new Believer
7401.Review: WOW, was not a big whiskey drinker until now.  Bring It On.

7401.Author: Yossi
7401.Review: Absolutely, mouth-wateringly delicious!  I have found my new favorite drop.

9732.Author: spijkie
9732.Review: the best whisky you can get. wonderfull combination of sweetness and complexity  in a glass.

9732.Author: Eyvind Taraldsen
9732.Review: I have tried this wonderful W. over christmas. I am impressed by the complexety and the balance. The sherry is so pressent yet the sweetness is not overwelming.

9732.Author: Anonymous
9732.Review: Fairly new to scotch, normally a bourbon drinker.  This one is magnificent, dried fruits, rich chocolate...many layers and lovely color. Will definitely revisit! Cheers!

9732.Author: Kitch
9732.Review: Stunning whisky. Superb sherry cask. Dried fruits and toffee

9732.Author: A Scotch Enthusiast
9732.Review: A Regal Scotch. While its certainly on the pricey side it tastes exactly like a 100 dollar bottle of scotch should.  It has an extremely rich punch of dried fruits, both in nose and palate. I've always been more partial to Islay and Island scotches myself, but this one demands your attention in a similar manner,  though with overwhelming richness instead of smoke.

9732.Author: Sam
9732.Review: stunning whisky and immense color for its age

9732.Author: Anonymous
9732.Review: I have been drinking Gelndronach for three years now. At first I bought the 15y/o, the 18y/o,the 21y/o and the cask strength. 15 was good. 21 was too sweet and the cask strength needed diluting and was just never right. The 18 I got at the time was the best scotch ever. When the 15 disappeared it was a clue that maybe the 18 would not be as good. I have bought several bottles of the 18 since and while it is not as great as the 18 two years ago it is still my favorite. This scotch is only for the neat drinker. It is like a fine cognac.

9732.Author: Anonymous
9732.Review: 5 stars!!!

9732.Author: Anonymous
9732.Review: This is among the best scotches I've ever tried. I had purchased 2 bottles of the 15y.o. on the recommendation of personnel in the Scotch Whisky Experience in Edinburgh and was disappointed upon returning home to the USA in that the 15 was no longer available.  I was excited to find the 18 and delighted to find it a superior scotch. Smooth, multiple layers of complementary flavors so subtle...not inexpensive but well matched with much higher priced whiskys!

9732.Author: Henning
9732.Review:
Oh the flavours in this is just what I want. I don't have to taste hard for them to come. They're just there. Will definetly have this again, and again...
If you do like tasty, sherried Whiskies, this is it.

9732.Author: Anonymous
9732.Review: Melted chocolate in a bottle.  After 2 drams, put it away or it magically disappears!

9732.Author: Anonymous
9732.Review: Not a fan of this to be honest. The finish is quite sour and has that cabbage/asparagus note which I have experienced  a few times before in Glendronach single casks. The whisky itself just feels a bit thin and pretty dull in flavor. Not one I will buy again and with the price of their  single casks releases getting more overpriced every batch  it looks like Glendronach will be just be a distant happy memory from now on. This distillery has had its day in the sun in my opinion, one to avoid for me sadly

9732.Author: Anonymous
9732.Review: Yes hard to get.  I found 5.  Grabbed them. For sherry,  I've yet to find better.  A gem.

9732.Author: Francisco
9732.Review:
Another very well done whisky, one of my favourites together with the fantastic Glendronach 15 Revival, Glengoyne 21 and in different style but also with wine influence, Bushmills 21.
I like very much both 15Y and 18Y but I feel the 15 is for less-sweet whisky lovers. If they give me the two versions to pick one, it would be a difficult choice but I would certainly want the 18 because is more fruity and sweet.

9732.Author: Juki
9732.Review: Excellent whisky, very dark coloured sherry cask whisky for a decent price.  Chocolate, toffee, plums. Just two drams back and finish is still open for me but atleast chocolate. Very nice purchase.

9732.Author: Phippo
9732.Review: This is a cracking good scotch, definitely underrated, hard to get so if you see it get it

9732.Author: Sid
9732.Review: Get this one while you can at this price,this is a superb sherry cask whisky for a very reasonable price.Love the smoke finish and the superb lingering taste.

9732.Author: Brandon
9732.Review: Wow. Just wow. This is an incredible whisky. By far my favorite 18. I will be buying this frequently and stocking up for the next couple of years, who knows what the 18 will be like when it's actually 18 yrs old (my bottling is 2016 and is 21 year old stock). I'm about 2/3 through the bottle, and it has gotten even better since opening up. Chocolote, Toffy, Plums, Figs, and the FINISH. the FINISH is amazing. Best finish i've experienced. Long, and mouth-watering, then dries but keeps going. Dark Fruit and Chocolate on the finish.

9732.Author: VJones
9732.Review: Wife bought me the 18 & 21yr from TWE for my birthday...Love Glendronach. one of my favorite distilleries

9732.Author: Manuel
9732.Review: Superb...90 points.

9732.Author: Tony
9732.Review: Excellent, stuff. I prefer this to the 15, because its noticeable sweeter and fruiter

9732.Author: Cosmin Marginean
9732.Review:
Nose: Bold sherry, toffee, fruit
Palate: Unexpected dryness (for this nose) mixed with fruit and pudding. Nutty. A very subtle smoke 
Finish: Lingering sherry and walnut

9732.Author: RMcDonald
9732.Review: What can i say this is Glendronach at its best.I had the pleasure of a bottle of this for my 50th party ,needless to say it did not last long ,and my guests were so impressed most went out to get a bottle for themselves.

9732.Author: Rick.
9732.Review: Had a bottle for Xmas, just had a dram. Beautiful.

9732.Author: keith palmer
9732.Review: This bottling of Glendronach is superb.It is a match for more exspensive sherried whiskies from more famous distilleries.

9732.Author: MSR
9732.Review: Dulce, suave, exquisito. Uno de los mejores del mercado en relacion precio/calidad.

9732.Author: trebor
9732.Review: Great nose of dates - toffee - sherry and lovely taste of sherried fruit with just a hint of smoke. Nice but something is missing - character which is cloaked by the heavy oloroso flavouring. Good but not memorable. The dram of the 12 yo basic release I had at the distillery had much more of the Glendronach character.

9732.Author: A.B
9732.Review: I agree with mr S Benetto. This one does indeed bring back memories of the "old" 15y.o. And those memories are, indeed, fond. Truly "The Perfect Choice", following a dinner of specifically game meat, such as for example deer. Right single malt afterwards, is in my personal humble opinion, just as important as "the right wine" is to a dinners main course.

9732.Author: S Bennetto
9732.Review: Brings back fond memories of the old 15 year old sherry cask.  Although only a sample i was given, i enjoyed it very much.  Beautiful butter toffee with a hint of spice.

15703.Author: Matt
15703.Review:
For the age I was a bit disappointed in the experience as a newer scotch enthusiast.
 I picked up strong notes of crispy apple with a hint of rye in the back. Some tiny sweet notes that I can't put my finger on.  The palate I got more of that Speyside crispy apple with a subtle spiciness of the rye as well. The finish is a bit punchy; some spices are left on the tongue.

15703.Author: Anonymous
15703.Review: Great whiskey!

15703.Author: Carlos Rangel
15703.Review: Moving from Tequila to Whisky enthusiastic...really enjoy the flavor and sweetness

15703.Author: George Gould
15703.Review: This is a wonderful single malt Scotch if you don`t like peat.  Great with a good cigar.

15703.Author: JSRI, MD
15703.Review: Great.  Pay more or less for other ideas but this single malt won its awards for a reason.  Value.  Enjoy.

15703.Author: Anonymous
15703.Review: I have tried a number of high end whiskies and keep going back to this one.  Simply the best value for money.

15703.Author: Ericiwan
15703.Review: This is the best whisky realy

15703.Author: No
15703.Review: Overtones of creosote and hamster dander.  Finisher like a sea anemone with a breathing apparatus.  Completely carnivorous nose with hints of sponge and spatzle.  Totally obsequious.

15703.Author: HIMMAT
15703.Review:
Very  popular  brand  and  like very much 
(THANKS )

15703.Author: Anonymous
15703.Review: Excellent 18 at a fair price point. Pairs well with an Oliva O series.

15703.Author: Jacob Rivera
15703.Review: At first glance a very attractive bottle  with a  smooth mild thin bodied whiskey with a almost bubble gum candy like taste.

15703.Author: Avery Ebbtide
15703.Review: Best I have ever had and I Love Scotch

15703.Author: NDB
15703.Review: the very best of the best

15703.Author: Mifune
15703.Review: Terrific scotch for this price point. Lovely honey sweet notes on opening followed by a spicy, citrus and chocolate.  It doesn''t last long enough on the way down the throat but excellent none the less.  Just a bit too sweet for my liking.

15703.Author: Tom C
15703.Review: Simply put - THE BEST Speyside Single Malt I''ve ever tasted!  Very smooth and very sweet. Zero peat. Perfect. Great value for money too - you won''t just be buying the one.

15703.Author: Tony
15703.Review:
This is by far one of the best value for money 18yr old scotches. Tastes like the 15yr old glenlivet but with more OOMPH dark chocolate stewed fruit flavours. due to its 43% bottling (nice). The tasting notes are spot on, very good whisky.

However, one thing to note is that this whisky is peatless, literally 0 peat or smoke. 

Overall, Good dram, and good value for money. Ideal for people that dosen''t like peat.

15703.Author: J-Han
15703.Review: When it hits the palate the overwhelming taste of milk chocolate explodes! unfortunately the flavours fade quickly and over all i was not overly impressed with anything lasting, oak and nutty, but quickly fades, not worth the price or the hype in a scotch that is aged 18 years.

15703.Author: Wes
15703.Review: Very smooth

15703.Author: Scottymalotty
15703.Review: My new favourite whisky

15703.Author: TerraRob
15703.Review: One of my absolute favourites. With a depth of flavour i have rarely come across. A beautiful dram that goes down far too easy. At this price it is an absolute must.

15703.Author: Scotch fan
15703.Review: Fruity and smooth. Toffee, butterscotch, mint. Incredibly well-balanced whisky as there is no individual flavor overpowering the whisky. Possibly the best choice in the entire range of Glenlivet. A must dram for all scotch fans. Great value for the money too!

15703.Author: Sean Sankey
15703.Review: It certainly is beautiful stuff this, which you never get tired of. Ok it's not got the phenols of Islay or the massive sherry of some other speysides but what it does have is gorgeous flavours around chocolate, fruit cake, berries and oak. Stunning nose, v sweet without being sickly. Lovely complexity all the way through and a long finish. Oh for heavens sake just buy one...

15703.Author: Maish Weinstein
15703.Review:
A supreme dram!!  An 18 yr old of such class and colour for so little money!
Makes me go Aisha Maisha!!!
Maish from London

15703.Author: FoxHound
15703.Review: Glenlivet 18 is a pleasure to drink in every sense of the word, lovely light fruity aromas with a nice dash of vanilla on the aroma and on the palate and immensely smooth. goes down your throat like water. an absolutely terrific scotch that after being sampled, should only be broken out on special occasions. 9.5 out of 10 from me

15703.Author: alien
15703.Review: Very nice malt, with very nice price!!! Love it!!!

15703.Author: Scott J. Buccine, Sr.
15703.Review: Love, love, love it!!!

15703.Author: Jamie H
15703.Review:
The greatest liquid that has ever passed my lips.

Amazing stuff!!

15703.Author: Dave
15703.Review: A brilliant drop. I have a stable of GlenLivet's (12, 15, 18 and 21) and the 18 is the pick for me - even over the 21. I love the rich fruit flavours and smooth oaky finish. It is my go to drop. The worst thing about it is the bottom of the bottle...again.

15703.Author: Smedster
15703.Review:
You could pay more for whisky of this quality - but why would you?
Great stuff!!

15703.Author: Tudval
15703.Review: I's say MUCH richer and refined than the 15yo.

15703.Author: Unclebadger
15703.Review: Just a bit richer and smoother that the 15 yr, lovely smooth lingering finish

15703.Author: Rob Hughes
15703.Review:
In my opinion this is one of the best value Single Malt's on the market, and never fails to impress. 
The nose is fabulous and fragrant, with dried fruit, light spice and a light citrus hint.
It is beautifully light on the taste buds, unlike some sherried Speyside malts, and has real class. Goes beautifully with a nice mince pie!

15703.Author: mark brailsford
15703.Review: simply superb, just try

10997.Author: Anonymous
10997.Review: Opened this evening to celebrate a special occasion with friends. What a treat! Sherry, fruit, spice and wood, all in perfect harmony with one another. The nose on this whisky is one of the best I've ever experienced and the taste is not too far behind. The entire experience is one of layered complexity - highly recommended.

10997.Author: Matt
10997.Review:
absolute perfection for a non peaty whisky. Very smooth, complex, powerful... flavors are bold, complex, and it hits you hard while maintaining smoothness. 

A masterpiece

10997.Author: Scotch Man
10997.Review: this whiskey is just wonderful great flavors ,my first order from this company, all is great packing was great just a great experience will order agian soon

10997.Author: Jason
10997.Review: Wow. If you're a fan of the Dalmore, this is the ticket...though again, as with the 15, a word of caution. Assuming you've tried and loved their entry-level 12 year old single malt, don't expect the same satiny-smoothness here. Yes, the 18 is smooth compared to other scotches, but it has a much more obvious burn to it than the 12 or 15 (probably due to the 43% alcohol). The flavour here is intense beyond reason - all the grapey, heavily-sherried richness of the 12 and the 15 are here in spades, but with an added hint of anise/liquorice-ness and a rough oakiness, along with a distinct cinnamon note. This scotch literally perfumes itself out of the glass, much like a harsh Islay scotch's fumes creep out. If you love the 12 and the 15, and simply want all those flavours maxed out to the inth degree, then the 18 is the ticket. A luxurious, full-bodied highland scotch well-worth trying.

10997.Author: Rich
10997.Review: Loved it. Strong dark Chocolate and Coffee notes.Great Finish.

10997.Author: BDubya
10997.Review: A fantastic dram, in this price range so so reasonable.  Nose is rich, smooth & deep; you can just breath this in forever.  Upon taking a sip, the arrival is sweet, complex and packed with character.  Had me smacking my lips.  Don''t ponder upon getting a bottle, just do it - and you''ll be welcomed into the warm world of great whisky appreciation.

10997.Author: JJ
10997.Review: This was my introduction bottle to a Highland region whisky and I must say it was a pleasant encounter. This 18yr is not only is smooth and flavorful in which you shouldn''t underestimate its ability to smoother your palate.  It makes you really appreciate the time spent on making such a fine whisky, especially aging it in 3 ways before bottled.

10997.Author: jud l/h
10997.Review: one of the best i have ever triede

10997.Author: Anonymous
10997.Review: one of my favorites,lovely notes of chocolate and raisins, well worth its price. take your time and enjoy it.

10997.Author: Andy Mack
10997.Review: When I first tried it I was unimpressed, but on a second sitting when my palate was more prepared I was taken on a flavour journey. It's like drinking the highlands themselves. My tasting companions and I tasted all sorts going on, there's the usual 'whiskey' flavours that seem to crop up in most but this has heather and pine and a whole assortment of delicate beautifully balanced flavours. A good one to buy for something a little different but not extreme.

10997.Author: M. Jansson
10997.Review: A good match for, say, Macallan 18yo at any time, Dalmore 18 delivers that classic sherried whisky character, with a tangerine orange peel finish. A very satisfying dram in my opinion.

10997.Author: Jean
10997.Review: An amazing whisky, but make sure you let it breatH and use a decanter if you have one. Goes down a treat!!

10997.Author: david glass
10997.Review: not so good  i agree with whisky exchange   it would be better at a higher strength

10997.Author: Anonymous
10997.Review: who eats lamb toasted in rabbit??? R.K. u plonker

10997.Author: Jack LaShay, LA
10997.Review: Because u didn't aeriate that! That's a perfect, complex and very easy to drink Highlander!

10997.Author: R.K. from Kilmarnock
10997.Review: This one has a strange flavour it is almost like lamb toasted in rabbit.

6942.Author: Reinhard
6942.Review: HP18 is one of my favourite whiskies. But I now see the price of HP18 has gone up by 50 % between Nov 2013 and now - Oct 2014. I purchased at bottle at the Distillery in Nov for ?62. Now it''s ?95. What in god''s name are they drinking at Highland Park? This is crazy...

6942.Author: Anonymous
6942.Review:
Color: Gold tan
Nose: Sweet grain. Softer than the 12 and 16. Lighter peat but still has influence. Cherry stones and toffee sweet sourness. 
Taste: Praline sherried walnuts! Chocolatey light black liquorish. Cherry stone syrup and nip of heat from alcohol.
Finish! Sweetness fades to cinnamon spice, liquorish savory with ribbons of sherry sourness and sweet peat stank!
Good Stuff! 91 Pts.

6942.Author: jordan
6942.Review: tried this at the whiskey exchange show..it was 1 0f 4 of my personal favourites. if you like smooth mellow and no harsh medicial after taste , then this is your winner..

6942.Author: Rick.
6942.Review: A beautiful whisky,,,,to good to share!

6942.Author: JJF
6942.Review: The best

6942.Author: Mke
6942.Review: If you enjoy whisky not buying this incredible single malt is doing yourself a major disservice, especially at this price.

6942.Author: Anonymous
6942.Review: Balance. Just pure balance. I could drink this forever. If you haven't had it you must. I can't say more.. except Sláinte!

6942.Author: PR
6942.Review: This is the 12 yo taken to massive heights. It is balanced, offers incredible complexity and lingers on the palate for a long time. It's great value for money as well, delivering what very few whiskies at the same price point can.

6942.Author: Tim --California, USA
6942.Review: Over the last 25 years, I've tasted whisky from about 60% of the working distilleries in Scotland, most of the blends, and a handful of Japanese and American whiskies.  Highland Park 18 YO is simply the greatest whisky I have ever tasted.  Magnificent nose, a palate that is both complex and balanced, and a finish like no other.  a sublime experience bottle after bottle.

6942.Author: Ricky P.- Wisconsin, United States
6942.Review: The balance is the key to the glory of this whisky.  The fruit, honey and smoke exist in perfect harmony.  It's amazing that not only do they create such a balance, but can reproduce it consistently from bottle to bottle.  Bravo!

6942.Author: Eddie G
6942.Review: Tasted this while on a couple of days holiday at the Forest Hills Hotel Loch Aird. I can only say it was superb, with sherry,Honey,and a very light peaty taste.haveing taken the twelve year old for a number of years this is ten times better.

6942.Author: Cav66
6942.Review: I love all types of whisky: sherried, smoky, peaty, briney, floral, honeyed, spicy - you name it, if it is a good version of its genre, I will happily drink it. This one has all these things - in balance. None dominate, all blend together. It is a bit like some of the better Japanese whiskies - but seems a tad more authentic and a lot cheaper! £50 very well spent!

6942.Author: JP
6942.Review: Perfect, a beautiful dram!

6942.Author: VM
6942.Review: An easygoing single malt with smoke, salt and sweetness all in a perfect balance. Indeed, unless you heavily dislike smokiness or saltiness, you'll certainly find Highland Park 18yo at least drinkable. However, whether or not you'll love it will depend fully on how much you appreciate this kind of smoothness. Personally, I tend to prefer more adventurous, rougher whiskies. 8 out of 10

6942.Author: Audrius Dargužis
6942.Review: While this one is too good to (care to) describe, I will try... The smell: stables and leather, glue, autumn leaves. The taste: nuts, smoky wood, vanilla, a pinch of ginger and peat; sweet but not too sweet.Awesome.

6942.Author: Mikko
6942.Review: Totally agree with Tudval. This is a very good malt, but what is wrong with rough edges? If I want something easy going I'll buy a bottle of blended.

6942.Author: Jason's Scotch Whisky Reviews
6942.Review: Palate (undiluted):  Rich, luxurious honey/toffee flavors interwoven with nuts, spicy cinnamon, pretzel salt and the perfect hint of peat fill the palate. A chewy dram drying towards the finish. No sharp edges here. No bite, bitterness or burn here. Peat is present but not overwhelming or dominating. It compliments the flavor profile only.  Finish undiluted):  A big, rounded finish of lingering smoke, spices verging on peppercorns.

6942.Author: Lena Nunn
6942.Review: HP 18yo is excellent! Has the most beautiful vintage floral fruity nose, and it won't disappoint on the taste. Gives a surprising fire burn, then off to smoother notes again. Just a beautiful dram!

6942.Author: Tudval
6942.Review: I must disagree with most reviews. I don't mind rough edges and I sometimes prefer younger whiskies to old. This is one such case.   True, it's extremely smooth, but also a bit too sweet for me. More of a dessert, it has it's place, but one cannot say 'it's the best' or 'you cannot go wrong'.

6942.Author: Harpreet Singh
6942.Review: We all want smoke and umber and fire..but this is the best of all rolled into one. there is the deep golden  "here comes the sun"colour. the taste is that of the rarest sweetest honey. But it's also got depth. the only downside of this whiskey is that having tasted it my love of all others has declined. Its rather like meeting cheryl cole.Simply the best.

6942.Author: Anonymous
6942.Review: WOW!

6942.Author: paul palmer
6942.Review: good tears , lovely aroma with strong nose and adore the toffee flavour keen to try with chocolate like last posting suggests.

6942.Author: Mr Claw
6942.Review: Just buy it. You literally cannot go wrong! It's smooth, honeyed, flowery, fruity, smoky rich and deep. In my view Highland Park is a great example of what single malts can do - and the 18 year old is about as good a whisky as you'll find anywhere. Sadly the 21 year old is only available at duty frees - so get yourself a bottle of the 18 it's the next best!

6942.Author: Anonymous
6942.Review: Wonderful! One of the few whiskies that complements chocolate.

15308.Author: Anonymous
15308.Review: This awesome funky little monster is like drinking a spiced chocolate covered truffle mushroom dusted in light espresso powder.

15308.Author: Stu
15308.Review: Bags and bags of character and depth, a Christmas dram if there ever was one but try a few teaspoons of water it really opens up and there is a bit of sulfur but not in a bad way it tends to die away again with a little water and I recommend experimenting and exploring this dram it really keeps on giving with a little coaxing !

15308.Author: Andreas Botsaris
15308.Review: The best value for money whisky

15308.Author: John.
15308.Review: This Dronach is fantastic. The lingering after taste is intense, goes on forever. Goes great side by side with a dark ale. Its a true king of whisky's for me.

15308.Author: Mikko
15308.Review: At first like a dream, the sherried whisky I have been looking for. So complex and vibrant that you think you have landed in sherryheaven. But when the whisky starting oxidize, it shows it's nasty sulfur character. The change is pretty drastic. Not let this whisky oxidize, put the whisky smaller bottles and don't leave much air in there.

15308.Author: Anonymous
15308.Review: Tried it today at The Wee Dram Festival In Cheshire...quite the best sherry matured whisky I have tasted in A long while.

15308.Author: Bill
15308.Review: Without question, the single greatest thing I’ve ever drunk under any capacity.  If I were stranded in the desert, seconds from death, I would choose a sip of this whisky over gallons of water.

15308.Author: GD, Elderslie Scotland
15308.Review: Wow, very good, you won't be disappointed:)

15308.Author: Anonymous
15308.Review: Possibly the best thing that's ever been in my mouth!

15308.Author: Ian from USA
15308.Review: 15yr Revival gets all the glory, but in a side by side this 21yr boasts maturity and depth. It is also the only one in the GlenDronach range without the drying sherry finish that can be a little displeasing at times. I just bought a bottle of this for my fathers birthday.

2161.Author: Johan
2161.Review: Wonderful dram. Got the Teapot dram no5. Borg are amazing. Havent come across any whisky that van beat Glengoyne.

2161.Author: Francisco
2161.Review:
Excellent whisky, clean, sophisticated, sherried and full of flavour. 
I bought a 20cl bottle, that is a very good idea and more inclusive for those that can not afford this level of whisky. 
It's a pity I can not afford the 25Y, but I will try to buy the big one 21Y (70cl).

Glengoyne has a very good range whisky's clean, sophisticated and tasty. I've experienced the 10, 12, 18 and 21, and for sure, Glengoyne is one of my favourite brands of Scotch Whisky along with Glendronach and Arran, all with different styles, all very good whisky's.

2161.Author: John B
2161.Review: I'm delighted to add my own big 'thumbs up' to this wonderfully rich sherried malt. The nose gave me a clue as to what was going to be savoured in the mouth and I wasn't disappointed. It also has a pleasantly long finish. I thought the 15 year old was terrific malt but this really is vastly better and worth the extra expense.

2161.Author: Johan
2161.Review:
Magnificent
Best whisky i have had so far. Great value for the money. Packed with flavor. The teapot drams are also highly recommended for any sherry cask whisky lovers.

2161.Author: AlexMark
2161.Review: I don't have so big vocabulary to describe how much I like it. I have never tried anything better then Glengoyne 21. All my friends are already informed, so the sale boom is coming

2161.Author: O.A.H.
2161.Review: Fantastic whisky, especially so at this price. Intense sherried nose and rich mouthfeel, with lovely red apple and oak to balance.

2161.Author: Robert
2161.Review: Great product, great value as well.  Very flavorful, with a nice finish and great nose

2161.Author: X-MAN
2161.Review: Well balanced and so easy to drink. Sweet and rich but not too much.  By far the BEST value for whiskey 18 years and older that I have had.

2161.Author: Paul Hanson
2161.Review: What can I say. An absolute cracker - very easy to drink and very engaging. This is one of the finest 21 year old I have had for a long time and no doubt will be buying another very soon. Stunning!

2161.Author: Graham Mac
2161.Review: I love Glengoyne 21. It''s a lovely rich mature dram that''s all too easy to drink. Of course, there''s no peat or smoke, so others may get more out of some of the Speyside cousins but as a pure expression of a highland malt- with the emphasis on the malt, this can''t be beaten.  I would however suggest that as a magnificent expression of the distillery, you might want to try the younger cask strength version. Pure butterscotch, it''s a cracker!

2161.Author: Jason Farque
2161.Review: I'm drinking a dram of this as I write this.  I bought the bottle on my last trip to Aberdeen.  This is a delicious single malt with very complex flavor.  Floral, wood, spice and nuts.  Wonderfully mild and complex finish as well!  As The Flying Scotsman says above, it has a very festive flavor that would fit quite well after a Scotch drinker's Christmas dinner.

2161.Author: Anonymous
2161.Review: Rich amber color, full bodied, may need just a touch of water to open and bring it down from 86 proof. Highly recommended at the price; would love to afford to drink it every day. Online notes tout the nose, but I did not notice it as exceptional. But on the palate... that was something else.

2161.Author: The Flying Scotsman
2161.Review: Another festive 'must' for your Christmas dram cupboard, picked up a bottle in Kiev, this dram is robust, and its maturity gives it a big, bold, yet mellow sherry kick. Stewed pears and red apples in here??? Oh yes, I think so! Enjoy responsibly. Slanje...

2161.Author: paulo
2161.Review: Was very impressed with this. Loads of flavours and a great finish. Try leaving your emptied glass out overnight and smell it in the morning. Lovely!

2161.Author: S Bennetto
2161.Review: Bought a bottle for my father in-laws 60th birthday.  Thought he wasnt going to open it for a second!  But he did and was kind enough to let me sample a glass or 2, and i must say this a very complex single malt with a lots to offer.  Top stuff, just thought it could have given more at 46% or even a little higher.

302.Author: Ashley N
302.Review: This really is the best whisky I have tasted.  A must try and well worth the money

302.Author: Anonymous
302.Review: Wonderful. Better than any other 21yo.

302.Author: O.A.H.
302.Review: This whisky is for me borderline 4-5... Balvenie are without a doubt an exemplary distillery of typical and consistently excellent Speyside single malts, and always have a place in my collection. However I find that value for money versus other whiskies at similar prices sometimes suffers. At the price, I have had better scotch... but, I have to hand it to Balvenie, this is deliciously creamy and peachy. More delicate and less fruit-forward than I expected, but great regardless.

302.Author: Andrew Wong
302.Review: It is one of my most favorite Scotch Whiskies!

302.Author: Mifune
302.Review: This is a ridiculously delicious whisky. If you like the Redbreast 12 yo barrel strength, I suspect this will be up your alley.

302.Author: Mifune
302.Review: I tried this again recently after a few years. A little different to how I remember it a bit sharper a bit more citrus, still has a whiff of smoke - It passes my most fundamental test in a whisky, I can just keep drinking and drinking and drinking it.

302.Author: Ray M.
302.Review: My favorite!!

302.Author: Ray M.
302.Review: My favorite!!

302.Author: Louie
302.Review: Sweet wood! The nose is phenomenal, and taste is sweet and woody. Highly recommended

302.Author: Briantheship
302.Review: Although a tad too sweet, I've worked my way through three bottles so far.

302.Author: Anonymous
302.Review: I got my first 21yo portwood in the early 2000?s and it is still my all time favorite. Not even the 30yo is as good as this is. Price has gone up 100%, but still worth every penny. Lovely and smooth. Highly recommend higher vol bottles than 40%, since they give more taste out with a drop of water.

302.Author: Jacob Rivera
302.Review: Delicious very smooth I wish it had a little more bite goes down too easy

302.Author: Manoj Modi
302.Review: Could not think of a better whiskey. No need for detailed drawn out review. If this is in your budget, get it. You wont regret it

302.Author: Anonymous
302.Review: The major drawback of this whisky is that it is too easy to drink. The nose is almost a bit too sweet, but not cloying indeed. It goes down with no sense of burning at all and leaves a well balanced persisting taste. A rounder alternative to the great super-masculine peaties

302.Author: Marc Bodow
302.Review: Powerful nose.  I was at a restaurant.  I had to keep swatting at a fruitfly.  It eventually ended up in my glass and drowned.  (What a way to go).  Fortunately my drink was graciously replaced. Very enjoyable.

302.Author: JJ
302.Review: I really liked this young adult dram and am looking forward to it tonight. Great raisin sweetness , star anise, smooth nutmeg oak flavor. Compact with a nice finish and subtle vanilla impact. This makes me want to explore the Doublewood next or just buy another bottle of this one.

302.Author: JJ
302.Review: Intriguing experience when dealing with the difference between sweetness from raisins as oppose to citrusy and apple flavors. A school teacher of whisky teaching me an amazing development of smoothness and dryness while still wetting my taste buds from honeyed dehydrated fruit and balanced spice. This bottle was my first Balvenie bottle and it definitely makes me curious to explore their 12yr Double Wood. I like this bottle a lot and don''t know if there is anything else in its age bracket  besides maybe 1  or 2 bottles that can compete.

302.Author: Patrik
302.Review: The ABSOLUTE favourite in my collection of different whiskies, just ordered one more, will buy one more as well in soon future :)

302.Author: Stu
302.Review: Wow ! Just wow !.  Absaloubtly stunning and amazing, how this malt can evoke such emotions and it''s a honor to be able to exsperiance such a dram of this stature and refinement just remember for every year of age on a malt whisky you should leave it stand for a minuit per each year and I wouldent recommend adding a tea spoon of water in this one as there is more aroma and flavour un watered like I said above just leave it stand a min per year and best of all enjoy it with a friend or family member !

302.Author: aviationman
302.Review: I bought a bottle at Singapore Airport, for my price range it's the very best & smooth malt scotch whisky I've ever had, plus when I arrived home I found I had a bottle of the same already.  So one half glass a week is going to last much longer than I thought.

302.Author: Andy
302.Review: Simply the best whisky I've ever had. I discovered it at the whisky fringe and it was so good I kept going back for more

302.Author: Poserj
302.Review: Very nice, tasty, but subtle and perhaps slightly disappointing for a 21 year old.

302.Author: Snoop-A-Loop
302.Review: Sweeet sassy molassy!!!

302.Author: Anonymous
302.Review: best ever!

302.Author: Andy Mack
302.Review: Thought I would venture into the £50+ range and went for this as i've always been a fan of Balvenie, it's the best money I have ever spent. From the moment I opened the box and set my eyes on it's rich colour I was in love, a sniff from the bottle had me drooling, a lung full from the glass had me weeping for joy. I was almost worried the taste wouldn't match up, but my word it did. This is a different class, I can't tell you how much I love this whiskey.

302.Author: weg
302.Review: a beautiful whiskey. Just for fun i was drinking this side by side with a Glenfarclas 40, and actually preferred this. The dried fruity aromas really come out on the palate, with just a hint of sweetness.

302.Author: Dor
302.Review: Thanx TWE admin appriciate it

302.Author: TWE Admin
302.Review: Dor: From what I can find the whisky is almost the same, just not as diluted for the duty free version. The big difference is that the 47.6% bottling isn't chill-filtered, while the regular version is.

302.Author: Dor
302.Review: I own a bottle. but one from the duty free version bottled at 47.6%, TWE admin, can you comment about the slight differences between the two?

302.Author: Anonymous
302.Review: Great stuff!  My runner up is the 15 Year Single Barrel, but I have a bottle of the 17 Year Madeira to try next...

302.Author: Ben, Singapore
302.Review: Fruity and amazingly smooth, so easy to drink and so wonderful in taste and character. This is definitely one of my personal favourites!

302.Author: Anonymous
302.Review: Price/quality is best on this one. I usually drink 12 double wood, but I am tempted to change to this one as "weekly drinker" :)

302.Author: Pol
302.Review: So smooth... definitely my favourite whisky!

302.Author: mighty quaid
302.Review: one of the smoothest easiest to drink single malts i own, immensly enjoyble

302.Author: Anonymous
302.Review: best liquor i ever tasted

302.Author: Anonymous
302.Review: First I tried the 12 year old back in 1997 and did not like it, then the 15 year old and not even close (1999), finally the PortWood in 2000 ....and I felt in love!!!Now, I have to safe 700 USD to try the highest of all.Stay "in love" my friendsMEM

302.Author: Oliver
302.Review: I just had two glasses of this at the Dorchester, my new favourite whiskey by far!

302.Author: jb
302.Review: IWSC Best in Class, ISC Best in Show. Brilliant whisky.

302.Author: ron mccaffery
302.Review: Absolutly stunning.  Finish is supberb

302.Author: rwbenjey
302.Review: The finish on this stuff is awesome!

302.Author: Ben, Hong Kong
302.Review: One of my favourites.  Silky smooth with nice complex aromas.  One can never have too much of the Balvenie 21.

302.Author: Rob
302.Review: I agree Nectar, things afoot at the distillery? Buy it now

302.Author: Ted, Portland, Oregon
302.Review: Nectar of the gods!

2516.Author: Tim
2516.Review: I'm beginning to become a bigger and bigger fan of the Glenmorangie family and this one certainly did not disappoint!

2516.Author: BB
2516.Review: Holy wow! The tasting notes by the whisky exchange were spot on. The chocolate really shows in the nose and palate of this scotch, and i like it. A

2516.Author: Anonymous
2516.Review: A smooth Scotch with a memorable taste.

2516.Author: Anonymous
2516.Review: Best regularly made single malt on the market, superb!!

2516.Author: Anonymous
2516.Review: This is perfect craftmanship.  From front to back it is effortless and artful.  What a wonderful scotch.

2516.Author: Soapy
2516.Review: A fantastic dram,  chocolaty, rich, dark sugars, fruit, very very good and well worth the price, I did find to get the full impact and array of flavours you have to let it sit for about 10/15 mins before drinking, but oh my is it well worth the wait.

2516.Author: Anonymous
2516.Review: Brilliant, really smooth and balanced

2516.Author: Anonymous
2516.Review: Does not live up to the price tag!

2516.Author: Quangle
2516.Review: Amazing. One word to describe this masterpiece

2516.Author: Irene
2516.Review: I received this as a gift for my 65th birthday! It is wonderful.  It is so good it is scary. You could find yourself drinking this way to fast.

2516.Author: Lester Mc.
2516.Review: A chocoholic's delight, but unfortunately not mine.

2516.Author: Cole
2516.Review: Love yhis pour, I have purchased this several times and have never been dissapointed!

2516.Author: Amy M
2516.Review: I absolutely love this product!!!!!

2516.Author: Thomas
2516.Review:
3rd bottle now finished
awesome whisky just awesome

2516.Author: chesterfield Stuart
2516.Review: like drinking christmas pudding soaked through christmas cake !

2516.Author: Nicole
2516.Review: Had this at a tasting threes days ago and can''t stop thinking about it. It''s everything I like about stout but encapsulated in a whisky. Bittersweet, tastes like chocolate-covered raisins. Worth the price.

2516.Author: Trev
2516.Review: Bought this as a 40th birthday treat being a lover of whiskey  and I have to say it doesn''t live up to its price tag. I''ve tasted better 10 year old Malts.

2516.Author: Sir Robin
2516.Review: One of the best whiskeys i have ever tasted top 3 of my list.

2516.Author: ourrob hegarty
2516.Review: Fabulous

2516.Author: Andy Tickled
2516.Review: I have had two bottles of this, one in 2011, blown away by its mouth filling chocolate cereal, balance and punch. The second bottle was a real disappointment, had non of these qualities and was a little subdued, almost flat in flavour and alcohol.

2516.Author: Thomas Caldwell, Ph.D.
2516.Review: Excellent!  I enjoy the original .

2516.Author: M. Helminen
2516.Review: I found this disappointing considering the rave reviews it's gotten. A glass of this shared the table with a Glenfarclas 21, a Dailuaine 27 from Adelphi, Brora 2003 and Port Ellen 7th release, and the Signet couldn't beat any of them. A sort of a charred, coffe aroma-enrichened Glenmorangie but not particularly complex or rich. For this rather heavy price more value is easy to find.

2516.Author: Scotch Fan
2516.Review: Phenomenal dram from the Glenmorangie distillery. Whether Signet deserves its price tag argument being completely customer-dependent -thus, relative, this is the very dram which Glenmorangie has outdone itself, that's for sure! Fancy packaging is not to be criticized for the very same reason either, because a dram that is so unique and fabulous certainly deserves to be spoiled also in this regard. Well done, Glenmorangie.

2516.Author: Anonymous
2516.Review: La experiencia de un Signet se recuerda toda la vida. Es indudablemente una obra de arte de la casa Glenmorangie.

2516.Author: Stu
2516.Review:
The holy grail of whisky. Well behaved and full of chocolate,dark sugars and fruit and leaves a velvet covering on the tongue like chocolate does which no doubt is the combination of the rare high roast malt and single estate cadboll barley with a generous helping of the vast and precious wealth of knoll-age the sixteen men of Tain have.
Whisky this good usually commands much more money so in my eyes it's a steel at this price !.

2516.Author: blank
2516.Review: My friends and I hold whisky gatherings at least 3-4 times a year, one of our flock has a liking for glenmorangie and has presented us with a long line of relatively uninteresting commercial tasting specimens so I wasnt expecting much from the Signet but oh boy was I wrong, this has got to be in my top three malts ive tasted for many a bottle, far better than even the Old Pulteney 21 Mr Murray just awarded top swig of 2012 (a bottle we also had at the same sitting).

2516.Author: John : Fife
2516.Review: Got a bottle of this as a present today. I am not  whisky drinker but after reading the reviews I cannot wait to get home and pour a glass. Thankfully I am off work tomorrow.

2516.Author: HWD
2516.Review: To my mind a dram designed more for the Asian export markets, or for those new to drinking whisky. Far too sweet and chocolatey for my tastes. I opened a bottle with a few members of the SMWS with great fanfare, but sadly there was no interest in a second helpings.

2516.Author: Sean Petch
2516.Review: I have a glass of this in my hand as I write this, and although I think packaging which is undoubtedly beautiful has increased the price it is still a fantastic whisky! I'm waiting for my bottle of sonnalta px to compare as there's a good £40 in the price difference! All scepticism aside I'd buy this again, but everyone's palates are different so is a review really gospel to go by???

2516.Author: Finnegan
2516.Review: An undeniably good whisky, but I couldn't help feeling I was paying more for the sumptuous packaging. There are better GM's available at a more attractive price.

2516.Author: Mike S.
2516.Review: Last night at an engagement party I tasted Glenlivet 21, Glenfiddich 21, Johnny Walker blue label. All three together didn't compare to Glenmorangie Signet a taste of heaven! Smooth with fantastic taste and flavors . I've been dreaming about it all day!

2516.Author: Kishore Rajendran
2516.Review: One of the best i ever had,surely will buy more!

2516.Author: Mike
2516.Review: I also know more about whisky than James Saxon. This whisky is truly wonderful, and is equal to the finest Japanese malts. It is called a chocolate malt for good reason - it has a rich sweetness and is incredibly smooth, and is worth every penny

2516.Author: Anonymous
2516.Review: Last night i opened my 3cl sample bottle, i now wish i had bought the full size bottle. It was the best i have tried for a long time.

2516.Author: Whisky Giraffe
2516.Review: This is seriously one of the best whisky's I have tried to date. Amazing nose followed by this dark chocolate palate and as you keep drinking it more and more characteristics develop. I only share it with my good friends and then they only ever get a sip! So happy I bought this one!

2516.Author: Bowen
2516.Review: I have just returned from a tour of the glenmorangie distillery and having tasted this whiskey after the tour i must say... this is one of the best whiskeys i have ever tasted. Not too peated but enough that you can taste it, heavenly chocolate with a finish of caramel and burned toast. I would happily pay 3 times the amount of money this bottle costs and would expect to if i had tasted it without knowing the price.

2516.Author: Jorma Pulkkinen
2516.Review: I know more about Single Malts than James Saxon. I consider myself to be educated as far as whisky is concerned (I am the Chairman of our local whisky club). Therefore I have to say James Saxon is very wrong. Amazing chameleon character that goes from candy shop sweetness to salty highland bruiser to Ardmorish mainland peatness with water and 30 minutes in the glass.

2516.Author: dinis
2516.Review: maravilhosssssssoooooooooooo......

2516.Author: Graham
2516.Review: I'm new to this whisky lark but I can say this is a blinder.

2516.Author: stuart coyne
2516.Review: I have been very fortunate around whiskey. I have two family members who work at Glenmorangie and have tasted 80 year old and 100 year old when Ive had 2 private tours of the distillery and the 2 people bickering over there views should taste what i have. This whiskey is not close but not to far from an 80 year old. enjoy its a bargain!

2516.Author: Daniel Harwood (a whisky collector)
2516.Review: HEAVEN IN A GLASS !!! one of the best i have tried, the chocolate really comes through and it leaves a wonderful aftertaste. In my humble opinion (unlike the posting above - he who apparently knows everything and considers himself educated) this is far better than the 25 year old - for half the price !! Have a try, you won't regret it !

2516.Author: James Saxon
2516.Review: I know more about Single Malts than the normal whisky drinker. I consider myself to be educated as far as whisky is concerned. Therefore I have to say the above posters are very wrong - this is an overpriced and very poor offering!

2516.Author: GABS
2516.Review: Absolutely phenomenal, a real treat and well worth the price which is pretty steep (you find out why once you have tasted it!!Just one query mind you, why the lack of publicity and marketing which one would expect with such quality stuff???Anyhow inhale deeply and swirl it round the mouth and let the aromas and taste carry you far far away..........!

2516.Author: MSR
2516.Review: Delicioso sabor a aceite de chocolate. Impresionante!

2516.Author: paras
2516.Review: excellent taste....one of the best in recent times!

2516.Author: HighschoolTeacher
2516.Review: Like everything best goes today to the wealthy New Russians :(((O tempora, o mores!!!

2516.Author: Gleb Batalin
2516.Review: Fantastic complex taste, tremendous nose - one of the best choice!

7317.Author: Anonymous
7317.Review: Out of 15 different aged single malts, this is the best. Smooth and rich. Full of taste.

7317.Author: charis
7317.Review: amazing,smooth.one of the best!!

7317.Author: Jeff Alaska
7317.Review: I've tried several superior Single Malts and this is my favorite. A sweet finish with a bit of citrus.

7317.Author: Jerrod Texas
7317.Review: Wonderful!

7317.Author: David
7317.Review: Very smooth, almost caramel with hints of orange. Well worth it.

7317.Author: Chris
7317.Review: Lovely flavor very smooth truly a masterpiece

7317.Author: Ivor Moore
7317.Review: Excellent flavors

7317.Author: Michael Smart
7317.Review: Possibly the best under ?200 whisky Iv had so hey I went and bought another it's rude not to

7317.Author: Stargazer
7317.Review: Exceptional relaxation libation. Mood altering emanates from the palate.

7317.Author: Anonymous
7317.Review: Sophisticated Elegance in a glass

7317.Author: Kevin
7317.Review:
It is more than 30yrs since I bought a bottle of Highland or Speyside whisky, although I have tasted many.
I tasted KA III and bought a bottle. 
As someone who is not favourable towards Sherried, or Port whiskies etc I found that the tannic quality of the Cab Sav balanced the sweeter casks. 
This is a masterpiece of blending. Two or three casks blended with a spirit must be difficult enough but to do, but to blend six and yet maintain the character of the foundation spirit and create such balance is truly to be commended.

7317.Author: George T
7317.Review: My favourite on that price range

7317.Author: English Immigrant (now Welsh)
7317.Review: Bought for my 50th, now 53 and just taken first glass, what an idiot I am. Why the wait? How many people do I know with bottles they never open because of cost. Delightful, smooth, beautiful toffee, chocolate, vanilla nose. Wish it left more of an aftertaste on the tongue, but this is mega critical. One of the best whiskeys I have ever experienced and I am not shrinking violet on the wee dram front. Recommend and enjoy

7317.Author: Flying Scotsman
7317.Review: I'v had many great Whisky's and this beats them all like singleton of 18 glen ord. glenmorangie 18. all the johnnie walker labels and the green is the best in my opinion. hibiki japanese whisky and many others this is the perfect whisky for my taste sweet and smooth it's a new whisky every time I drink it. It is an amazing piece of art and will continue to buy

7317.Author: armen
7317.Review: OUT STANDING!

7317.Author: Gar
7317.Review: Clear Toffee nose, and incomparable taste, rick, fruity and prestige mouth warming taste.. this is real whisky for a good price. Love it and would drink it on daily bases. Real gentleman''s choice

7317.Author: Jeff Stewart. ..Qualicum Beach B.C. Canada
7317.Review: I enjoy very much the taste of the almond and  I can taste hints of raspberry and the cinnamon. ..the aging process is crazy good...aged in 6 different casks which gives this great tasting whiskey it''s great flavor and smoothness. ..I love it

7317.Author: JJ
7317.Review: Malty cereal and barley presence. Sour young oranges, burnt citrus peel. Medium body with oak flavor. No spice. Slight dryness, slight cocoa. Good dram for Dalmore. I like the 18yr still.

7317.Author: Cs
7317.Review:
I''m dalmore king Alexander fan, I have 23 bottle of king Alexander, and i have open 5 bottle . This is the best whiskey I have tried and the special whiskey, worth to buy and keep. 
Taste, you try it, then you will find it is so special. 
I gotna tell  A secret of this bottle is,  once the moment you open the bottle,  abt 2-3 feet far you still able to smell the aroma, so please take note when u going to open this Gem. If in Aircon room then it will be more obvious. 
You hardly can found this when u open others''..

7317.Author: Mac
7317.Review:
Incredible whiskey. And I've tasted my fair share (macallan,talisker etc) 
 Fruity, winter berries, spice. With elements of liqueur. Very complex. Very smooth.
Highly recommended.

7317.Author: Scotch Fan
7317.Review: As I loved this dram and agree that it is indeed a remarkable feat of blending, 40% ABV bottling is heart-breaking since it has obviously brought down the much greater potential of this otherwise great dram. It should have been bottled at a relatively higher strength as in the example of Dalmore's Clan Mackenzie series. I'd rather spend my £120.00 on a dram that is unadulterated. Still 90/100, which I presume could have been as high as 93 points otherwise.

7317.Author: Anonymous
7317.Review: This was my whisky of choice for my wedding.  Tremendous.  Every sip results in one of those noises of appreciation.  ooooohhhhh lovely.

7317.Author: JJF
7317.Review: superB and smooth

7317.Author: Steve R
7317.Review: Great news! I'm just about to buy one for a friend's special birthday. I'm sure he'll share some with me :) I love giving presents like that!

7317.Author: Nick
7317.Review: Absolutely superb with a smoky but not overpowering flavour. It's also incredibly smooth and has no bite which makes in very pleasant to drink. Lovely.

7317.Author: Billy M
7317.Review: I recently purchased my second bottle from TWE, bought on the reviews here and have yet to open either. I hoping they are worth the wait. They certainly look the business

7317.Author: Juan M Prieto- Miami
7317.Review: Excellent Whiskey, Simply the Best I've drunk so far !!...worth the Money !

7317.Author: Pav
7317.Review: Very sherried and little peat.  If you like them smooth and easy to drink this is very good.  Not a patch on Glenlivet XXV though!

7317.Author: Steve Rainbow
7317.Review: I just bought one of these because i'm very much a Dalmore fan. Reading these reviews makes me even more excited.I also second the above comment - Richard Paterson is indeed a genius.

7317.Author: Jonhedin H. Trondheim
7317.Review: Absolutely one of the best whiskey I have ever tasted. My daughter bought a bottle for me at the Edinburg Airport (God bless her) She knows I love whiskey, but this one just hit the bullet.Thank God she's studying at the Stirling Uni and is a frequent traveler.

7317.Author: Juan M prieto
7317.Review: I bought a bottle couple of years a go... never opened.Now with all this good comments, I think I'm gone taste it .

7317.Author: Ari Papadopoulos
7317.Review: A truly magnificent whisky. Elegant and exceptionally smooth. Worth the money!!

7317.Author: John M Cooper
7317.Review: Am about to open my third bottle! this is simply superb. Seductively easy to drink, even neat, a true leader of the pack John M Cooper

7317.Author: karl
7317.Review: a truly sumptuos and exquisite whisky if ive ever had one. as smooth and as complex as you would like your malt to be, with a nose to die for. epic stuff.

7317.Author: James Saxon
7317.Review: I tried this at the Scotch Whisky Experience in Edinburgh, and as experiences go it was a definitive one. I had no idea whisky could taste like this: a wild fruit farm of berries rolling over dark rich peatiness and biscuity maltiness. The neat nose was pure love. If I had more money I would buy this in a heart beat. As it is I'm quite content to settle for the new 15YO. Richard Paterson, you're a genius.

9910.Author: Patrick  P.  Cosgrove
9910.Review: A superb Scotch--beyond description, in fact.  This Highlander has been half in love with this peaty,  comfortable, warm and wonderful drink for forty years.

9910.Author: Henry
9910.Review: I bought a case of this fine drop a while ago without knowing they'd be discontinued by the end of 2016!

9910.Author: Channing Davidson
9910.Review: According to Wikipedia, the Laphroaig 18 Year Old was discontinued in late 2015..  I love the 18 so I purchased 4 bottles.

9910.Author: Kenny E from Mississippi
9910.Review: This is my first time trying an Islay... and I''m a fairly new Scotch drinker . Though I''ve been drinking whiskey most of my 54 years.  WOW!   Peaty...and very smokey.  I don''t mean that in a bad way..but am I the only one getting  good, smoked sardines?   And I love sardines but the smoke and peat just bring that to mind.  With a wonderful intense toffee sweetness that follows across the tongue and a very smooth finish.  This is drinking it neat.  I intend to make my second tasting over a little ice to see how it opens.  Overall I am very happy with it and enjoying the complexity.

9910.Author: JJ
9910.Review: Great Peat Smell, subtle smoke, wonderful maritime salinity provided by liquorice, oak chips. Seaweed and sesame followed by sweet mint. I simply adore this dram from Islay and became a staple bottle on my shelf. Passes with flying colors. Add water and taste how sweet it is. Then add an ice cube and taste how sweeter it gets. Simply Wonderful.

9910.Author: Glen from Minnesota
9910.Review: I have been enjoying my single malt scotch for some time now. It became time to restock my scotch and where I buy it were giving free samples of 18 yr. Wow it hit my taste buds like a long lost friend. The taste of hot tar, with licorice with a slight taste of smoke. I stood there not knowing what to say, but I added it to my other scotches I was buying. I now have a dram of it now and then to give me a fine break from my other scotch I enjoy. Yet I see it goes a little faster than I want. So that means I have to go out and buy some more. But this time I am buying more than one bottle of it. Cheers everyone

9910.Author: Toronto Tim (Canada)
9910.Review: Save the 18 for relatively special occasions, affordable daily dram should be - by default - Laphroaig-QC (Quarter Cask) for its "kick" ... Cheers !

9910.Author: Scotch Fan
9910.Review: Nose: Sweet BBQ, toffee, fresh moss, liquorice, absinthe, fennel, coal tar and some TCP. Palate: Big, powerful, needs some water to open up. Sugar notes, peppermint and savory malt flavors that mimic salty bacon start to develop with water. Relatively fresh peat smoke. Sherry-sweet influenced. This dram is still young and the balance is not great. Far from perfection and needs a couple more years to develop.

9910.Author: Anonymous
9910.Review: Wow. This is beautiful.

9910.Author: Anonymous
9910.Review: It's just beautiful. The best Laphroaig!

9910.Author: Kevin H
9910.Review: I have been drinking this bottle since Christmas and it is a good one.  Typical Laphroaig tarry rope and pungent smoke, some days there is a bit of smoked fish too but not always. Rich and complex flavour with a rounded, malty sophistcation that comes with age.  Powerful but mellow finish with lingering pepper. Dry and a bit more oak compared to younger expressions.

9910.Author: Anonymous
9910.Review: its heavenly nothing more i would say.....uuummmmmmaaahhhhhh

9910.Author: yoav
9910.Review: Just finished half a bottle with my friends last night. Smokey and smooth, always leaving a need for 1 more round. Outstanding whisky. What a desert!

9910.Author: Anonymous
9910.Review: It's awesome when you can get an 18 Year for the 15 Year price : )  This stuff is basically a more powerful version of the 15 Year.  Complex and masterful.

9910.Author: Mikko
9910.Review: Considerably sweeter than any Ardbeg or any Islay malt. I have never liked Laphroaig because of that sweet tar, but this is decent.

9910.Author: VM
9910.Review: An excellent mature Islay single malt with class and character. Back when I got the FoL email telling that my old favorite 15yo was going to be replaced by this I got a bit worried - could the 18yo live up to the standard? Fortunately, it did even more than that: Laphroaig 18yo is spicier and peatier with a tad stronger finish. Not quite as mellow as its predecessor, so needs a bit more time to get used to, but still very drinkable especially with a few drops of water. 9 out of 10.

9910.Author: Lawrence Edwards
9910.Review: James Saxon you do talk some rubbish at times. There is certainly NOT a 'seaweedy and dry oaty maltiness' about this refined beauty.

9910.Author: Anonymous
9910.Review: One of the best at this price. Smooth and peaty, with a mellow finish. Worth the wait.

9910.Author: Vegas Alex
9910.Review: Great stuff. The most fitting words are luxurious and refined. It has all the expected Laphroaig flavors with no rough or overbearing traits. I love their Quarter Cask as well but this is definitely a couple levels above that. I wish I could make a direct comparison to the 15 yr but I haven't had that in a while.

9910.Author: Inoue Kosei
9910.Review: not quite reaching the same height as Laphroaig 15

9910.Author: James Saxon
9910.Review: Deserving of all its high praise. I had to take this one seriously, having found the extremes of the standard 10's character a little overbearing. The extra maturation has allowed for a deeper, more mellow and balanced presentation of the classic peaty, seaweedy and dry oaty maltiness of this unique distillery.

4085.Author: S. Edwards
4085.Review: Felt like a child at Christmas opening my sole remaining bottle.  Treat yourself to this gem, you've earned it.

4085.Author: John Hudson
4085.Review: stunning

4085.Author: Anonymous
4085.Review: This right here is the best Speyside whisky I have ever tried!

4085.Author: Debbie
4085.Review: Absolutely exquisite and very glad I brought in bulk some time ago!!!

4085.Author: jim corbett
4085.Review: Lovely! Really glad I bought a few bottles when it was cheaper. I am no expert, but I know when something is delicious, and this is.

4085.Author: O.A.H.
4085.Review: Shockingly good. Fully justifies the current price (versus the absolute bargain it was at in early 2014 when I first tried it). Loads of character.

4085.Author: Anonymous
4085.Review: My favorite hands down. Exceptional.

4085.Author: Frank
4085.Review: Our favorite single malt. This is the best.

4085.Author: Egor
4085.Review: Amazing. Or how to say it more politely. ******* amazing. I''m still sipping drop after drop. Sometimes adding a drop of cold ice water. Sometimes snacking a balcsanic sweet. I think this is the most beautiful whisky I ever tasted or at least in this range.

4085.Author: Anonymous
4085.Review: excellent malt from Mortlach, lucky who has  some of them in collection

4085.Author: Ruchira
4085.Review: A spectacular single malt. Had me weak at the knees at first sip. Had to go searching for it and glad the Whisky exchange had a few bottles left! Have stocked up! My tastebuds thank you Mortlach.

4085.Author: Bret
4085.Review: This is one of my favorite. Opened it up with a buddy of mine and before you know it we were half way through. Its sweet and smooth, and has a dried fruit taste with a mild oak finish.

4085.Author: Charles Drake
4085.Review:
Amazing. Sandy at the "Taste of Speyside" restaurant turned me onto this on my honeymoon. Upset that they are changing it.

A must have

4085.Author: keith
4085.Review: Great bottle at a great price will  miss it.

4085.Author: Anonymous
4085.Review: Had a sample of this last night and wow just wow ) am speechless. This is a *truly* outstanding single malt. Only wish I had obtained a bottle when it was more affordable :( but when my next horse comes in this is on the wish list! :)

4085.Author: E S
4085.Review:
A really delicious whisky. I've had my 2 bottles now though so I'm going to have to go searching for another supplier.

Don't miss out on this one.

4085.Author: Stewart
4085.Review: Stocks must be getting really low as most retailers now have a limit of one or two bottles when attempting to order. Time to fill up the cupboards of one's favourite tipple!

4085.Author: Anonymous
4085.Review: By far the best of the F&F range.

4085.Author: Szarik
4085.Review: Another great whisky from flora & fauna range,but still prefer  Benrinnes 15yo to this.

4085.Author: Anonymous
4085.Review: My favourite ...

4085.Author: Waymol
4085.Review: Certainly different from other single malts I've tried I found it very sweet with traces of Maple syrup!!!!

4085.Author: Anonymous
4085.Review: Very nice in taste! And the best service to Finland! Only few days and I was able to enjoy!

4085.Author: Anonymous
4085.Review: My friend brought it from Scotland. I like it a lot! Deep color, smooth.

4085.Author: Peter
4085.Review: Mortlach whisky - amazing. I'm glad that I have been able to experience this great malt. Has a bit of everything for everyone.

4085.Author: Anonymous
4085.Review: Love this whiskey. We camped right next to the distillery while in Dufftown. This is the foundation malt in Johnny Walker Blue Label. To bad I can hardly find it in Boston.

4085.Author: Rob
4085.Review: Loved this actually made the glenfiddich bottles i got seem a bit too sickly sweet. Plus for 40 quid absolute bargain.

4085.Author: dasir
4085.Review: this one is awesome, gentle, smooth and rather sweet. go this from this site few days ago and almost half a bottle is gone already. beautiful!

4085.Author: Debbie
4085.Review: I discovered this wonderful gem at the Scotch Whiskey Experience in Edinburgh. Fabulous scotch and it now has a dedicated fan in Australia - not for sharing either ;-)

4085.Author: Anonymous
4085.Review: Can only concur with most of the previous posts, a true hidden gem of a whisky, wonderfully balanced, smooth sherried nectar.

4085.Author: kf - glasgow
4085.Review: Bartenders go all a-fankle when women ask for Mortlach as they believe that the fairer sex should have watered down versions of whisky.  So to all whisky drinking female executives out there -- this is the dram for you!

4085.Author: Anonymous
4085.Review: A great Speyside whisky.  It stands apart as better than most from the area and a real bargain for the price.  I agree, it suffers from sever underexposure.

4085.Author: Dirk
4085.Review: One of my every day favourites. I hope they won't stop bottling this one like so many of that wonderful Flora

4085.Author: James Saxon
4085.Review: Give it a bit of time and attention and this is a very rewarding whisky. I'm particularly charmed by the peat smoke note, most evident and cohesive with water, and which is so different to that found in island malts. Unique and lovely.

4085.Author: Mark Connelly
4085.Review: A classic dram. One you MUST have in the cupboard.

4085.Author: Joe
4085.Review: I recieved a bottle of this wonderful malt for my 50th birthday and what abirthday present it proved to be.  I agree with Alexx, this is one of my top spirits.  This is so good I would only share it with favoured friends.

4085.Author: Anonymous
4085.Review: The untameable beast of speyside manages to muscle its way through the sherry tones and retain its potency. Knows where its going and wont leave you lagging behind. Braw.

4085.Author: Michael
4085.Review: My favourite everyday dram - do not stop bottling this one..!!!

4085.Author: dougie b
4085.Review: wonderful nose,deep colour,amazing fruity and sherried tones.

4085.Author: Jimbo
4085.Review: I think the above poster must have tried a faulty bottle.  Mortlach is a wonderful spirit, and to say it has no flavour is laughable.  Delicious, spicy, rich, sherried - Mortlach is everything one could hope for in a Speyside.  I repeat, the above poster has either a faulty bottle  - or faulty tastebuds.

4085.Author: Anonymous
4085.Review: Horrendous bottle, no flavor. It's gasoline best served over a mountain of ice, don't even try it neat, which it needed to be for that price.

4085.Author: alexx
4085.Review: this has got to be one of my top five spirits of all time! A true work of craftsmanship and incredible balance and richness all at once.

4085.Author: David
4085.Review:
Amazing.
Best ever, and please no wider recognition, more for me.

9389.Author: Anonymous
9389.Review: Among the best of the best

9389.Author: Geffy
9389.Review: very very nice

9389.Author: Judy Manalastas
9389.Review: Smooth...with sweetness in the pallette after it gies fown.  No burn.  Love it.

9389.Author: Frank
9389.Review: Extremely smooth whisky I discovered by chance.  One of the best ones i''ve had. Always keep a bottle around.

9389.Author: Nathan Churchill
9389.Review: My favorite  single malt.  Enjoy a dram.

9389.Author: Anonymous
9389.Review: My favourite of many single malts I have tried this is my favourite, keep up the great work Scapa.

9389.Author: Anonymous
9389.Review: excellent

9389.Author: Anonymous
9389.Review: Excellent

9389.Author: Andy McPhee
9389.Review: One of the smoothest and tastiest whiskys ever in my opinion. Definate top 3 quality. Beautiful sweet honey aftertaste. One Big lovely glass before bed. Hard to beat.....Incredibly hard.

9389.Author: Highlander
9389.Review: Very nice indeed.  A distinct honey sweetness with very little peat. At 80 proof there is no burn.  A splash of water opens it up and makes it even smoother.

9389.Author: Rick.
9389.Review:
I can''t fault the tasting note by Stuart P.
Smooth, fresh, & incredibly moreish.

9389.Author: Ralph
9389.Review: The Scapa 16 is one of my three favorite single malts. Along with any Highland Park and my personal favorite Lagavulin 16, this Scotch offers a beautiful alternative to the Islay scotches and a wonderful compliment to its Orkney sibling.

9389.Author: Adnan
9389.Review: My favourit

9389.Author: George
9389.Review: One of my favourites! and the best price I've found!

9389.Author: Adam
9389.Review:
I normally only buy Speyside single malts, but on a whim decided to try this and so glad I did! For my tastes the Scapa is the nicest whiskey I've had. Deliciously warming and smooth straight up...but let a couple of large ice cubes melt for 5 mins & it develops a honey sweetness that is a Speyside lovers dream!
Well worth it at the present reduced price as well.

9389.Author: Alex
9389.Review: I am a fan of this slightly off the beaten track whisky. Fairly subtle flavours to enjoy on a relaxed evening.

9389.Author: Anonymous
9389.Review: You do read a lot of tosh!  This is a great, balanced malt which I'm keen does not get better known.  Heather, honey and finesse,  not a slug of peat to complicate things.  If you prefer heavily peated malts, there are plenty about.  This one is about balance, and very much to my palate.  Great stuff.

9389.Author: Anonymous
9389.Review: Definitely my favourite single malt, I tried it in a Heathrow airport test in 94 and since then my beloved one.

9389.Author: small man
9389.Review: A lovely easy drinking whisky. Ideal for those who find peat, smoke and a burning throat things to avoid. I would call it a beginners whisky, but for me - the best.

9389.Author: Eugen
9389.Review: A great whisky that goes very well with fish or fish soup - just in case you intend to compose a whisky menu like my wife and me did recently.

9389.Author: CRC aka BigFatJock
9389.Review: Nice smooth whisky. No burning in the mouth nor the throat. Just a lovely warmth in the belly. A hint of smoke mind you it's just a hint .
